elements.description:
### Usage
    <px-vis-chart-navigator
        id="navigator"
        x-axis-type="time"
        y-axis-type="linear"
        width="[[width]]"
        height="100"
        margin="[[marginNav]]"
        default-series-config="[[defaultSeriesConfig]]"
        series-config="[[seriesConfig]]"
        include-all-series="[[includeAllSeries]]"
        chart-data="[[chartData]]"
        nav-series-limit="[[navSeriesLimit]]"
        chart-domain-x="[[chartDomainX]]"
        chart-domain-y="[[chartDomainY]]"
        disable-empty-render
        selected-domain="{{selectedDomain}}">
    </px-vis-chart-navigator>

### Styling
The following custom properties are available for styling:

Custom property | Description
:----------------|:-------------
  `--px-vis-nav-brush-outline-color` | The stroke (border) color for the brushed box
  `--px-vis-nav-brush-fill-color` | The fill (background) color for the brushed box
  `--px-vis-nav-brush-opacity` | The opacity of the brushed box
  `--px-vis-nav-brush-gradient-fill-color` | The fill (background) color for the brushed box when gradientColors is not defined
  `--px-vis-nav-brush-handle-fill-color` | The fill (background) color for the handles on the brushed box
  `--px-vis-nav-brush-handle-lines-color` | The stroke (border) color for the handles on the brushed box
  `--px-vis-nav-brush-handle-fill-color-hover` | The hover state fill (background) color for the handles on the brushed box
  `--px-vis-nav-brush-handle-lines-color-hover` | The hover state stroke (border) color for the handles on the brushed box
  `--px-vis-nav-brush-handle-fill-color-press` | The pressed/mousedown state fill (background) color for the handles on the brushed box
  `--px-vis-nav-brush-handle-lines-color-press` | The pressed/mousedown state stroke (border) color for the handles on the brushed box
  |
  |
  |
  `--px-vis-series-color-0` | These are the colors used to represent the data series on the charts. Used in numerical order by default. Colors MUST start at 0 and cannot contain gaps between numbers.
  `--px-vis-series-color-1` |
  `--px-vis-series-color-2` |
  `--px-vis-series-color-n` |

properties.name: width
properties.description: The width of the elem; generally the width of the charting area for most components

properties.name: height
properties.description: The height of the component; generally the height of the charting area for most components.

properties.name: _defaultMargin
properties.description: Copy of the default margin for checking if it has changed

properties.name: margin
properties.description: Defines the base margin for the chart. Calcs are run to add to the margin to accommodate axes and other elements which exist within the SVG frame, but outside the chart frame.

properties.name: offset
properties.description: An optional offset for a variety of elements

properties.name: x
properties.description:
x is a holder for the d3 instantiated scale object
Must be set in the svg component and passed to all components so they know the drawing scale.
This can be set declaratively

See: https://github.com/d3/d3/blob/master/API.md#scales-d3-scale

properties.name: y
properties.description:
y is a holder for the d3 instantiated scale object
Must be set in the svg component and passed to all components so they know the drawing scale.
This can be set declaratively

See: https://github.com/d3/d3/blob/master/API.md#scales-d3-scale

properties.name: chartData
properties.description:
container for the data object that drives the chart / component
Generally loaded with an iron-ajax tag (but doesnt have to be)
This can be set declaratively

properties.name: selectedDomain
properties.description:
New chart extents selected by the user

Serves as a trigger for the scale component to redefine the chart extents

properties.name: xAxisType
properties.description:
Sets the type of data for the x values

Valid entries are:
- `ordinal`: for discrete input domains, such as names or categories.
- `scaleBand`: another ordinal type meant to create a bar instead of a point.
- `time`: for time domains.
- `timeLocal`: for local time domains.
- `linear`: for continuous input domains, such as numbers.
- `log`: for continuous input domains displayed logarithmicly. NOTE: Per d3 docs, this scale cannot cross or include 0.
- `pie`: for pie/donut charts

properties.name: yAxisType
properties.description:
Sets the type of data for the y values

Valid entries are:
- `ordinal`: for discrete input domains, such as names or categories.
- `scaleBand`: another ordinal type meant to create a bar instead of a point.
- `linear`: for continuous input domains, such as numbers.
- `log`: for continuous input domains, such as numbers.
- `pie`: for pie/donut charts

properties.name: completeSeriesConfig
properties.description: A configuration file generated by the chart behavior based on seriesConfig and defaultSeriesConfig.

properties.name: chartExtents
properties.description:
Developer set chart extents for the chart. The chart will draw to whatever values are specified in the chartExtents.
```
 {
     "x": [0,100],
     "y": [5,50],
 }
```

To force the chart to calculate based on data, use "dynamic".
```
 {
     "x": [0,"dynamic"],
     "y": [-10,"dynamic"],
 }
```

properties.name: dataExtents
domainChanged
properties.description:
Number which increments up when the domain(s) has(have) changed.

0 (false) indicates that domains have not been set.

Serves as a trigger for many elements to redraw.

properties.name: preventWebWorkerSynchronization
properties.description:
Prevents the chart from synchronizing its data with a webworker.
This can be turned on to minimize the memory footprint of the
chart
WARNING: turning the synchronization off will:
- prevent the chart from being able to use crosshair feature
- slow down data search for tooltip/register
- slow down calculating extents for the chart if it needs to

We advise against turning it off but it might be beneficial in
specific scenarios (high number of small charts with minimum
interaction for example)

properties.name: mutedSeries
properties.description:
A list of user selected muted series. Tied declaratively to series components

The series name is the key and the value is a boolean for whether it is muted or not:

```
{
    'seriesId1':true,
    'seriesId2':false,
 }
```

In this example, seriesId1 is muted. seriesId2 was muted, but has been turned back on.

properties.name: hardMute
properties.description:
Allows for a "hard" muting of the series/categories: the
series/category won't show up
in the tooltip anymore, it's tooltip data won't be shown in the register
and its extents won't be taken into account by the chart

properties.name: _extents
properties.description: Holder for chart extents from the seriesConfig object

properties.name: _chartDataHasChanged
properties.description: Boolean to detect if the chart data has changed

properties.name: _calculatingDomain
properties.description: Boolean to indicate if we are currently calculating the domain

properties.name: _defaultScaleValue
properties.description:
default extents to use if none are specified

0 for y axis for best practice

properties.name: disableDynamicUpdate
properties.description: Defines if the viewable chart extents should update when chartData is updated

properties.name: chartId
properties.description: Internal unique ID

properties.name: scalePadding
properties.description:
The padding for ordinal type scales - effective controls the spacing between ordinal groups

Expressed as a percent of the ordinal group width, so a value of 0.5 for a bar chart means your bar and the gap between bars are the same size

properties.name: paddingOuter
properties.description:
The outer padding for ordinal type scales - effective controls the spacing between the first and last ordinal group the the axes

Expressed as a percent of the ordinal group width, so a value of 0.5 for a bar chart means your bar and the gap between bars are the same size

properties.name: logBase
properties.description: The base for logarithmic type scales

properties.name: truncationLength
properties.description:
Defines if the label should get truncated and to how many characters.

Default length is 10 characters, not including the ellipsis which gets inserted.

The length must be at least 2.

To disable truncation, set the value to -1

properties.name: numberFormatCulture
properties.description:
Defines how a display number should be formatted:
Provide localization for currency formatting

For valid formats and features, see: http://numbrojs.com/languages.html
For docs on the component, see: https://www.predix-ui.com/#/components/px-number-formatter/

properties.name: numberFormatIsCurrency
properties.description:
Defines how a display number should be formatted:
Specify whether the value should be formatted as a currency

For valid formats and features, see: http://numbrojs.com/format.html
For docs on the component, see: https://www.predix-ui.com/#/components/px-number-formatter/

properties.name: numberFormatCurrency
properties.description:
Defines how a display number should be formatted:
Provide a new default format for currency

For valid formats and features, see: http://numbrojs.com/format.html
For docs on the component, see: https://www.predix-ui.com/#/components/px-number-formatter/

properties.name: numberFormatDefault
properties.description:
Defines how a display number should be formatted:
Provides a new default format

For valid formats and features, see: http://numbrojs.com/format.html
For docs on the component, see: https://www.predix-ui.com/#/components/px-number-formatter/

properties.name: numberFormat
properties.description:
Defines how a display number should be formatted:
The format used to generate the output

For valid formats and features, see: http://numbrojs.com/format.html
For docs on the component, see: https://www.predix-ui.com/#/components/px-number-formatter/

properties.name: numberFormatUnformat
properties.description:
Defines how a display number should be converted back to a Number:
A formatted String to extract a value from

For valid formats and features, see: http://numbrojs.com/format.html#unformat
For docs on the component, see: https://www.predix-ui.com/#/components/px-number-formatter/

properties.name: numberFormatZero
properties.description:
Defines how to display 0 values

For valid formats and features, see: http://numbrojs.com/format.html
For docs on the component, see: https://www.predix-ui.com/#/components/px-number-formatter/

properties.name: firstDateTimeFormat
properties.description:
Defines the format for the first datetime string. The first datetime is shown in normal font weight.

Default is the first datetime string is TIME presented as "15:00:00 +0000"

For valid string formats, see: http://momentjs.com/docs/#/displaying/

properties.name: secondDateTimeFormat
properties.description:
Defines the format for the second datetime string. The second datetime is shown in bold font weight.

Default is the second datetime string is DATE presented as "12 Feb 2016"

For valid string formats, see: http://momentjs.com/docs/#/displaying/

properties.name: separator
properties.description: Defines a separator character between the two datetime strings.

properties.name: timezone
properties.description:
Sets what timezone the event time should display in.

Timezone defaults to UTC time. If a valid timezone is specified, then times include daylight savings time if applicable.

For a list of valid timezones, see: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_tz_database_time_zones

For more details on timezones, see: http://momentjs.com/timezone/

properties.name: svg
properties.description:
svg is a holder for the d3 instantiated svg container to draw to.
Must be set in ready and passed to all components so they know whom to draw to.

properties.name: _uniqueIdsUsed
properties.description:
Array of unique IDs generated for this comp. cleaned from global
store on detached

properties.name: pxSvgElem
properties.description: The SVG element inside the chart - not a D3 selected element.

properties.name: orientation
properties.description:
Defines which side the axis should be on.
 - 'left'
 - 'right'
 - 'bottom'
 - 'top'

properties.name: axis
properties.description:
axis is a general holder for the d3 instantiated scale object
Can pass any type of instantiated scale object, IE pass in either your x or your y depending which this axis is for.
This can be set declaratively

See: https://github.com/d3/d3/blob/master/API.md#scales-d3-axis

properties.name: canvasContext
properties.description:
canvasContext is a holder for the instantiated canvas context to draw to.
Must be set in ready and passed to all components so they know whom to draw to.

properties.name: canvasLayers
properties.description: An array of the generated layers

properties.name: _isAttached
properties.description: Boolean tracking if we are attached

properties.name: renderToCanvas
properties.description: Boolean to specify if drawings should render to canvas instead of svg

properties.name: seriesColorList
properties.description: Defines an colors in order that will be used for series.

properties.name: seriesConfig
properties.description:
A configuration file to associate series order, name, type, and colors.

Association of name, type, and seriesNumber should be developer set. Color and axis are optional.

```
 {
    "seriesKey": {  //seriesKey is a unique identifier for the configuration
        "type": "line",  //line or scatter or both
        "priority": 0, //relative priority is used to decide which series draw on top of each other. priority 0 => smaller priority. 2 draws over 1, which itself draws over 0, etc.. CANVAS ONLY
        "markerSymbol": "diamond" //if using scatter different markerSymbol can be used. See "markerSymbol" in px-vis-scatter
        "markerSize": "64" //if using scatter allows to change the size of markers
        "markerScale": "2" //if using scatter allows to scale the size of markers
        "markerFillOpacity": "0.5" //if using scatter allows to specify the opacity of the inside of the marker
        "markerStrokeOpacity": "1" //if using scatter allows to specify the opacity of the outside of the marker
        "strokeWidth": "1" //if using line, allows you to specify the thickness of the line
        "mutedOpacity": "0.3" //opacity value to use when muting a serie
        "name": "My Series",  //human readable name
        "x": "x",  //index or key name for independent variable
        "y": "y",  //index or key name for dependent variable
        "xAxisUnit": "Volt" //Unit to be used for the X axis. Can be ignored if x axis is time based
        "yAxisUnit": "Oranges" //unit to be used for the Y axis.
        "xMin": 0,  // minimum x value
        "xMax": 100,  //maximum x value
        "yMin": 5,  //minimum y value
        "yMax": 50,  //maximum y value
        "hideInRegister": true, //dont show in the register
        "color": "rgb(0,0,0)", //color you want for the series
        "negativeColor": "rgb(255,255,255)", //color you want negative values of the series to be (not all charts)
        "interpolationFunction": Px.d3.curveBasis, //The line interpretor you want to use. See property 'interpolationFunction'
        "axis": {
            "id": "AXIS_ID"   //a unique identifier
            "side": "left"    //the side that you want the axis to draw on, `left` or `right`
            "number": 1       //the order of the axis on each side
         }
    }
 }
```

properties.name: _defaultSeriesConfig
defaultSeriesConfig
properties.description: Overwrites to the default configuration file. The defaultSeriesConfig is used to fill in the missing parts of seriesConfig. Any option from seriesConfig can be specified in the defaultSeriesConfig and will be automatically used if not defined in the seriesConfig

properties.name: includeAllSeries
properties.description:
A boolean flag on whether to include all the series in the data.
- `false`: only series defined in the seriesConfig file will be drawn
- `true`: All series in the dataset will be drawn. Defaults will be used for the seriesConfig. If this is used do not specify a seriesConfig

properties.name: _seriesKeys
properties.description:
Representes the keys avaiable in completeSeriesConfig. It's being set
 before completeSeriesConfig is set

properties.name: _parentResizable
properties.description: The closest ancestor element that implements `IronResizableBehavior`.

properties.name: _notifyingDescendant
properties.description:
True if this element is currently notifying its descendant elements of
resize.

properties.name: preventResize
properties.description: Prevents the chart from automatically resizing to fit its container

properties.name: chartHorizontalAlignment
properties.description:
This allows to decide how the chart
drawing will be horizontally aligned when smaller than its container. Values:
- center
- left
- right

if any other value is used then left alignment will be chosen

properties.name: chartVerticalAlignment
properties.description:
This allows to decide how the chart
drawing will be vertically aligned when smaller than its container. Values:
- center
- top
- bottom

if any other value is used then top alignment will be chosen

properties.name: _chartWrapperClass
properties.description: Class to be used on the external wrapper within the chart

properties.name: debounceResizeTiming
properties.description:
Timing (in ms) to be used for iron resize when the chart auto size
(preventResize = false)

properties.name: tooltipConfig
properties.description:
Configuration object used to customize the tooltip cosmetic properties.
Please refer to px-vis-tooltip and px-vis-register (https://github.com/PredixDev/px-vis) for a list of supported properties
Most interesting properties include:
- width
- height
- tooltipStyle
- forceDateTimeDisplay

properties.name: registerConfig
properties.description:
Configuration object used to customize the register cosmetic properties.
Please refer to px-vis-register (https://github.com/PredixDev/px-vis) for a list of supported properties

properties.name: xAxisConfig
properties.description:
Configuration object used to customize the X axis cosmetic properties.
Please refer to px-vis-axis (https://github.com/PredixDev/px-vis) for a list of supported properties

properties.name: yAxisConfig
properties.description:
Configuration object used to customize the Y axis cosmetic properties.
Please refer to px-vis-axis (https://github.com/PredixDev/px-vis) for a list of supported properties

properties.name: layer
properties.description: Array of the svg layers

properties.name: wwDataSyncCounter
properties.description:
Updated every time the chart gets new data and a sync request
to the web worker happened. Use it for triggering observers
instead of chartData if the observer needs the data in the webworker
(i.e kicking another webworker processing)

properties.name: _wwSyncDataDeletionTimeout
properties.description:
After detaching the chart time after which we will delete
the synced data of the chart from the webworker. If the
chart is re-attached in the meantime the deletion will
be canceled to avoid a re-sync

properties.name: _wwSyncDataPropName
properties.description:
Name of the property to be kept in sync. Usually chartData but can
be overriden for a filtered dataset instead for example

properties.name: clipPath
properties.description: Holder for a clipping path ID

properties.name: seriesClipPath
properties.description: A more restricting clip path used to limit where the series are being drawn

properties.name: preventInitialDrawing
properties.description: blocks initial drawings of axis until set to false

properties.name: drawDebounceTime
properties.description: Debounce time to use for different types of rendering

properties.name: debounceOnPanning
properties.description:
Whether the drawings will be debounced on panning the chart.
When not debounced the redraw will happen more often on panning,
which should result in a smoother experience. However if rendering
a big number of points this can have the opposite effect since
it wil redraw too often comapred tot he time taken to re render everything

properties.name: _progressiveRenderingCounter
properties.description: Counter to track progressive rendering requests and only draw the latest one

properties.name: _canvasTargets
properties.description: Current registered targets to draw on canvas during rendering

properties.name: _svgTargets
properties.description: Current registered targets to draw on svg during rendering

properties.name: rendererMinimumPointsPerFrame
properties.description:
The minimum number of points to render per frame
even if the chart is laggy

properties.name: rendererFrameDurationTarget
properties.description:
Target duration (in ms) for one frame. The renderer will try to render
as much data as possible in that given timeframe before calling the next
animation frame.
WARNING: this needs to be higher than 16ms since by default
requestAnimationFrame will be called every ~16ms, so our target needs to
be higher to ensure we keep the processor busy

properties.name: rendererFrameCountToAverage
properties.description:
Number of previous frames to average for the adaptive
progressive rendering

properties.name: _previousFramesTiming
properties.description: For each renderer type the previous frames number of points and duration for line and scatter

properties.name: gradientColors
properties.description:
Colors used to create a gradient. Can be one of the folowing:
- A single color (string), resulting in that color being applied for the whole "gradient"
- An Array of colors from which a linear gradient while be created
- A custom function that defined a gradient. The function takes an input that will be between 0 and 1 and should return a color based on that input.
- A d3 chromatic scale, which is effectively a function as described above with predefined colors. Please see the "interpolate" functions at https://github.com/d3/d3-scale-chromatic

properties.name: navSeriesLimit
properties.description: Number of series to display on the navigator

properties.name: chartDomainX
properties.description: The parent chart's extents

properties.name: chartDomainY
properties.description: The parent chart's extents

methods.name: _processYValues
methods.description:
This functions process Y axis and applies the result to some variable.
If in single Y it just run the function and assign the result to `result`, if multi Y
it runs the function for each axis and stores the result against the axis key
on `result`

methods.name: _isValidData

methods.name: _isVarUndefined

When the domain gets set via a user interaction, set the scale function to use the new domain

https://github.com/mbostock/d3/wiki/API-Reference

methods.name: getPixelFromData
methods.description:
Gets pixel values for data values relating to a series (series is the id
used in seriesConfig). data is an array: [xValue, yValue]
if margin is specified it will use thos to adjust the pixel values
instead of the normal `margin` property
returns an object with the result and whether that result is out of
bounds for the current domain

methods.name: getDataFromPixel
methods.description:
Gets data values for pixel values relating to a series (series is the id
used in seriesConfig). pixelVal is an array: [xValue, yValue]
please note that the values returned have no guarantee to match any
actual chart data, this is just a conversion based on pixel

methods.name: _truncateName
methods.description:
_truncateName takes a string and string length [optional].
Returns a truncated string with the middle replaced by an ellipsis. The ellipsis does not count towards the total character count.
Follows these truncation principles: http://www.gesdh.com/predix/product/principles/truncation/
Example: LNG_BAH_HOT_EFFECTIVENESS_CORE8 --> LNG_B...CORE8

Length cannot be less than 2 characters.
Default length is 10 characters.

If the string is less than or equal to the length or the length is invalid, returns the original string.

methods.name: formatTimestamp
methods.description: Method that takes a datetime string, timezone string, and a formatting string. Returns a formated datetime string.

methods.name: generateRandomID
methods.description:
Generates a random id string.

Takes a string prefix, then adds 10 random chars

methods.name: cloneSVGElem
methods.description:
Clones a SVG elem and sets a component property with the d3 instance of that clone.

The intent of this is to clone the high level 'g' elem we draw to and attach it.
The draw order matters  in SVG and we want the some stuff to appear on top of everything else
Since we cannot easily ensure it draw order with components, we can stick top level items in a different 'g' that we know is drawn after the main 'g'

methods.name: _drawSVGOnCanvas
methods.description: Draws the current svg into a canvas

methods.name: _drawCanvg
methods.description:
Uses canvg third party to "translate" svg to javascript instructions
for the canvas, and draw on the canvas

methods.name: _nativeDrawSvgOnCanvas
methods.description: Tries to draw the SVG to canvas and if that doesnt work, falls back on a failure callback

methods.name: _getSVGOuterHtml
methods.description: fix for IE to get outer HTML

methods.name: _getColor
methods.description: Helper function to return the correct color for a particular index.

methods.name: _calcIndex
methods.description: Helper function to calculate the index. When we run out of indcies, it loops back over valid indicies.

methods.name: getToolbar
methods.description: Convenience method for searching for a toolbar in a chart.

methods.name: _returnAllKeys
methods.description:
Goes through an array of objects and gathers all unique keys. Returns a list of keys

Expects and array of objects

Returns an array of strings

methods.name: muteUnmuteSeries
methods.description: Method to mute or umute

methods.name: _calcChartExts
methods.description: Calcs the extents of the charts

methods.name: _setCompleteSeriesConfig
methods.description: Creates the real series confit object based on the default settings, the dev defined series config, and the includeAllSeries flag.

methods.name: _sideRegister
methods.description: Helper function for the register. Returns true if the side register should exist

methods.name: _topRegister
methods.description: Helper function for the register. Returns true if the top register should exist

methods.name: _chartTypeLine
methods.description: Helper function for the line series. Returns true if the series is a line

methods.name: _chartTypeScatter
methods.description: Helper function for the line series. Returns true if the series is a line

methods.name: _returnKeys
methods.description: returns the keys of an object

methods.name: notifyResize
methods.description:
Can be called to manually notify a resizable and its descendant
resizables of a resize change.

methods.name: assignParentResizable
methods.description:
Used to assign the closest resizable ancestor to this resizable
if the ancestor detects a request for notifications.

methods.name: stopResizeNotificationsFor
methods.description:
Used to remove a resizable descendant from the list of descendants
that should be notified of a resize change.

methods.name: resizerShouldNotify
methods.description:
This method can be overridden to filter nested elements that should or
should not be notified by the current element. Return true if an element
should be notified, or false if it should not be notified.

params.name: element
params.description:
A candidate descendant element that
implements `IronResizableBehavior`.

return.desc: True if the `element` should be notified of resize.

methods.name: getImage
methods.description:
Takes a graphic "snapshot" of the component and pass results through a callback:
- a canvas containing the graphical snapshot
- a png base 64 data uri

callback object:
{
 canvas: theCanvasObject
 image: "data:image/png;base64;iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAUAAAAFCAYAAACN..."
}

the data uri can be used to save the image and the canvas object to do
further processing, such as combining different elements snapshot into one image

methods.name: _drawRegister
methods.description: Draws a fake representation of the registers

methods.name: _onIronResize
methods.description: Resizes the chart based on a container resize if prevent-resize is false (default)

methods.name: _applyConfigToElement
methods.description:
Applies the config object to the element. Each key in the config object
is the name of the property to be applied

methods.name: _createLayers
methods.description: Creates <g> layers

methods.name: syncCSSTheme
methods.description:
Retrieves the CSS style variables set on this element and applies them
to the appropriate properties, triggering a redraw.

methods.name: _debounceSyncCSSTheme
methods.description:
Debounced function call for `syncCSSTheme` method. Loops through available
style variables to apply them to appropriate objects.

methods.name: _applyStyleVariables
methods.description:
Called when there is at least one style variable applied (the first is
expected to be named `--px-vis-series-color-0`). Loops through each
style variable in the format `--px-vis-series-color-[n]` and applies
the resulting values and series color order to the element. Stops looping
through style variables when it finds a gap.

methods.name: _colorHexToRgb
methods.description: Converts a hex-format color to RGB.

methods.name: _checkIfDevSetSeriesColorOrder
methods.description: Compares seriesColorOrder property value to the seriesColorOrder to determine if the dev set their own override.

methods.name: addClipPath
methods.description: Add the clip-path attr to the element

methods.name: _initializeRendererTypeObject
methods.description: Creates an object with all renderer types and a default value for each

methods.name: _registerDrawingElement
methods.description:
Elements wanting to use the renderer need to fire an event which
will be processed here

methods.name: _unregisterDrawingElement
methods.description:
Elements wanting to use the renderer need to fire an event (on detached)
which will be processed here

methods.name: _renderData
methods.description: Initial entry point, debouncing as needed or cancel

methods.name: _renderDataDebounced
methods.description:
Ensure we the basic conditions for allowign rendering
and start it

methods.name: _initializeCanvasRendering
methods.description:
Resets var relating to 1 complete rendering, call initializeDrawingSession
on all rendering targets and kick the process

methods.name: _processCanvasRendering
methods.description:
Called each frame.
- Updates previous frame timings if there was one
- Render what can be in the current frame
- Exit or wait for next frame

methods.name: _processCanvasOneFrame
methods.description:
Rendering process during one frame. Calculate how many points can be
rendered for the current target an render those. Keep rendering next
targets if we have enough time, based on same process

methods.name: _updatePreviousFrameTiming
methods.description:
Updates stats of the previous frame: how many points have been
rendered per type and how long it took

methods.name: _firstCanvasRender
methods.description:
Used when rendering a target we don't have stats about. Assumes a first
number of points to render, measure that and render more if we think we can

methods.name: _renderTargetToCanvas
methods.description:
Tries to render toRender number of points for the current target.
returns the number of points actually rendered and how much of the budget
this used

methods.name: _calculatePointsAllowance
methods.description:
Calculates how many points we can render in one frame for the
context current target. Based on stats of previous rendering of same type.
Returns -1 if we don't have stats about this type of rendering

methods.name: _limitSeries
methods.description: Dom if function to decide if a repeated item is above the limit

methods.name: resizeChart
methods.description: Forces the chart to resize and redraw

attributes.name: width
attributes.description: The width of the elem; generally the width of the charting area for most components

attributes.name: height
attributes.description: The height of the component; generally the height of the charting area for most components.

attributes.name: margin
attributes.description: Defines the base margin for the chart. Calcs are run to add to the margin to accommodate axes and other elements which exist within the SVG frame, but outside the chart frame.

attributes.name: offset
attributes.description: An optional offset for a variety of elements

attributes.name: x
attributes.description:
x is a holder for the d3 instantiated scale object
Must be set in the svg component and passed to all components so they know the drawing scale.
This can be set declaratively

See: https://github.com/d3/d3/blob/master/API.md#scales-d3-scale

attributes.name: y
attributes.description:
y is a holder for the d3 instantiated scale object
Must be set in the svg component and passed to all components so they know the drawing scale.
This can be set declaratively

See: https://github.com/d3/d3/blob/master/API.md#scales-d3-scale

attributes.name: chart-data
attributes.description:
container for the data object that drives the chart / component
Generally loaded with an iron-ajax tag (but doesnt have to be)
This can be set declaratively

attributes.name: selected-domain
attributes.description:
New chart extents selected by the user

Serves as a trigger for the scale component to redefine the chart extents

attributes.name: x-axis-type
attributes.description:
Sets the type of data for the x values

Valid entries are:
- `ordinal`: for discrete input domains, such as names or categories.
- `scaleBand`: another ordinal type meant to create a bar instead of a point.
- `time`: for time domains.
- `timeLocal`: for local time domains.
- `linear`: for continuous input domains, such as numbers.
- `log`: for continuous input domains displayed logarithmicly. NOTE: Per d3 docs, this scale cannot cross or include 0.
- `pie`: for pie/donut charts

attributes.name: y-axis-type
attributes.description:
Sets the type of data for the y values

Valid entries are:
- `ordinal`: for discrete input domains, such as names or categories.
- `scaleBand`: another ordinal type meant to create a bar instead of a point.
- `linear`: for continuous input domains, such as numbers.
- `log`: for continuous input domains, such as numbers.
- `pie`: for pie/donut charts

attributes.name: complete-series-config
attributes.description: A configuration file generated by the chart behavior based on seriesConfig and defaultSeriesConfig.

attributes.name: chart-extents
attributes.description:
Developer set chart extents for the chart. The chart will draw to whatever values are specified in the chartExtents.
```
 {
     "x": [0,100],
     "y": [5,50],
 }
```

To force the chart to calculate based on data, use "dynamic".
```
 {
     "x": [0,"dynamic"],
     "y": [-10,"dynamic"],
 }
```

attributes.name: data-extents
domain-changed
attributes.description:
Number which increments up when the domain(s) has(have) changed.

0 (false) indicates that domains have not been set.

Serves as a trigger for many elements to redraw.

attributes.name: prevent-web-worker-synchronization
attributes.description:
Prevents the chart from synchronizing its data with a webworker.
This can be turned on to minimize the memory footprint of the
chart
WARNING: turning the synchronization off will:
- prevent the chart from being able to use crosshair feature
- slow down data search for tooltip/register
- slow down calculating extents for the chart if it needs to

We advise against turning it off but it might be beneficial in
specific scenarios (high number of small charts with minimum
interaction for example)

attributes.name: muted-series
attributes.description:
A list of user selected muted series. Tied declaratively to series components

The series name is the key and the value is a boolean for whether it is muted or not:

```
{
    'seriesId1':true,
    'seriesId2':false,
 }
```

In this example, seriesId1 is muted. seriesId2 was muted, but has been turned back on.

attributes.name: hard-mute
attributes.description:
Allows for a "hard" muting of the series/categories: the
series/category won't show up
in the tooltip anymore, it's tooltip data won't be shown in the register
and its extents won't be taken into account by the chart

attributes.name: disable-dynamic-update
attributes.description: Defines if the viewable chart extents should update when chartData is updated

attributes.name: chart-id
attributes.description: Internal unique ID

attributes.name: scale-padding
attributes.description:
The padding for ordinal type scales - effective controls the spacing between ordinal groups

Expressed as a percent of the ordinal group width, so a value of 0.5 for a bar chart means your bar and the gap between bars are the same size

attributes.name: padding-outer
attributes.description:
The outer padding for ordinal type scales - effective controls the spacing between the first and last ordinal group the the axes

Expressed as a percent of the ordinal group width, so a value of 0.5 for a bar chart means your bar and the gap between bars are the same size

attributes.name: log-base
attributes.description: The base for logarithmic type scales

attributes.name: truncation-length
attributes.description:
Defines if the label should get truncated and to how many characters.

Default length is 10 characters, not including the ellipsis which gets inserted.

The length must be at least 2.

To disable truncation, set the value to -1

attributes.name: number-format-culture
attributes.description:
Defines how a display number should be formatted:
Provide localization for currency formatting

For valid formats and features, see: http://numbrojs.com/languages.html
For docs on the component, see: https://www.predix-ui.com/#/components/px-number-formatter/

attributes.name: number-format-is-currency
attributes.description:
Defines how a display number should be formatted:
Specify whether the value should be formatted as a currency

For valid formats and features, see: http://numbrojs.com/format.html
For docs on the component, see: https://www.predix-ui.com/#/components/px-number-formatter/

attributes.name: number-format-currency
attributes.description:
Defines how a display number should be formatted:
Provide a new default format for currency

For valid formats and features, see: http://numbrojs.com/format.html
For docs on the component, see: https://www.predix-ui.com/#/components/px-number-formatter/

attributes.name: number-format-default
attributes.description:
Defines how a display number should be formatted:
Provides a new default format

For valid formats and features, see: http://numbrojs.com/format.html
For docs on the component, see: https://www.predix-ui.com/#/components/px-number-formatter/

attributes.name: number-format
attributes.description:
Defines how a display number should be formatted:
The format used to generate the output

For valid formats and features, see: http://numbrojs.com/format.html
For docs on the component, see: https://www.predix-ui.com/#/components/px-number-formatter/

attributes.name: number-format-unformat
attributes.description:
Defines how a display number should be converted back to a Number:
A formatted String to extract a value from

For valid formats and features, see: http://numbrojs.com/format.html#unformat
For docs on the component, see: https://www.predix-ui.com/#/components/px-number-formatter/

attributes.name: number-format-zero
attributes.description:
Defines how to display 0 values

For valid formats and features, see: http://numbrojs.com/format.html
For docs on the component, see: https://www.predix-ui.com/#/components/px-number-formatter/

attributes.name: first-date-time-format
attributes.description:
Defines the format for the first datetime string. The first datetime is shown in normal font weight.

Default is the first datetime string is TIME presented as "15:00:00 +0000"

For valid string formats, see: http://momentjs.com/docs/#/displaying/

attributes.name: second-date-time-format
attributes.description:
Defines the format for the second datetime string. The second datetime is shown in bold font weight.

Default is the second datetime string is DATE presented as "12 Feb 2016"

For valid string formats, see: http://momentjs.com/docs/#/displaying/

attributes.name: separator
attributes.description: Defines a separator character between the two datetime strings.

attributes.name: timezone
attributes.description:
Sets what timezone the event time should display in.

Timezone defaults to UTC time. If a valid timezone is specified, then times include daylight savings time if applicable.

For a list of valid timezones, see: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_tz_database_time_zones

For more details on timezones, see: http://momentjs.com/timezone/

attributes.name: svg
attributes.description:
svg is a holder for the d3 instantiated svg container to draw to.
Must be set in ready and passed to all components so they know whom to draw to.

attributes.name: px-svg-elem
attributes.description: The SVG element inside the chart - not a D3 selected element.

attributes.name: orientation
attributes.description:
Defines which side the axis should be on.
 - 'left'
 - 'right'
 - 'bottom'
 - 'top'

attributes.name: axis
attributes.description:
axis is a general holder for the d3 instantiated scale object
Can pass any type of instantiated scale object, IE pass in either your x or your y depending which this axis is for.
This can be set declaratively

See: https://github.com/d3/d3/blob/master/API.md#scales-d3-axis

attributes.name: canvas-context
attributes.description:
canvasContext is a holder for the instantiated canvas context to draw to.
Must be set in ready and passed to all components so they know whom to draw to.

attributes.name: canvas-layers
attributes.description: An array of the generated layers

attributes.name: render-to-canvas
attributes.description: Boolean to specify if drawings should render to canvas instead of svg

attributes.name: series-color-list
attributes.description: Defines an colors in order that will be used for series.

attributes.name: series-config
attributes.description:
A configuration file to associate series order, name, type, and colors.

Association of name, type, and seriesNumber should be developer set. Color and axis are optional.

```
 {
    "seriesKey": {  //seriesKey is a unique identifier for the configuration
        "type": "line",  //line or scatter or both
        "priority": 0, //relative priority is used to decide which series draw on top of each other. priority 0 => smaller priority. 2 draws over 1, which itself draws over 0, etc.. CANVAS ONLY
        "markerSymbol": "diamond" //if using scatter different markerSymbol can be used. See "markerSymbol" in px-vis-scatter
        "markerSize": "64" //if using scatter allows to change the size of markers
        "markerScale": "2" //if using scatter allows to scale the size of markers
        "markerFillOpacity": "0.5" //if using scatter allows to specify the opacity of the inside of the marker
        "markerStrokeOpacity": "1" //if using scatter allows to specify the opacity of the outside of the marker
        "strokeWidth": "1" //if using line, allows you to specify the thickness of the line
        "mutedOpacity": "0.3" //opacity value to use when muting a serie
        "name": "My Series",  //human readable name
        "x": "x",  //index or key name for independent variable
        "y": "y",  //index or key name for dependent variable
        "xAxisUnit": "Volt" //Unit to be used for the X axis. Can be ignored if x axis is time based
        "yAxisUnit": "Oranges" //unit to be used for the Y axis.
        "xMin": 0,  // minimum x value
        "xMax": 100,  //maximum x value
        "yMin": 5,  //minimum y value
        "yMax": 50,  //maximum y value
        "hideInRegister": true, //dont show in the register
        "color": "rgb(0,0,0)", //color you want for the series
        "negativeColor": "rgb(255,255,255)", //color you want negative values of the series to be (not all charts)
        "interpolationFunction": Px.d3.curveBasis, //The line interpretor you want to use. See property 'interpolationFunction'
        "axis": {
            "id": "AXIS_ID"   //a unique identifier
            "side": "left"    //the side that you want the axis to draw on, `left` or `right`
            "number": 1       //the order of the axis on each side
         }
    }
 }
```

attributes.name: default-series-config
attributes.description: Overwrites to the default configuration file. The defaultSeriesConfig is used to fill in the missing parts of seriesConfig. Any option from seriesConfig can be specified in the defaultSeriesConfig and will be automatically used if not defined in the seriesConfig

attributes.name: include-all-series
attributes.description:
A boolean flag on whether to include all the series in the data.
- `false`: only series defined in the seriesConfig file will be drawn
- `true`: All series in the dataset will be drawn. Defaults will be used for the seriesConfig. If this is used do not specify a seriesConfig

attributes.name: prevent-resize
attributes.description: Prevents the chart from automatically resizing to fit its container

attributes.name: chart-horizontal-alignment
attributes.description:
This allows to decide how the chart
drawing will be horizontally aligned when smaller than its container. Values:
- center
- left
- right

if any other value is used then left alignment will be chosen

attributes.name: chart-vertical-alignment
attributes.description:
This allows to decide how the chart
drawing will be vertically aligned when smaller than its container. Values:
- center
- top
- bottom

if any other value is used then top alignment will be chosen

attributes.name: debounce-resize-timing
attributes.description:
Timing (in ms) to be used for iron resize when the chart auto size
(preventResize = false)

attributes.name: tooltip-config
attributes.description:
Configuration object used to customize the tooltip cosmetic properties.
Please refer to px-vis-tooltip and px-vis-register (https://github.com/PredixDev/px-vis) for a list of supported properties
Most interesting properties include:
- width
- height
- tooltipStyle
- forceDateTimeDisplay

attributes.name: register-config
attributes.description:
Configuration object used to customize the register cosmetic properties.
Please refer to px-vis-register (https://github.com/PredixDev/px-vis) for a list of supported properties

attributes.name: x-axis-config
attributes.description:
Configuration object used to customize the X axis cosmetic properties.
Please refer to px-vis-axis (https://github.com/PredixDev/px-vis) for a list of supported properties

attributes.name: y-axis-config
attributes.description:
Configuration object used to customize the Y axis cosmetic properties.
Please refer to px-vis-axis (https://github.com/PredixDev/px-vis) for a list of supported properties

attributes.name: layer
attributes.description: Array of the svg layers

attributes.name: ww-data-sync-counter
attributes.description:
Updated every time the chart gets new data and a sync request
to the web worker happened. Use it for triggering observers
instead of chartData if the observer needs the data in the webworker
(i.e kicking another webworker processing)

attributes.name: clip-path
attributes.description: Holder for a clipping path ID

attributes.name: series-clip-path
attributes.description: A more restricting clip path used to limit where the series are being drawn

attributes.name: prevent-initial-drawing
attributes.description: blocks initial drawings of axis until set to false

attributes.name: draw-debounce-time
attributes.description: Debounce time to use for different types of rendering

attributes.name: debounce-on-panning
attributes.description:
Whether the drawings will be debounced on panning the chart.
When not debounced the redraw will happen more often on panning,
which should result in a smoother experience. However if rendering
a big number of points this can have the opposite effect since
it wil redraw too often comapred tot he time taken to re render everything

attributes.name: renderer-minimum-points-per-frame
attributes.description:
The minimum number of points to render per frame
even if the chart is laggy

attributes.name: renderer-frame-duration-target
attributes.description:
Target duration (in ms) for one frame. The renderer will try to render
as much data as possible in that given timeframe before calling the next
animation frame.
WARNING: this needs to be higher than 16ms since by default
requestAnimationFrame will be called every ~16ms, so our target needs to
be higher to ensure we keep the processor busy

attributes.name: renderer-frame-count-to-average
attributes.description:
Number of previous frames to average for the adaptive
progressive rendering

attributes.name: gradient-colors
attributes.description:
Colors used to create a gradient. Can be one of the folowing:
- A single color (string), resulting in that color being applied for the whole "gradient"
- An Array of colors from which a linear gradient while be created
- A custom function that defined a gradient. The function takes an input that will be between 0 and 1 and should return a color based on that input.
- A d3 chromatic scale, which is effectively a function as described above with predefined colors. Please see the "interpolate" functions at https://github.com/d3/d3-scale-chromatic

attributes.name: nav-series-limit
attributes.description: Number of series to display on the navigator

attributes.name: chart-domain-x
attributes.description: The parent chart's extents

attributes.name: chart-domain-y
attributes.description: The parent chart's extents

elements.description:
### Usage

    <px-vis-clip-complex-area
      svg="[[svg]]"
      x="[[x]]"
      y="[[y]]"
      domain-changed="[[domainChanged]]"
      chart-data="[[chartData]]"
      dimensions="[[dimensions]]"
      clip-path="{{clipPath}}">
    </px-vis-clip-complex-area>

## MDN Spec
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Element/clipPath

properties.name: svg
properties.description:
svg is a holder for the d3 instantiated svg container to draw to.
Must be set in ready and passed to all components so they know whom to draw to.

properties.name: _uniqueIdsUsed
properties.description:
Array of unique IDs generated for this comp. cleaned from global
store on detached

properties.name: pxSvgElem
properties.description: The SVG element inside the chart - not a D3 selected element.

properties.name: width
properties.description: The width of the elem; generally the width of the charting area for most components

properties.name: height
properties.description: The height of the component; generally the height of the charting area for most components.

properties.name: _defaultMargin
properties.description: Copy of the default margin for checking if it has changed

properties.name: margin
properties.description: Defines the base margin for the chart. Calcs are run to add to the margin to accommodate axes and other elements which exist within the SVG frame, but outside the chart frame.

properties.name: offset
properties.description: An optional offset for a variety of elements

properties.name: x
properties.description:
x is a holder for the d3 instantiated scale object
Must be set in the svg component and passed to all components so they know the drawing scale.
This can be set declaratively

See: https://github.com/d3/d3/blob/master/API.md#scales-d3-scale

properties.name: y
properties.description:
y is a holder for the d3 instantiated scale object
Must be set in the svg component and passed to all components so they know the drawing scale.
This can be set declaratively

See: https://github.com/d3/d3/blob/master/API.md#scales-d3-scale

properties.name: clipPath
properties.description: Holder for a clipping path ID

properties.name: seriesClipPath
properties.description: A more restricting clip path used to limit where the series are being drawn

properties.name: _clipPathObj
properties.description: Holder for the clip path object

properties.name: _clipPathSvg
properties.description: Holder for the clip path svg

methods.name: generateRandomID
methods.description:
Generates a random id string.

Takes a string prefix, then adds 10 random chars

methods.name: cloneSVGElem
methods.description:
Clones a SVG elem and sets a component property with the d3 instance of that clone.

The intent of this is to clone the high level 'g' elem we draw to and attach it.
The draw order matters  in SVG and we want the some stuff to appear on top of everything else
Since we cannot easily ensure it draw order with components, we can stick top level items in a different 'g' that we know is drawn after the main 'g'

methods.name: _drawSVGOnCanvas
methods.description: Draws the current svg into a canvas

methods.name: _drawCanvg
methods.description:
Uses canvg third party to "translate" svg to javascript instructions
for the canvas, and draw on the canvas

methods.name: _nativeDrawSvgOnCanvas
methods.description: Tries to draw the SVG to canvas and if that doesnt work, falls back on a failure callback

methods.name: _getSVGOuterHtml
methods.description: fix for IE to get outer HTML

methods.name: _processYValues
methods.description:
This functions process Y axis and applies the result to some variable.
If in single Y it just run the function and assign the result to `result`, if multi Y
it runs the function for each axis and stores the result against the axis key
on `result`

methods.name: _isValidData
methods.description: returns true if the data is valid: non NaN, null or undefined

methods.name: _isDataNotNull
methods.description: returns true if the data is not null

methods.name: _isObjEmpty
methods.description: Checks to see if an object is empty

methods.name: _isD3Empty
methods.description: Checks to see if an d3 obj is empty

methods.name: _doesD3HaveValues
methods.description: Checks to see if an d3 obj has something

methods.name: _doesObjHaveValues
methods.description: Checks to see if an object has values

methods.name: _isVarDefined
methods.description: Checks to see if an object is defined

methods.name: _isVarUndefined
methods.description: Checks to see if an object is defined

methods.name: _escapeCssSelector
methods.description: escapes '.' in css selectors so that we can appropriately select stuff with dots in thei ids

methods.name: _checkThemeVariable
methods.description: Checks if a theme variable exists, if so, returns the theme value, if not, returns the default

methods.name: _hexToRgb
methods.description: converts a hex to rgb color

methods.name: _binarySearch
methods.description: Binary search through sorted chartData

methods.name: _fuzzyBinarySearch
methods.description: Binary search through sorted chartData returning all vals within a window

methods.name: clone
methods.description: deep-copy object into newObject

methods.name: addClipPath
methods.description: Add the clip-path attr to the element

methods.name: _drawElement
methods.description: Creates and sets a clipping path

elements.description:
### Usage

    <px-vis-svg
        ...
        svg="{{svg}}">
    </px-vis-svg>
    <px-vis-scale
        ...
        x="{{x}}"
        y="{{y}}"
        domain-changed="{{domainChanged}}">
    </px-vis-scale>
    <px-vis-cursor-line
        svg="[[layer.2]]"
        svg-data-layer="[[layer.0]]"
        svg-overlay-layer="[[layer.1]]"
        canvas-data-layer="[[canvasContext]]"
        canvas-overlay-layer="[[canvasLayers.highlighter]]"
        x="[[x]]"
        y="[[y]]"
        parallel-coordinates
        dimensions="[[dimensions]]"
        domain-changed="[[domainChanged]]"
        complete-series-config="[[completeSeriesConfig]]"
        series-id="[[seriesKey]]"
        category-key="[[categoryKey]]"
        categories="[[categories]]"
        tooltip-data="[[tooltipData.dataset]]">
    </px-vis-cursor-line>

properties.description:
svg is a holder for the d3 instantiated svg container to draw to.
Must be set in ready and passed to all components so they know whom to draw to.

properties.name: _uniqueIdsUsed
properties.description:
Array of unique IDs generated for this comp. cleaned from global
store on detached

properties.name: pxSvgElem
properties.description: The SVG element inside the chart - not a D3 selected element.

properties.name: x
properties.description:
x is a holder for the d3 instantiated scale object
Must be set in the svg component and passed to all components so they know the drawing scale.
This can be set declaratively

See: https://github.com/d3/d3/blob/master/API.md#scales-d3-scale

properties.name: y
properties.description:
y is a holder for the d3 instantiated scale object
Must be set in the svg component and passed to all components so they know the drawing scale.
This can be set declaratively

See: https://github.com/d3/d3/blob/master/API.md#scales-d3-scale

properties.name: chartData
properties.description:
container for the data object that drives the chart / component
Generally loaded with an iron-ajax tag (but doesnt have to be)
This can be set declaratively

properties.name: tooltipData
defaultEmptyData
properties.description: The "empty" dataset that should be used for tooltipData when not hovering

properties.name: completeSeriesConfig
properties.description: A configuration file generated by the chart behavior based on seriesConfig and defaultSeriesConfig.

properties.name: seriesId
properties.description: A unique ID for each line series

properties.name: categoryKey
properties.description: A dev set string speciying which key to use as the category to use to color the series lines

properties.name: categories
properties.description: A dev set array defining the categories values.

properties.name: clipPath
properties.description: Holder for a clipping path ID

properties.name: seriesClipPath
properties.description: A more restricting clip path used to limit where the series are being drawn

properties.name: mutedSeries
properties.description:
A list of user selected muted series. Tied declaratively to series components

The series name is the key and the value is a boolean for whether it is muted or not:

```
{
    'seriesId1':true,
    'seriesId2':false,
 }
```

In this example, seriesId1 is muted. seriesId2 was muted, but has been turned back on.

properties.name: hardMute
properties.description:
Allows for a "hard" muting of the series/categories: the
series/category won't show up
in the tooltip anymore, it's tooltip data won't be shown in the register
and its extents won't be taken into account by the chart

properties.name: axes
properties.description:
Represents all axes plotted by the chart, including muted ones.
It doesn't guarantee to have the same order as the current visual
representation.
Can be set by the developer to define which axes to plot

properties.name: dimensions
properties.description:
An array of dimensions (axes) which the chart uses. This array represents
the current state of all axes: muted axes won't be included and the
array is ordered based on the current visual representation.
Do not set at a chart level, only read

properties.name: seriesKey
properties.description: A string specifying which key to use as the series

properties.name: domainChanged
properties.description:
Number which increments up when the domain(s) has(have) changed.

0 (false) indicates that domains have not been set.

Serves as a trigger for many elements to redraw.

properties.name: _dynamicProperties
properties.description: A list of the dynamic properties

properties.name: interpolationFunction
properties.description:
A d3 function used to interpolate the series lines.

Can also be a string referencing simple, built in d3 functions:
- `"curveBasis"`
- `"curveBasisClosed"`
- `"curveBasisOpen"`
- `"curveLinear"`
- `"curveLinearClosed"`
- `"curveMonotoneX"`
- `"curveMonotoneY"`
- `"curveNatural"`
- `"curveStep"`
- `"curveStepAfter"`
- `"curveStepBefore"`

See: https://github.com/d3/d3-shape/blob/master/README.md#curves

properties.name: lineRadiusLimit
properties.description: sets a minimum value for the line amplitude. Points less than the lineRadiusLimit will be set to the limit

properties.name: timeDomain
properties.description:
Can be used to define a time domain to be used, typically to restrain/filter the amount
of data displayed. Can be used in combination with a px-vis-chart-navigator

properties.name: parallelCoordinates
properties.description: Boolean specifying if the chart is a parallel coordinates chart

properties.name: radialLine
properties.description: Boolean specifying if the line is using radial (polar) data

methods.name: generateRandomID
methods.description:
Generates a random id string.

Takes a string prefix, then adds 10 random chars

methods.name: cloneSVGElem
methods.description:
Clones a SVG elem and sets a component property with the d3 instance of that clone.

The intent of this is to clone the high level 'g' elem we draw to and attach it.
The draw order matters  in SVG and we want the some stuff to appear on top of everything else
Since we cannot easily ensure it draw order with components, we can stick top level items in a different 'g' that we know is drawn after the main 'g'

methods.name: _drawSVGOnCanvas
methods.description: Draws the current svg into a canvas

methods.name: _drawCanvg
methods.description:
Uses canvg third party to "translate" svg to javascript instructions
for the canvas, and draw on the canvas

methods.name: _nativeDrawSvgOnCanvas
methods.description: Tries to draw the SVG to canvas and if that doesnt work, falls back on a failure callback

methods.name: _getSVGOuterHtml
methods.description: fix for IE to get outer HTML

methods.name: _processYValues
methods.description:
This functions process Y axis and applies the result to some variable.
If in single Y it just run the function and assign the result to `result`, if multi Y
it runs the function for each axis and stores the result against the axis key
on `result`

methods.description: returns true if the data is valid: non NaN, null or undefined

methods.description: Checks to see if an d3 obj is empty

methods.description: Checks to see if an d3 obj has something

methods.name: _doesObjHaveValues
methods.description: Checks to see if an object has values

methods.name: _isVarDefined
methods.description: Checks to see if an object is defined

methods.name: _isVarUndefined
methods.description: Checks to see if an object is defined

methods.description: escapes '.' in css selectors so that we can appropriately select stuff with dots in thei ids

methods.name: _checkThemeVariable
methods.description: Checks if a theme variable exists, if so, returns the theme value, if not, returns the default

methods.name: _hexToRgb
methods.description: converts a hex to rgb color

methods.name: _binarySearch
methods.description: Binary search through sorted chartData

methods.name: _fuzzyBinarySearch
methods.description: Binary search through sorted chartData returning all vals within a window

methods.name: clone
methods.description: deep-copy object into newObject

methods.name: addClipPath
methods.description: Add the clip-path attr to the element

methods.name: _computeValue
methods.description: Decides if it should use a default or user specified value

methods.name: _processConfig
methods.description: sets each property listed in dynamicProperies

methods.name: _watchConfigProperty
methods.description: Cycles through properties and adds them to dynamic properties

methods.name: _updateLayers
methods.description: Mutes and unmutes the other chart layers

methods.name: _returnData
methods.description: Passes the data to the line generator if it exists

elements.description:
### Usage

  <px-vis-svg
    width="[[width]]"
    height="[[height]]"
    margin="[[margin]]"
    svg="{{svg}}">
  </px-vis-svg>
  <px-vis-scale
    x-axis-type="time"
    y-axis-type="linear"
    complete-series-config="[[seriesConfig]]"
    data-extents="[[dataExtents]]"
    width="[[width]]"
    height="[[height]]"
    margin="[[margin]]"
    chart-data={{chartData}}
    x="{{x}}"
    y="{{y}}"
    domain-changed="{{domainChanged}}"
    selected-domain="[[selectedDomain]]">
  </px-vis-scale>
  <px-vis-interaction-space
    x-axis-type="time"
    svg="[[svg]]"
    width="[[width]]"
    height="[[height]]"
    margin="[[margin]]"
    complete-series-config="[[seriesConfig]]"
    chart-data="[[chartData]]"
    tooltip-data={{tooltipData}}
    series-keys="[[seriesKeys]]"
    extents-data={{extentsData}}
    x="[[x]]"
    y="[[y]]"
    domain-changed="[[domainChanged]]">
  </px-vis-interaction-space>
  <px-vis-cursor
    svg="[[svg]]"
    width="[[width]]"
    height="[[height]]"
    margin="[[margin]]"
    complete-series-config="[[seriesConfig]]"
    chart-data="[[chartData]]"
    tooltip-data="[[tooltipData]]"
    selection-type=[[selectionType]]>
  </px-vis-cursor>

### Styling
The following custom properties are available for styling:

Custom property | Description
:----------------|:-------------
  `--px-vis-cursor-line-color` | The color for the lines which track the cursor/data

elements.description:
Converts data from Array form to Object form.

px-vis charts expect data in the following array of objects format:

```
[
    {
        x: 10,
        y: 50
    },{
        x: 20,
        y: 40
    }
]
```

Keys are flexible - multiple keys can be added to the same object:

```
[
    {
        timestamp: 1413930600000,
        tag1: 15,
        tag2: 16,
        tag3: 11
    },{
        timestamp: 1414080000000,
        tag1: 14,
        tag2: 17,
        tag3: 13
    }
]
```

This component accepts data in the following format:

```
[{
    "id":"myTagID",
    "name":"My Favorite Tag",
    "minValue":0,
    "maxValue":293,
    "data":[
        [1464562720308,41],
        [1464571360308,170]
    ]
}]
```

It will reformat the data into the object format and create a seriesConfig file.

### Usage

    <px-vis-data-converter
        data-key="[[dataKey]]"
        id-key="[[idKey]]"
        original-data="[[originalData]]"
        chart-data="{{chartData}}"
        series-config="{{seriesConfig}}">
    </px-vis-data-converter>

properties.name: dataKey
properties.description: The key for accessing the data array.

properties.name: idKey
properties.description: The key for accessing the data id.

properties.name: nameKey
properties.description: The key for accessing the data name.

properties.name: dataIds
properties.description: An optional array of data IDs matching the order of the data array.

properties.name: dataNames
properties.description: An optional array of data names matching the order of the data array.

properties.name: newXKey
properties.description: An optional name for the x-key for chartData.

properties.name: xUnitKey
properties.description: An optional key for the x axis units for chartData.

properties.name: yUnitKey
properties.description: An optional key for the y axis units for chartData.

properties.name: originalData
properties.description: The original data in Array form.

properties.name: seriesConfig
properties.description: A series configuration file computed from originalData.

properties.name: chartData
properties.description: The computed data in the Array of Object form expected by px-vis charts.

properties.name: emptySets
properties.description: A list of the empty datasets.

elements.description:
### Usage

    <px-vis-event
        svg="[[svg]]"
        x-axis-type="[[xAxisType]]"
        clip-path="[[clipPath]]"
        event-id="[[item.id]]"
        chart-data="[[item]]"
        x="[[x]]"
        y="[[y]]"
        event-config="[[eventConfig]]">
    </px-vis-event>

The configuration object allows developers to set the icon used for each event type.

It should follow this form:

    eventConfig = {
      "Event Name 1":{
        "color": "blue",
        "icon": "px-fea:deployments",
        "type": "px",
        "offset":[0,0]
      },
      "Event Name 2":{
        "color": "green",
        "icon": "px-nav:favorite",
        "type": "px",
        "offset":[0,0],
        "lineWeight": 0
      },
      "Event Name 3":{
        "icon": "Dancing_banana.gif",
        "type": "image",
        "offset":[-2,-20],
        "size":"25"
      }
    }

### Styling
The following custom properties are available for styling:

Custom property | Description
:----------------|:-------------
  `--px-vis-event-line-color` | The default color for the vertical lines below the icon
  `--px-vis-event-icon-color` | The default color for the event icon markers

properties.name: svg
properties.description:
svg is a holder for the d3 instantiated svg container to draw to.
Must be set in ready and passed to all components so they know whom to draw to.

properties.name: _uniqueIdsUsed
properties.description:
Array of unique IDs generated for this comp. cleaned from global
store on detached

properties.name: pxSvgElem
properties.description: The SVG element inside the chart - not a D3 selected element.

properties.name: x
properties.description:
x is a holder for the d3 instantiated scale object
Must be set in the svg component and passed to all components so they know the drawing scale.
This can be set declaratively

See: https://github.com/d3/d3/blob/master/API.md#scales-d3-scale

properties.name: y
properties.description:
y is a holder for the d3 instantiated scale object
Must be set in the svg component and passed to all components so they know the drawing scale.
This can be set declaratively

See: https://github.com/d3/d3/blob/master/API.md#scales-d3-scale

properties.name: width
properties.description: The width of the elem; generally the width of the charting area for most components

properties.name: height
properties.description: The height of the component; generally the height of the charting area for most components.

properties.name: _defaultMargin
properties.description: Copy of the default margin for checking if it has changed

properties.name: margin
properties.description: Defines the base margin for the chart. Calcs are run to add to the margin to accommodate axes and other elements which exist within the SVG frame, but outside the chart frame.

properties.name: offset
properties.description: An optional offset for a variety of elements

properties.name: xAxisType
properties.description:
Sets the type of data for the x values

Valid entries are:
- `ordinal`: for discrete input domains, such as names or categories.
- `scaleBand`: another ordinal type meant to create a bar instead of a point.
- `time`: for time domains.
- `timeLocal`: for local time domains.
- `linear`: for continuous input domains, such as numbers.
- `log`: for continuous input domains displayed logarithmicly. NOTE: Per d3 docs, this scale cannot cross or include 0.
- `pie`: for pie/donut charts

properties.name: yAxisType
properties.description:
Sets the type of data for the y values

Valid entries are:
- `ordinal`: for discrete input domains, such as names or categories.
- `scaleBand`: another ordinal type meant to create a bar instead of a point.
- `linear`: for continuous input domains, such as numbers.
- `log`: for continuous input domains, such as numbers.
- `pie`: for pie/donut charts

properties.name: clipPath
properties.description: Holder for a clipping path ID

properties.name: seriesClipPath
properties.description: A more restricting clip path used to limit where the series are being drawn

properties.name: eventConfig
properties.description:
Configuration object to define what event should map to what icon and color.
The object has a key being the event name, the value being a configuration object for that event. The configuration object has four properties:
- `color`: A valid color name found in the px-colors-design
- `icon`: the reference to the icon; for 'px' it is an icon set and an icon name; for an image, it is a path
- `type`: 'px', or 'image'.
- `offset`: a 2 element array with the number of pixels to offset the icon. offset[0] is along the x-axis; offset[1] is along the y-axis; necessary for some icons to adjust their values to achieve a better alignment over the event line.
- `size`: a size in pixels for images.
- `enableTooltip` enable/disable tooltip on the event, useful when using a lot of events
- `firstDateTimeFormat`: moment.js format string for the first part of the timestamp if the x Axis is time based
- `separator`: the separator character between the two datetime strings
- `secondDateTimeFormat`: moment.js format string for the second part of the timestamp if the x Axis is time based
- `tooltipOrientation`: orientation of the tooltip
- `timezone`: the moment.js timezone to be used for the timestamp
- `lineWeight`: thickness of the line
- `dataKey`: the access key for the eventData value to be used to position the event
```
Format: {
  "Event-Name-A":{
    "color": "a color, rgb or hex",
    "icon": "a px icon",
    "type": "px",
    "offset":[0,0],
    'enableTooltip': true
  },
  "Event-Name-C":{
    "color": "a color, rgb or hex",
    "icon": "path-to-an-img",
    "type": "image",
    "offset":[0,0]
  },
}
```

```
Example: {
  "Recalibrate":{
    "color": "rgb(0,0,255)",
    "icon": "px-vis:mov",
    "type": "px",
    "offset":[-3,0]
  },
  "Fan stop":{
    "icon": "Dancing_banana.gif",
    "type": "image",
    "offset":[-2,-20],
    "size":"25"
   }
}
```

properties.name: defaultEventConfig
properties.description:
Configuration object to define what the default icon should be. This gets used if a) no eventConfig is defined or b) the particular event is not defined in the eventConfig object.

```
Default: {
  'color': 'grey7', //or theme var
  'icon': 'px-vis:mov',
  'type': 'px',
  'offset': 0,
  'lineColor': 'grey9',
  'lineWeight': 1,
  'enableTooltip': true
  'firstDateTimeFormat': 'HH:mm:ss ZZ',
  'secondDateTimeFormat': 'DD MMM YYYY',
  'separator': '|',
  'timezone': 'utc',
  'tooltipOrientation': 'left'
}
```

properties.name: eventData
domainChanged
properties.description:
Number which increments up when the domain(s) has(have) changed.

0 (false) indicates that domains have not been set.

Serves as a trigger for many elements to redraw.

properties.name: _iconCallbackQueue
properties.description: A list of methods that should be called in order to load the icon, position it, etc

properties.name: eventGroup
properties.description: Holder object for the event svg "g" element.

properties.name: _eventConfigChanged
properties.description: Tracks if the event configuration has been edited.

properties.name: _defaultDefaultEventConfig
properties.description:
Default defaultEventConfig

```
Default: {
  'color': 'rgb(0,0,0)',
  'icon': 'px-utl:information',
  'type': 'px',
  'offset': 0,
  'size': 16,
  'lineColor': 'rgb(0,0,0)',
  'lineWeight': 1,
  'enableTooltip': true,
  'firstDateTimeFormat': 'HH:mm:ss ZZ',
  'secondDateTimeFormat': 'DD MMM YYYY',
  'separator': '|',
  'timezone': 'utc',
  'tooltipOrientation': 'left'
  'dataKey': 'time'
}
```

methods.name: generateRandomID
methods.description:
Generates a random id string.

Takes a string prefix, then adds 10 random chars

methods.name: cloneSVGElem
methods.description:
Clones a SVG elem and sets a component property with the d3 instance of that clone.

The intent of this is to clone the high level 'g' elem we draw to and attach it.
The draw order matters  in SVG and we want the some stuff to appear on top of everything else
Since we cannot easily ensure it draw order with components, we can stick top level items in a different 'g' that we know is drawn after the main 'g'

methods.name: _drawSVGOnCanvas
methods.description: Draws the current svg into a canvas

methods.name: _drawCanvg
methods.description:
Uses canvg third party to "translate" svg to javascript instructions
for the canvas, and draw on the canvas

methods.name: _nativeDrawSvgOnCanvas
methods.description: Tries to draw the SVG to canvas and if that doesnt work, falls back on a failure callback

methods.name: _getSVGOuterHtml
methods.description: fix for IE to get outer HTML

methods.name: _processYValues
methods.description:
This functions process Y axis and applies the result to some variable.
If in single Y it just run the function and assign the result to `result`, if multi Y
it runs the function for each axis and stores the result against the axis key
on `result`

elements.description:
The drawing object has two orientation options: `bottom` and `left`.

Using `bottom` specifies vertical gridlines drawn from the x-axis.
Using `left` specifes horizontal gridlines drawn from the y-axis.

### Usage

    <px-vis-gridlines
        svg="[[svg]]"
        axis="[[x]]"
        margin="[[margin]]"
        length="[[height]]"
        orientation="bottom">
    </px-vis-gridlines>

### d3 reference
https://github.com/mbostock/d3/wiki/SVG-Axes
The gridlines still make use of the d3.axis object, just with different settings

### Styling
The following custom properties are available for styling:

Custom property | Description
:----------------|:-------------
  `--px-vis-gridlines-color` | The color for the gridlines

 - 'center'
 - 'before'
 - 'after'

properties.description: Defines how the label should be rotated. Number is the degree of rotation

properties.description: Defines how the label should be moved in x,y. Array is an x,y pair and coresponds to the number of pixels to move the label

```

     x: Number, // a x number of pixels
     y: Number, // a y number of pixels
     r: Number, // a number of degrees to rotate
     anchor: String, // middle, start, end
   }
```

properties.name: tickSizeOuter

properties.name: tickValues
properties.description:
Defines the what values the axis should use

See: https://github.com/d3/d3-axis#axis_tickValues

properties.name: ticks
properties.description:
Defines the tick number and format

See: https://github.com/d3/d3-axis#axis_ticks

Can be either a Number or an Object

Obj format:
```
   {
        "interval": Number,
        "format": String or d3 object,
   }
```
