attributes.description: The width of the elem; generally the width of the charting area for most components

attributes.name: height
attributes.description: The height of the component; generally the height of the charting area for most components.

attributes.name: margin
attributes.description: Defines the base margin for the chart. Calcs are run to add to the margin to accommodate axes and other elements which exist within the SVG frame, but outside the chart frame.

attributes.name: offset
attributes.description: An optional offset for a variety of elements

attributes.name: orientation
attributes.description:
Defines which side the axis should be on.
 - 'left'
 - 'right'
 - 'bottom'
 - 'top'

attributes.name: axis
attributes.description:
axis is a general holder for the d3 instantiated scale object
Can pass any type of instantiated scale object, IE pass in either your x or your y depending which this axis is for.
This can be set declaratively

See: https://github.com/d3/d3/blob/master/API.md#scales-d3-axis

attributes.name: label-type-size
attributes.description: Defines the base label type size

attributes.name: title
attributes.description: The displayed title for the axis

attributes.name: label-position
attributes.description:
Defines on which side the tick mark the label should sit.
 - 'center'
 - 'before'
 - 'after'

attributes.name: label-rotation
attributes.description: Defines how the label should be rotated. Number is the degree of rotation

attributes.name: label-translation
attributes.description: Defines how the label should be moved in x,y. Array is an x,y pair and coresponds to the number of pixels to move the label

attributes.name: series
attributes.description: Array of the series which belong to this axis

attributes.name: translate-amt
attributes.description: An x,y amount to move the axis to allow for labels and titles

attributes.name: title-location
attributes.description:
Optional object to specify placement of the title. If none is supplied, then it uses `orientation` to determine title location.

```
   {
     x: Number, // a x number of pixels
     y: Number, // a y number of pixels
     r: Number, // a number of degrees to rotate
     anchor: String, // middle, start, end
   }
```

attributes.name: title-type-size
attributes.description: Defines the Title type size

attributes.name: stroke-width
attributes.description: Defines the axis stroke width

attributes.name: tick-size-outer
attributes.description:
Defines the axis tickSizeOuter. Default is to hide them

See: https://github.com/d3/d3-axis#axis_tickSizeOuter

attributes.name: tick-values
attributes.description:
Defines the what values the axis should use

See: https://github.com/d3/d3-axis#axis_tickValues

attributes.name: ticks
attributes.description:
Defines the tick number and format

See: https://github.com/d3/d3-axis#axis_ticks

Can be either a Number or an Object

Obj format:
```
   {
        "interval": Number,
        "format": String or d3 object,
   }
```

attributes.name: tick-format
attributes.description:
A string that specifies the format of the ticks

https://github.com/d3/d3-format

https://github.com/d3/d3-time-format

attributes.name: axis-color
attributes.description: Defines the color for axis lines, ticks, labels, and title

attributes.name: axis-line-color
attributes.description: Defines the color for axis lines (overrides axisColor)

attributes.name: axis-tick-color
attributes.description: Defines the color for axis ticks (overrides axisColor)

attributes.name: axis-label-color
attributes.description: Defines the color for axis labels (overrides axisColor)

attributes.name: axis-title-color
attributes.description: Defines the color for axis title (overrides axisColor)

attributes.name: drawn-tick-values
attributes.description: Returned tick values from the axis

attributes.name: domain-changed
attributes.description:
Number which increments up when the domain(s) has(have) changed.

0 (false) indicates that domains have not been set.

Serves as a trigger for many elements to redraw.

attributes.name: grid-id
attributes.description: A unique ID for the grid.

elements.description:
### Usage
      <px-vis-svg-canvas
        width="[[width]]"
        height="[[height]]"
        margin="[[margin]]"
        canvas-context="{{canvasContext}}">
      </px-vis-svg-canvas>
      <px-vis-scale
        x-axis-type="time"
        y-axis-type="linear"
        complete-series-config="[[seriesConfig]]"
        data-extents="[[dataExtents]]"
        width="[[width]]"
        height="[[height]]"
        margin="[[margin]]"
        chart-data={{chartData}}
        x="{{x}}"
        y="{{y}}"
        domainChanged="{{domainChanged}}"
        selected-domain="[[selectedDomain]]">
      </px-vis-scale>
      <px-vis-line-canvas
        series-id="mySeries"
        complete-series-config="[[seriesConfig]]"
        chart-data="[[chartData]]"
        x="[[x]]"
        y="[[y]]"
        width="[[width]]"
        height="[[height]]"
        margin="[[margin]]"
        canvas-context="[[canvasContext]]"
        domain-changed="[[domainChanged]]">
        </px-vis-line-canvas>

properties.name: canvasContext
properties.description:
canvasContext is a holder for the instantiated canvas context to draw to.
Must be set in ready and passed to all components so they know whom to draw to.

properties.name: canvasLayers
properties.description: An array of the generated layers

properties.name: completeSeriesConfig
properties.description: A configuration file generated by the chart behavior based on seriesConfig and defaultSeriesConfig.

properties.name: chartData
properties.description:
container for the data object that drives the chart / component
Generally loaded with an iron-ajax tag (but doesnt have to be)
This can be set declaratively

properties.name: interpolationFunction
properties.description:
A d3 function used to interpolate the series lines.

Can also be a string referencing simple, built in d3 functions:
- `"curveBasis"`
- `"curveBasisClosed"`
- `"curveBasisOpen"`
- `"curveLinear"`
- `"curveLinearClosed"`
- `"curveMonotoneX"`
- `"curveMonotoneY"`
- `"curveNatural"`
- `"curveStep"`
- `"curveStepAfter"`
- `"curveStepBefore"`

See: https://github.com/d3/d3-shape/blob/master/README.md#curves

properties.name: lineRadiusLimit
properties.description:
sets a minimum value for the line amplitude. Points less than the lineRadiusLimit will be set to the limit

Essentially, it moves a point that is past the center into the visible axis area on the opposite side to terminating inside the clip path area, thereby also changing the angle of those connecting lines

Note: radius on a radialLine is equivelent to y on a cartesean line.

properties.name: line
properties.description: A holder object for the line generator

properties.name: seriesId
properties.description: A unique ID for each line series

properties.name: showGaps
properties.description: A boolean spcifying if the line should show gaps on undefined data.

properties.name: timeDomain
properties.description:
Can be used to define a time domain to be used, typically to restrain/filter the amount
of data displayed. Can be used in combination with a px-vis-chart-navigator

properties.name: parallelCoordinates
properties.description: A dev set boolean specifying if the chart is for a parallel coordinates chart

properties.name: radialLine
properties.description: A dev set boolean specifying if the line is using radial(polar) data

properties.name: gradientLine
properties.description: A boolean spceifying if a opacity gradient should get applied to the line

properties.name: _colorArr
properties.description: Gets and saves the rgb so we can make an rgba to apply to the line

properties.name: multiPath
properties.description: A boolean spcifying if multiple paths get drawn by the line

properties.name: _currentDrawingOptions
properties.description: Options currently in use for drawing lines: opacity, color, etc.

properties.name: x
properties.description:
x is a holder for the d3 instantiated scale object
Must be set in the svg component and passed to all components so they know the drawing scale.
This can be set declaratively

See: https://github.com/d3/d3/blob/master/API.md#scales-d3-scale

properties.name: y
properties.description:
y is a holder for the d3 instantiated scale object
Must be set in the svg component and passed to all components so they know the drawing scale.
This can be set declaratively

See: https://github.com/d3/d3/blob/master/API.md#scales-d3-scale

properties.name: width
properties.description: The width of the elem; generally the width of the charting area for most components

properties.name: height
properties.description: The height of the component; generally the height of the charting area for most components.

properties.name: _defaultMargin
properties.description: Copy of the default margin for checking if it has changed

properties.name: margin
properties.description: Defines the base margin for the chart. Calcs are run to add to the margin to accommodate axes and other elements which exist within the SVG frame, but outside the chart frame.

properties.name: offset
properties.description: An optional offset for a variety of elements

properties.name: mutedSeries
properties.description:
A list of user selected muted series. Tied declaratively to series components

The series name is the key and the value is a boolean for whether it is muted or not:

```
{
    'seriesId1':true,
    'seriesId2':false,
 }
```

In this example, seriesId1 is muted. seriesId2 was muted, but has been turned back on.

properties.name: hardMute
properties.description:
Allows for a "hard" muting of the series/categories: the
series/category won't show up
in the tooltip anymore, it's tooltip data won't be shown in the register
and its extents won't be taken into account by the chart

properties.name: categoryKey
properties.description: A dev set string speciying which key to use as the category to use to color the series lines

properties.name: categories
properties.description: A dev set array defining the categories values.

properties.name: selectedDomain
properties.description:
New chart extents selected by the user

Serves as a trigger for the scale component to redefine the chart extents

properties.name: serieToRedrawOnTop
properties.description:
Array containing a set of series to redraw on top of everything (in the order
they are found in this array)

properties.name: domainChanged
properties.description:
Number which increments up when the domain(s) has(have) changed.

0 (false) indicates that domains have not been set.

Serves as a trigger for many elements to redraw.

properties.name: preventInitialDrawing
properties.description: blocks initial drawings of axis until set to false

properties.name: _isAttached
properties.description: Boolean tracking if we are attached

properties.name: counterClockwise
properties.description: whether the polar data should be interpreted clockwise or counter-clockwise

properties.name: useDegrees
properties.description: Whether the angle data should be processed as degrees, as opposed to be processed as radians

properties.name: rendererType
properties.description:
Type of renderer this drawing element should be using. Determines on what
condition the element is going to be drawn
- chartData
- filteredChartData
- highlightData

properties.name: clipPath
properties.description: Whether to use the clipPath to avoid drawing outside of the axes.

properties.name: _dynamicProperties
properties.description: A list of the dynamic properties

properties.name: mutedOpacity
properties.description: The opacity value of the fill to be used when muting a series (stroke is not drawn on mute).

properties.name: _clipData
properties.description: Holder for clipPath data.

methods.name: _isValidData
methods.description: returns true if the data is valid: non NaN, null or undefined

methods.name: _isDataNotNull
methods.description: returns true if the data is not null

methods.name: _defineRadialLine
methods.description: Defines a multi-scale d3 line generator and its attrs

methods.name: _isObjEmpty
methods.description: Checks to see if an object is empty

methods.name: _isD3Empty
methods.description: Checks to see if an d3 obj is empty

methods.name: _doesD3HaveValues
methods.description: Checks to see if an d3 obj has something

methods.name: _doesObjHaveValues
methods.description: Checks to see if an object has values

methods.name: _isVarDefined
methods.description: Checks to see if an object is defined

methods.name: _isVarUndefined
methods.description: Checks to see if an object is defined

methods.name: _escapeCssSelector
methods.description: escapes '.' in css selectors so that we can appropriately select stuff with dots in thei ids

methods.name: _checkThemeVariable
methods.description: Checks if a theme variable exists, if so, returns the theme value, if not, returns the default

methods.name: _hexToRgb
methods.description: converts a hex to rgb color

methods.name: _binarySearch
methods.description: Binary search through sorted chartData

methods.name: _fuzzyBinarySearch
methods.description: Binary search through sorted chartData returning all vals within a window

methods.name: clone
methods.description: deep-copy object into newObject

methods.name: _computeGradientRange
methods.description: Computes the data range.

methods.name: _getLineColor
methods.description: Returns the correct color to use for the line.

methods.name: _defineSingleLine
methods.description: Defines the d3 line generator and its attrs

methods.name: _defineMultiLine
methods.description: Defines a multi-scale d3 line generator and its attrs

methods.name: _processYValues
methods.description:
This functions process Y axis and applies the result to some variable.
If in single Y it just run the function and assign the result to `result`, if multi Y
it runs the function for each axis and stores the result against the axis key
on `result`

methods.name: _getPixelCoordForRadialData
methods.description:
Returns pixel coordinates for data values. [0,0] is the center of the
radial drawing, not the top left corner

methods.name: _adjustAngleForPolarChart
methods.description:
adjusts the angle for the polar chart, taking counterClockwise into account
and returning it in the asked unit (degrees if toDegrees is true)

methods.name: _computeValue
methods.description: Decides if it should use a default or user specified value

methods.name: _processConfig
methods.description: sets each property listed in dynamicProperies

methods.name: _watchConfigProperty
methods.description: Cycles through properties and adds them to dynamic properties

methods.name: initializeDrawingSession
methods.description:
Defines the appropriate line generator and updates drawing
variables: opacity, colors, etc.

methods.name: drawClipPath
methods.description: Draws a clip path for canvas.

methods.name: _drawRadarClipPath
methods.description: Draws a clip path for radar.

methods.name: _drawRectClipPath
methods.description: Draws a rectangular clip path for cartesian charts.

methods.name: _generateRadarClipData
methods.description: Generates the edges for the radar clip path.

elements.description:
### Usage

    <px-vis-svg
        ...
        svg="{{svg}}">
    </px-vis-svg>
    <px-vis-scale
        ...
        x="{{x}}"
        y="{{y}}"
        domain-changed="{{domainChanged}}">
    </px-vis-scale>
    <px-vis-interaction-space
        ...
        generating-crosshair-data="{{generatingCrosshairData}}"
        crosshair-data="{{crosshairData}}">
    </px-vis-interaction-space>

    <px-vis-highlight-line
        svg="[[svg]]"
        x="[[x]]"
        y="[[y]]"
        domain-changed="[[domainChanged]]"
        time-data="[[key]]"
        complete-series-config="[[completeSeriesConfig]]"
        chart-data="[[chartData]]"
        generating-crosshair-data="[[generatingCrosshairData]]"
        crosshair-data="[[crosshairData]]">
    </px-vis-highlight-line>

properties.name: crosshairData
generatingCrosshairData
properties.description: Bool indicating if interaction space is currently generating data

properties.name: crosshairPixelSearch
properties.description:
Allows the crosshair to search all datapoints within a pixel radius. If set
to 0 will only pick up the closest point

properties.name: completeSeriesConfig
properties.description: A configuration file generated by the chart behavior based on seriesConfig and defaultSeriesConfig.

properties.name: seriesId
properties.description: A unique ID for each line series

properties.name: categoryKey
properties.description: A dev set string speciying which key to use as the category to use to color the series lines

properties.name: categories
properties.description: A dev set array defining the categories values.

properties.description:
A list of user selected muted series. Tied declaratively to series components

The series name is the key and the value is a boolean for whether it is muted or not:

```
{
    'seriesId1':true,
    'seriesId2':false,
 }
```

In this example, seriesId1 is muted. seriesId2 was muted, but has been turned back on.

properties.name: hardMute

Allows for a "hard" muting of the series/categories: the
series/category won't show up
in the tooltip anymore, it's tooltip data won't be shown in the register
and its extents won't be taken into account by the chart

properties.name: axes
properties.description:
Represents all axes plotted by the chart, including muted ones.
It doesn't guarantee to have the same order as the current visual
representation.
Can be set by the developer to define which axes to plot

properties.name: dimensions
properties.description:
An array of dimensions (axes) which the chart uses. This array represents
the current state of all axes: muted axes won't be included and the
array is ordered based on the current visual representation.
Do not set at a chart level, only read

properties.name: seriesKey
properties.description: A string specifying which key to use as the series

properties.name: domainChanged
properties.description:
Number which increments up when the domain(s) has(have) changed.

0 (false) indicates that domains have not been set.

Serves as a trigger for many elements to redraw.

properties.name: _dynamicProperties
properties.description: A list of the dynamic properties

properties.name: counterClockwise
properties.description: whether the polar data should be interpreted clockwise or counter-clockwise

properties.name: useDegrees
properties.description: Whether the angle data should be processed as degrees, as opposed to be processed as radians

properties.name: differentDataset
properties.description:
Boolean indicating if the dataset on this chart is different than the one on the crosshairData's origin chart.

NOTE: The chartData passed into the chart MUST be sorted by the timeData for differentDataset to work. This component will not work with unsorted data.

properties.name: fuzz
properties.description: The amount +/- around the datapoint

properties.name: timeData
properties.description: Name of the variable holding the time stamp in the data

properties.name: layersToMask
properties.description: The layers where the series are drawn if you want them to mute on crosshair data

properties.name: drawWithLocalCrosshairData
properties.description: By default, a highlighter will not react to crosshairData if generatingCrosshairData is true. This boolean forces it to draw the crosshairData regardless of the value of generatingCrosshairData

properties.name: parallelCoordinates
properties.description: A dev set boolean specifying if the chart is for a parallel coordinates chart

properties.name: radialLine
properties.description: A dev set boolean specifying if the line is using radial(polar) data

properties.name: tooltipData
defaultEmptyData
properties.description: The "empty" dataset that should be used for tooltipData when not hovering

methods.name: _computeValue

methods.name: _processConfig
methods.description: sets each property listed in dynamicProperies

methods.name: _watchConfigProperty
methods.description: Cycles through properties and adds them to dynamic properties

methods.name: _getPixelCoordForRadialData
methods.description:
Returns pixel coordinates for data values. [0,0] is the center of the
radial drawing, not the top left corner

methods.name: _adjustAngleForPolarChart
methods.description:
adjusts the angle for the polar chart, taking counterClockwise into account
and returning it in the asked unit (degrees if toDegrees is true)

methods.name: _resetTooltipData
methods.description:
Helper function called on mouseout
resets tooltipData

methods.name: _calcDataset
methods.description: Determines if we should do a regular binary search or a fuzzy binary search

methods.name: _computeChartData
methods.description:
Draws the crosshair elements and sets up listeners and callbacks on chart hover
Sets the crosshairData property which gets passed to the register.

attributes.name: width
attributes.description: The width of the elem; generally the width of the charting area for most components

attributes.name: height
attributes.description: The height of the component; generally the height of the charting area for most components.

attributes.name: margin
attributes.description: Defines the base margin for the chart. Calcs are run to add to the margin to accommodate axes and other elements which exist within the SVG frame, but outside the chart frame.

attributes.name: offset
attributes.description: An optional offset for a variety of elements

attributes.name: canvas-context
attributes.description:
canvasContext is a holder for the instantiated canvas context to draw to.
Must be set in ready and passed to all components so they know whom to draw to.

attributes.name: canvas-layers
attributes.description: An array of the generated layers

attributes.name: x
attributes.description:
x is a holder for the d3 instantiated scale object
Must be set in the svg component and passed to all components so they know the drawing scale.
This can be set declaratively

See: https://github.com/d3/d3/blob/master/API.md#scales-d3-scale

attributes.name: y
attributes.description:
y is a holder for the d3 instantiated scale object
Must be set in the svg component and passed to all components so they know the drawing scale.
This can be set declaratively

See: https://github.com/d3/d3/blob/master/API.md#scales-d3-scale

attributes.name: chart-data
attributes.description:
container for the data object that drives the chart / component
Generally loaded with an iron-ajax tag (but doesnt have to be)
This can be set declaratively

attributes.name: crosshair-data
generating-crosshair-data
attributes.description: Bool indicating if interaction space is currently generating data

attributes.name: crosshair-pixel-search
attributes.description:
Allows the crosshair to search all datapoints within a pixel radius. If set
to 0 will only pick up the closest point

attributes.name: complete-series-config
attributes.description: A configuration file generated by the chart behavior based on seriesConfig and defaultSeriesConfig.

attributes.name: series-id
attributes.description: A unique ID for each line series

attributes.name: category-key
attributes.description: A dev set string speciying which key to use as the category to use to color the series lines

attributes.name: categories
attributes.description: A dev set array defining the categories values.

attributes.name: clip-path
attributes.description: Whether to use the clipPath to avoid drawing outside of the axes.

attributes.name: muted-series
attributes.description:
A list of user selected muted series. Tied declaratively to series components

The series name is the key and the value is a boolean for whether it is muted or not:

```
{
    'seriesId1':true,
    'seriesId2':false,
 }
```

In this example, seriesId1 is muted. seriesId2 was muted, but has been turned back on.

attributes.name: hard-mute
attributes.description:
Allows for a "hard" muting of the series/categories: the
series/category won't show up
in the tooltip anymore, it's tooltip data won't be shown in the register
and its extents won't be taken into account by the chart

attributes.name: axes
attributes.description:
Represents all axes plotted by the chart, including muted ones.
It doesn't guarantee to have the same order as the current visual
representation.
Can be set by the developer to define which axes to plot

attributes.name: dimensions
attributes.description:
An array of dimensions (axes) which the chart uses. This array represents
the current state of all axes: muted axes won't be included and the
array is ordered based on the current visual representation.
Do not set at a chart level, only read

attributes.name: series-key
attributes.description: A string specifying which key to use as the series

attributes.name: domain-changed
attributes.description:
Number which increments up when the domain(s) has(have) changed.

0 (false) indicates that domains have not been set.

Serves as a trigger for many elements to redraw.

attributes.name: counter-clockwise
attributes.description: whether the polar data should be interpreted clockwise or counter-clockwise

attributes.name: use-degrees
attributes.description: Whether the angle data should be processed as degrees, as opposed to be processed as radians

attributes.name: different-dataset
attributes.description:
Boolean indicating if the dataset on this chart is different than the one on the crosshairData's origin chart.

NOTE: The chartData passed into the chart MUST be sorted by the timeData for differentDataset to work. This component will not work with unsorted data.

attributes.name: fuzz
attributes.description: The amount +/- around the datapoint

attributes.name: time-data
attributes.description: Name of the variable holding the time stamp in the data

attributes.name: layers-to-mask
attributes.description: The layers where the series are drawn if you want them to mute on crosshair data

attributes.name: draw-with-local-crosshair-data
attributes.description: By default, a highlighter will not react to crosshairData if generatingCrosshairData is true. This boolean forces it to draw the crosshairData regardless of the value of generatingCrosshairData

attributes.name: parallel-coordinates
attributes.description: A dev set boolean specifying if the chart is for a parallel coordinates chart

attributes.name: radial-line
attributes.description: A dev set boolean specifying if the line is using radial(polar) data

attributes.name: tooltip-data
default-empty-data
attributes.description: The "empty" dataset that should be used for tooltipData when not hovering

attributes.name: interpolation-function
attributes.description:
A d3 function used to interpolate the series lines.

Can also be a string referencing simple, built in d3 functions:
- `"curveBasis"`
- `"curveBasisClosed"`
- `"curveBasisOpen"`
- `"curveLinear"`
- `"curveLinearClosed"`
- `"curveMonotoneX"`
- `"curveMonotoneY"`
- `"curveNatural"`
- `"curveStep"`
- `"curveStepAfter"`
- `"curveStepBefore"`

See: https://github.com/d3/d3-shape/blob/master/README.md#curves

elements.description:
### Usage

    <px-vis-svg
        ...
        svg="{{svg}}">
    </px-vis-svg>
    <px-vis-scale
        ...
        x="{{x}}"
        y="{{y}}"
        domain-changed="{{domainChanged}}">
    </px-vis-scale>
    <px-vis-interaction-space
        ...
        generating-crosshair-data="{{generatingCrosshairData}}"
        crosshair-data="{{crosshairData}}">
    </px-vis-interaction-space>

    <px-vis-highlight-line
        id="highlighter"
        margin="[[margin]]"
        svg="[[layer.1]]"
        layers-to-mask="[[layer.0]]"
        x="[[x]]"
        y="[[y]]"
        parallel-coordinates
        dimensions="[[dimensions]]"
        domain-changed="[[domainChanged]]"
        time-data="[[seriesKey]]"
        complete-series-config="[[completeSeriesConfig]]"
        series-id="[[seriesKey]]"
        category-key="[[categoryKey]]"
        categories="[[categories]]"
        chart-data="[[chartData]]"
        generating-crosshair-data="[[generatingCrosshairData]]"
        crosshair-data="[[crosshairData]]"
        default-empty-data="{{defaultEmptyData}}">
    </px-vis-highlight-line>

methods.name: generateRandomID
methods.description:
Generates a random id string.

Takes a string prefix, then adds 10 random chars

methods.name: cloneSVGElem
methods.description:
Clones a SVG elem and sets a component property with the d3 instance of that clone.

The intent of this is to clone the high level 'g' elem we draw to and attach it.
The draw order matters  in SVG and we want the some stuff to appear on top of everything else
Since we cannot easily ensure it draw order with components, we can stick top level items in a different 'g' that we know is drawn after the main 'g'

methods.name: _drawSVGOnCanvas
methods.description: Draws the current svg into a canvas

methods.name: _drawCanvg
methods.description:
Uses canvg third party to "translate" svg to javascript instructions
for the canvas, and draw on the canvas

methods.name: _nativeDrawSvgOnCanvas
methods.description: Tries to draw the SVG to canvas and if that doesnt work, falls back on a failure callback

methods.name: _getSVGOuterHtml
methods.description: fix for IE to get outer HTML

methods.name: _processYValues
methods.description:
This functions process Y axis and applies the result to some variable.
If in single Y it just run the function and assign the result to `result`, if multi Y
it runs the function for each axis and stores the result against the axis key
on `result`

elements.description:
### Usage

    <px-vis-scale
      x-axis-type="time"
      y-axis-type="linear"
      complete-series-config="[[seriesConfig]]"
      data-extents="[[dataExtents]]"
      width="[[width]]"
      height="[[height]]"
      margin="[[margin]]"
      chart-data="{{chartData}}"
      x="{{x}}"
      y="{{y}}"
      domain-changed="{{domainChanged}}"
      selected-domain="[[selectedDomain]]">
    </px-vis-scale>
    <px-vis-svg
      width="[[width]]"
      height="[[height]]"
      margin="[[margin]]"
      svg="{{svg}}">
    </px-vis-svg>
    <px-vis-scatter-canvas
      svg="[[svg]]"
      series-id="mySeries"
      complete-series-config="[[seriesConfig]]"
      chart-data="[[chartData]]"
      width="[[width]]"
      height="[[height]]"
      margin="[[margin]]"
      x="[[x]]"
      y="[[y]]"
      domain-changed="[[domainChanged]]">
    </px-vis-scatter-canvas>

properties.name: lineRadiusLimit
properties.description:
sets a minimum value for the line amplitude. Points less than the lineRadiusLimit will be set to the limit

Essentially, it moves a point that is past the center into the visible axis area on the opposite side to terminating inside the clip path area, thereby also changing the angle of those connecting lines

Note: radius on a radialLine is equivelent to y on a cartesean line.

properties.name: _isAttached
properties.description: Boolean tracking if we are attached

properties.name: markerMapping
properties.description:
Maps dev input marker string to d3 symbols.

To add additional, custom icons, provide a draw function wrapped in an object and draw your shape using canvas drawing methods. See 'bar' or 'x' as examples

properties.name: markerSymbol
properties.description:
The symbol used for the marker. Supported symbols:
- 'circle'
- 'cross'
- 'diamond'
- 'square'
- 'triangle-up'
- 'star'
- 'wye'
more info at https://github.com/d3/d3-shape/blob/master/README.md#symbols
This property will be read from the completeSeriesConfig

Some additional "custom" types are also available:
- 'bar'
- 'thin-bar'
- 'thick-bar'
- 'x'

properties.name: markerScale
properties.description:
Scales the size of the scatter marker
This property will be read from the completeSeriesConfig

properties.name: markerSize
properties.description:
the size of the markers
This property will be read from the completeSeriesConfig

properties.name: markerFillOpacity
properties.description:
The opacity of the fill (inside) of the marker
This property will be read from the completeSeriesConfig

properties.name: markerStrokeOpacity
properties.description:
The opacity of the stroke (outside) of the marker
This property will be read from the completeSeriesConfig

properties.name: mutedOpacity
properties.description:
the opacity value of the fill to be used when muting a serie (stroke is not drawn on mute)
This property will be read from the completeSeriesConfig

properties.name: rendererType
properties.description:
Type of renderer this drawing element should be using. Determines on what
condition the element is going to be drawn
- chartData
- filteredChartData
- highlightData

properties.name: clipPath
properties.description: Whether to use the clipPath to avoid drawing outside of the axes.

properties.name: showArrows
properties.description: Boolean to indicate if arrows should be drawn

properties.name: arrowConfig
properties.description:
Configuration options for the arrow
- `symbol`: the symbol name from `markerMapping`. Default: `caret
- `size`: the size of the symbol.
- `scale`: the scale of the symbol (another way to size). Default: 1
- `minLength`: the minimum segment length between points which should get an arrow. Lengths below this min value will not get an arrow. Default: 10

properties.name: seriesNumber
properties.description: The index of the series, used for calculating its color.

properties.name: radial
properties.description: Whether the scatter plot is using radial coordinates (x=phase, y=amplitude).

properties.name: timeData
properties.description: Name of the variable holding the time stamp in the data. Used for non-timeseries charts.

properties.name: _currentDrawingOptions
properties.description: Options currently in use for drawing scatter: opacity, symbol, drawing function, etc.

methods.name: _processYValues
methods.description:
This functions process Y axis and applies the result to some variable.
If in single Y it just run the function and assign the result to `result`, if multi Y
it runs the function for each axis and stores the result against the axis key
on `result`

methods.name: _isValidData
methods.description: returns true if the data is valid: non NaN, null or undefined

methods.name: _isDataNotNull
methods.description: returns true if the data is not null

methods.name: _isObjEmpty
methods.description: Checks to see if an object is empty

methods.name: _isD3Empty
methods.description: Checks to see if an d3 obj is empty

methods.name: _doesD3HaveValues
methods.description: Checks to see if an d3 obj has something

methods.name: _doesObjHaveValues
methods.description: Checks to see if an object has values

methods.name: _isVarDefined
methods.description: Checks to see if an object is defined

methods.name: _isVarUndefined
methods.description: Checks to see if an object is defined

methods.name: _escapeCssSelector
methods.description: escapes '.' in css selectors so that we can appropriately select stuff with dots in thei ids

methods.name: _checkThemeVariable
methods.description: Checks if a theme variable exists, if so, returns the theme value, if not, returns the default

methods.name: _hexToRgb
methods.description: converts a hex to rgb color

methods.name: _binarySearch
methods.description: Binary search through sorted chartData

methods.name: _fuzzyBinarySearch
methods.description: Binary search through sorted chartData returning all vals within a window

methods.name: clone
methods.description: deep-copy object into newObject

methods.name: _defineRadialLine
methods.description: Defines a multi-scale d3 line generator and its attrs

methods.name: _getPixelCoordForRadialData
methods.description:
Returns pixel coordinates for data values. [0,0] is the center of the
radial drawing, not the top left corner

methods.name: _adjustAngleForPolarChart
methods.description:
adjusts the angle for the polar chart, taking counterClockwise into account
and returning it in the asked unit (degrees if toDegrees is true)

methods.name: _computeValue
methods.description: Decides if it should use a default or user specified value

methods.name: _processConfig
methods.description: sets each property listed in dynamicProperies

methods.name: _watchConfigProperty
methods.description: Cycles through properties and adds them to dynamic properties

methods.name: initializeDrawingSession
methods.description:
Defines the appropriate line and symbol generators,
and updates drawing variables: opacity, colors, etc.

methods.name: drawClipPath
methods.description: Draws a clip path for the canvas.

methods.name: renderOneBatch
methods.description:
Renders one batch of scatter data (can be one batch during progressive rendering
or all data during render at once).

attributes.name: canvas-context
attributes.description:
canvasContext is a holder for the instantiated canvas context to draw to.
Must be set in ready and passed to all components so they know whom to draw to.

attributes.name: canvas-layers
attributes.description: An array of the generated layers

attributes.name: x
attributes.description:
x is a holder for the d3 instantiated scale object
Must be set in the svg component and passed to all components so they know the drawing scale.
This can be set declaratively

See: https://github.com/d3/d3/blob/master/API.md#scales-d3-scale

attributes.name: y
attributes.description:
y is a holder for the d3 instantiated scale object
Must be set in the svg component and passed to all components so they know the drawing scale.
This can be set declaratively

See: https://github.com/d3/d3/blob/master/API.md#scales-d3-scale

attributes.name: chart-data
attributes.description:
container for the data object that drives the chart / component
Generally loaded with an iron-ajax tag (but doesnt have to be)
This can be set declaratively

attributes.name: complete-series-config
attributes.description: A configuration file generated by the chart behavior based on seriesConfig and defaultSeriesConfig.

attributes.name: muted-series
attributes.description:
A list of user selected muted series. Tied declaratively to series components

The series name is the key and the value is a boolean for whether it is muted or not:

```
{
    'seriesId1':true,
    'seriesId2':false,
 }
```

In this example, seriesId1 is muted. seriesId2 was muted, but has been turned back on.

attributes.name: hard-mute
attributes.description:
Allows for a "hard" muting of the series/categories: the
series/category won't show up
in the tooltip anymore, it's tooltip data won't be shown in the register
and its extents won't be taken into account by the chart

attributes.name: interpolation-function
attributes.description:
A d3 function used to interpolate the series lines.

Can also be a string referencing simple, built in d3 functions:
- `"curveBasis"`
- `"curveBasisClosed"`
- `"curveBasisOpen"`
- `"curveLinear"`
- `"curveLinearClosed"`
- `"curveMonotoneX"`
- `"curveMonotoneY"`
- `"curveNatural"`
- `"curveStep"`
- `"curveStepAfter"`
- `"curveStepBefore"`

See: https://github.com/d3/d3-shape/blob/master/README.md#curves

attributes.name: line-radius-limit
attributes.description:
sets a minimum value for the line amplitude. Points less than the lineRadiusLimit will be set to the limit

Essentially, it moves a point that is past the center into the visible axis area on the opposite side to terminating inside the clip path area, thereby also changing the angle of those connecting lines

Note: radius on a radialLine is equivelent to y on a cartesean line.

attributes.name: line
attributes.description: A holder object for the line generator

attributes.name: tooltip-data
default-empty-data
attributes.description: The "empty" dataset that should be used for tooltipData when not hovering

attributes.name: domain-changed
attributes.description:
Number which increments up when the domain(s) has(have) changed.

0 (false) indicates that domains have not been set.

Serves as a trigger for many elements to redraw.

attributes.name: counter-clockwise
attributes.description: whether the polar data should be interpreted clockwise or counter-clockwise

attributes.name: use-degrees
attributes.description: Whether the angle data should be processed as degrees, as opposed to be processed as radians

attributes.name: series-id
attributes.description: A unique ID for each line series

attributes.name: serie-to-redraw-on-top
attributes.description:
Array containing a set of series to redraw on top of everything (in the order
they are found in this array)

attributes.name: prevent-initial-drawing
attributes.description: blocks initial drawings of axis until set to false

attributes.name: marker-mapping
attributes.description:
Maps dev input marker string to d3 symbols.

To add additional, custom icons, provide a draw function wrapped in an object and draw your shape using canvas drawing methods. See 'bar' or 'x' as examples

- 'x'

elements.description:
### Usage

    <px-vis-svg
        ...
        svg="{{svg}}">
    </px-vis-svg>
    <px-vis-scale
        ...
        x="{{x}}"
        y="{{y}}"
        domain-changed="{{domainChanged}}">
    </px-vis-scale>
    <px-vis-interaction-space
        ...
        generating-crosshair-data="{{generatingCrosshairData}}"
        crosshair-data="{{crosshairData}}">
    </px-vis-interaction-space>

    <px-vis-highlight-point-canvas
        svg="[[svg]]"
        x="[[x]]"
        y="[[y]]"
        domain-changed="[[domainChanged]]"
        time-data="[[key]]"
        complete-series-config="[[completeSeriesConfig]]"
        chart-data="[[chartData]]"
        generating-crosshair-data="[[generatingCrosshairData]]"
        crosshair-data="[[crosshairData]]">
    </px-vis-highlight-point-canvas>

properties.description: The height of the component; generally the height of the charting area for most components.

properties.description: Copy of the default margin for checking if it has changed

properties.description: Defines the base margin for the chart. Calcs are run to add to the margin to accommodate axes and other elements which exist within the SVG frame, but outside the chart frame.

properties.name: useDegrees
properties.description: Whether the angle data should be processed as degrees, as opposed to be processed as radians

properties.description:
Boolean indicating if the dataset on this chart is different than the one on the crosshairData's origin chart.

NOTE: The chartData passed into the chart MUST be sorted by the timeData for differentDataset to work. This component will not work with unsorted data.

properties.name: fuzz
properties.description: The amount +/- around the datapoint

properties.name: timeData
properties.description: Name of the variable holding the time stamp in the data

properties.name: layersToMask
properties.description: The layers where the series are drawn if you want them to mute on crosshair data

properties.name: drawWithLocalCrosshairData
properties.description: By default, a highlighter will not react to crosshairData if generatingCrosshairData is true. This boolean forces it to draw the crosshairData regardless of the value of generatingCrosshairData

defaultEmptyData

methods.name: generateRandomID
methods.description:
Generates a random id string.

Takes a string prefix, then adds 10 random chars

methods.name: cloneSVGElem
methods.description:
Clones a SVG elem and sets a component property with the d3 instance of that clone.

The intent of this is to clone the high level 'g' elem we draw to and attach it.
The draw order matters  in SVG and we want the some stuff to appear on top of everything else
Since we cannot easily ensure it draw order with components, we can stick top level items in a different 'g' that we know is drawn after the main 'g'

for the canvas, and draw on the canvas

methods.description: Tries to draw the SVG to canvas and if that doesnt work, falls back on a failure callback

methods.name: _getSVGOuterHtml
methods.description: fix for IE to get outer HTML

methods.name: _processYValues
methods.description:
This functions process Y axis and applies the result to some variable.
If in single Y it just run the function and assign the result to `result`, if multi Y
it runs the function for each axis and stores the result against the axis key
on `result`

attributes.name: height

attributes.name: margin
attributes.description: Defines the base margin for the chart. Calcs are run to add to the margin to accommodate axes and other elements which exist within the SVG frame, but outside the chart frame.

attributes.name: offset
attributes.description: An optional offset for a variety of elements

attributes.name: svg
attributes.description:
svg is a holder for the d3 instantiated svg container to draw to.
Must be set in ready and passed to all components so they know whom to draw to.

attributes.name: px-svg-elem
attributes.description: The SVG element inside the chart - not a D3 selected element.

attributes.name: x
attributes.description:
x is a holder for the d3 instantiated scale object
Must be set in the svg component and passed to all components so they know the drawing scale.
This can be set declaratively

See: https://github.com/d3/d3/blob/master/API.md#scales-d3-scale

attributes.name: y
attributes.description:
y is a holder for the d3 instantiated scale object
Must be set in the svg component and passed to all components so they know the drawing scale.
This can be set declaratively

See: https://github.com/d3/d3/blob/master/API.md#scales-d3-scale

attributes.name: chart-data
attributes.description:
container for the data object that drives the chart / component
Generally loaded with an iron-ajax tag (but doesnt have to be)
This can be set declaratively

attributes.name: crosshair-data
generating-crosshair-data
attributes.description: Bool indicating if interaction space is currently generating data

attributes.name: crosshair-pixel-search
attributes.description:
Allows the crosshair to search all datapoints within a pixel radius. If set
to 0 will only pick up the closest point

attributes.name: clip-path
attributes.description: Holder for a clipping path ID

attributes.name: series-clip-path
attributes.description: A more restricting clip path used to limit where the series are being drawn

attributes.name: complete-series-config
attributes.description: A configuration file generated by the chart behavior based on seriesConfig and defaultSeriesConfig.

attributes.name: muted-series
attributes.description:
A list of user selected muted series. Tied declaratively to series components

The series name is the key and the value is a boolean for whether it is muted or not:

```
{
    'seriesId1':true,
    'seriesId2':false,
 }
```

In this example, seriesId1 is muted. seriesId2 was muted, but has been turned back on.

attributes.name: hard-mute
attributes.description:
Allows for a "hard" muting of the series/categories: the
series/category won't show up
in the tooltip anymore, it's tooltip data won't be shown in the register
and its extents won't be taken into account by the chart

attributes.name: series-keys
attributes.description: Representes the keys avaiable in completeSeriesConfig.

attributes.name: series-id
attributes.description: A unique ID for each line series

attributes.name: counter-clockwise
attributes.description: whether the polar data should be interpreted clockwise or counter-clockwise

attributes.name: use-degrees
attributes.description: Whether the angle data should be processed as degrees, as opposed to be processed as radians

attributes.name: different-dataset
attributes.description:
Boolean indicating if the dataset on this chart is different than the one on the crosshairData's origin chart.

NOTE: The chartData passed into the chart MUST be sorted by the timeData for differentDataset to work. This component will not work with unsorted data.

attributes.name: fuzz
attributes.description: The amount +/- around the datapoint

attributes.name: time-data
attributes.description: Name of the variable holding the time stamp in the data

attributes.name: layers-to-mask
attributes.description: The layers where the series are drawn if you want them to mute on crosshair data

attributes.name: draw-with-local-crosshair-data
attributes.description: By default, a highlighter will not react to crosshairData if generatingCrosshairData is true. This boolean forces it to draw the crosshairData regardless of the value of generatingCrosshairData

attributes.name: tooltip-data
default-empty-data
attributes.description: The "empty" dataset that should be used for tooltipData when not hovering

attributes.name: radial
attributes.description: Whether the scatter plot is using radial coiordinates (x=phase, y=amplitude)

elements.description:
Sets the tooltipData property, which can then be used to share adjacent datapoint values with other components, such as the register.

### Usage

    <px-vis-interaction-space
        svg="[[svg]]"
        width="[[width]]"
        height="[[height]]"
        margin="[[margin]]"
        chart-data="[[chartData]]"
        x="[[x]]"
        y="[[y]]"
        tooltip-data="{{tooltipData}}"
        extents-data="{{extentsData}}">
    </px-vis-interaction-space>

### Styling
The following custom properties are available for styling:

Custom property | Description | Default
:----------------|:-------------|----------
  `--px-vis-zoom-brush-outline-color` | The stroke (border) color for the on-chart zoom/selection brush | `$grey6`
  `--px-vis-zoom-brush-fill-color` | The fill (background) color for the on-chart zoom/selection brush | `$gray2`
  `--px-vis-zoom-brush-fill-opacity` | The opacity for the on-chart zoom/selection brush | `0.5`

  `--px-vis-lasso-outline-color` | The stroke (border) color for the on-chart lasso selection | `$grey12`
  `--px-vis-lasso-fill-color` | The fill (background) color for the on-chart lasso selection | `none`
  `--px-vis-lasso-fill-opacity` | The opacity for the on-chart lasso selection | `0.5`

extentsAction
properties.description: Used by the chart to interpret if extentsData is strip or zoom

properties.name: xAxisType
properties.description:
Sets the type of data for the x values

Valid entries are:
- `ordinal`: for discrete input domains, such as names or categories.
- `scaleBand`: another ordinal type meant to create a bar instead of a point.
- `time`: for time domains.
- `timeLocal`: for local time domains.
- `linear`: for continuous input domains, such as numbers.
- `log`: for continuous input domains displayed logarithmicly. NOTE: Per d3 docs, this scale cannot cross or include 0.
- `pie`: for pie/donut charts

properties.name: yAxisType
properties.description:
Sets the type of data for the y values

Valid entries are:
- `ordinal`: for discrete input domains, such as names or categories.
- `scaleBand`: another ordinal type meant to create a bar instead of a point.
- `linear`: for continuous input domains, such as numbers.
- `log`: for continuous input domains, such as numbers.
- `pie`: for pie/donut charts

properties.name: selectionType
properties.description:
The zoom selection type:
- xy
- xAxis
- yAxis

properties.name: seriesKeys
properties.description: Representes the keys avaiable in completeSeriesConfig.

properties.name: counterClockwise
properties.description: whether the polar data should be interpreted clockwise or counter-clockwise

properties.name: useDegrees
properties.description: Whether the angle data should be processed as degrees, as opposed to be processed as radians

properties.name: actionConfig
properties.description:
Configuration used to define what actions happen on events.
Each key represents an event, each value can be:
- a predefined action found in px-vis-interaction-space `actionMapping`
- a function, where `this` will be bound to the chart and the function's argument will be the mouse position on the chart

properties.name: handlersCount
properties.description: how many handlers are currently setup for each event type

properties.name: preventWebWorkerSynchronization
properties.description:
Prevents the chart from synchronizing its data with a webworker.
This can be turned on to minimize the memory footprint of the
chart
WARNING: turning the synchronization off will:
- prevent the chart from being able to use crosshair feature
- slow down data search for tooltip/register
- slow down calculating extents for the chart if it needs to

We advise against turning it off but it might be beneficial in
specific scenarios (high number of small charts with minimum
interaction for example)

properties.name: wwDataSyncCounter
properties.description:
Updated every time the chart gets new data and a sync request
to the web worker happened. Use it for triggering observers
instead of chartData if the observer needs the data in the webworker
(i.e kicking another webworker processing)

properties.name: _iconCallbackQueue
properties.description: A list of methods that should be called in order to load the icon, position it, etc

properties.description: An object that contains meta data for the area drawn by the user.

properties.description: The actual mouse svg rectangle which can be used to activate the tooltip.

properties.name: timeData
properties.description: Name of the variable holding the time stamp in the data. Used for non timeseries charts.

properties.name: actionMapping
properties.description: Set of predefined actions that can be used out of the box.

properties.name: showTooltip
properties.description: If false, will pass `hidden: true` in the tooltip data.

properties.name: radial
properties.description: Whether the scatter plot is using radial coordinates (x=phase, y=amplitude).

properties.description: Whether tooltip data is currently being searched for.

properties.description: Whether pinMarker data is currently being searched for.

properties.description: Whether crosshair data is currently being searched for.

methods.name: _finishActionBox

Helper function called on mouseup.action.
Gets the size of the action area rectangle, sets the extents, and removes it.

attributes.description: The search radius for quadtree searches. Only points inside this radius will be returned.

attributes.name: chart-id
attributes.description: Unique ID of the chart owning this interaction space.

attributes.name: search-type
attributes.description: the tooltip/crosshair search: closestPoint, pointPerSeries, allInArea, polygon

attributes.name: search-for
attributes.description: the tooltip search for: `timestamp`, `point`

attributes.name: icon-type
attributes.description: Name of the icon type.

attributes.name: cursor-type
attributes.description:
Type of cursor drawing to add:
 - 'none' : default
 - 'crosshair' : draws vertical and horizontal line
 - 'circle' : draws circle of size radius

attributes.name: use-quadtree
attributes.description: Boolean specifying if a quadtree should be created and used for searching.

elements.description:
### Usage

    <px-vis-svg
        ...
        svg="{{svg}}">
    </px-vis-svg>
    <px-vis-scale
        ...
        x="{{x}}"
        y="{{y}}"
        domain-changed="{{domainChanged}}">
    </px-vis-scale>
    <px-vis-interaction-space
        ...
        generating-crosshair-data="{{generatingCrosshairData}}"
        crosshair-data="{{crosshairData}}">
    </px-vis-interaction-space>

    <px-vis-markers
        svg="[[svg]]"
        x="[[x]]"
        y="[[y]]"
        domain-changed="[[domainChanged]]"
        time-data="[[key]]"
        complete-series-config="[[completeSeriesConfig]]"
        chart-data="[[chartData]]"
        generating-crosshair-data="[[generatingCrosshairData]]"
        crosshair-data="[[crosshairData]]">
    </px-vis-markers>

properties.name: width
properties.description: The width of the elem; generally the width of the charting area for most components

properties.name: height
properties.description: The height of the component; generally the height of the charting area for most components.

properties.name: _defaultMargin
properties.description: Copy of the default margin for checking if it has changed

properties.name: margin
properties.description: Defines the base margin for the chart. Calcs are run to add to the margin to accommodate axes and other elements which exist within the SVG frame, but outside the chart frame.

properties.name: offset
properties.description: An optional offset for a variety of elements

properties.name: canvasContext
properties.description:
canvasContext is a holder for the instantiated canvas context to draw to.
Must be set in ready and passed to all components so they know whom to draw to.

properties.name: canvasLayers
properties.description: An array of the generated layers

properties.name: x
properties.description:
x is a holder for the d3 instantiated scale object
Must be set in the svg component and passed to all components so they know the drawing scale.
This can be set declaratively

See: https://github.com/d3/d3/blob/master/API.md#scales-d3-scale

properties.name: y
properties.description:
y is a holder for the d3 instantiated scale object
Must be set in the svg component and passed to all components so they know the drawing scale.
This can be set declaratively

See: https://github.com/d3/d3/blob/master/API.md#scales-d3-scale

properties.description:
container for the data object that drives the chart / component
Generally loaded with an iron-ajax tag (but doesnt have to be)
This can be set declaratively

properties.name: clipPath
properties.description: Holder for a clipping path ID

properties.name: seriesClipPath
properties.description: A more restricting clip path used to limit where the series are being drawn

properties.name: completeSeriesConfig
properties.description: A configuration file generated by the chart behavior based on seriesConfig and defaultSeriesConfig.

properties.name: seriesId
properties.description: A unique ID for each line series

properties.name: _dynamicProperties
properties.description: A list of the dynamic properties

properties.name: markerConfig
properties.description:
Configuration object to define what marker should map to what icon, color, and row.
The object has a key being the marker name, the value being a configuration object for that marker. The configuration object has four properties:
- `color`: A rgb color value for the fill or stroke.
- `priority`: relative priority is used to decide which type of markers draw on top of each other. priority 0 => smaller priority. 2 draws over 1, which itself draws over 0, etc..
- `markerFillOpacity`: the opacity of the inside of the marker
- `markerStrokeOpacity`: the opacity of the outside of the marker
- `markerSymbol`: the symbol type; see below
- `markerSize`: specifies the size of markers
- `markerScale`: allows to scale the size of markers
- `location`: "top" or "bottom"
- `row`: the row number on the top or the bottom, starting at 0
- `showTooltip`: whether a tooltip should be shown on hover
- `firstDateTimeFormat`: used to format the date part of the timestamp in the tooltip
- `secondDateTimeFormat`: used to format the time part of the timestamp in the tooltip
- `separator`: symbol between date and time in the tooltip
- `timezone`: timezone to use for the timestamp in the tooltip
- `tooltipOrientation`: orientation of the tooltip: "left", "right", "bottom", "top"
- `tooltipLabel`: label to be used in the tooltip for this type. If not defined the key
of this type will be used (which should match 'label' in the markerData)

The symbol used for the marker. Supported symbols:
- 'circle'
- 'cross'
- 'diamond'
- 'square'
- 'triangle-up'
- 'star'
- 'wye'
more info at https://github.com/d3/d3-shape/blob/master/README.md#symbols

Some additional "custom" types are also available:
- 'bar'
- 'thin-bar'
- 'thick-bar'
- 'x'
```
Example: {
  'myMarkerType':{
      'fillColor': 'rgb(123,0,0)',
      'markerFillOpacity': 0.5,
      'markerSymbol': 'square',
      'markerSize': 4,
      'location': 'top',
      'row': 1,
      'priority': 10,
      'showTooltip': true,
      'tooltipOrientation': 'top'
  }
}
```

properties.name: markerData
tooltipDetectionRadius
properties.description: how close to a point the mouse has to be before we show a tooltip

properties.name: _tooltipDataResult
properties.description: List of tooltips that can be displayed for current marker

This functions process Y axis and applies the result to some variable.
If in single Y it just run the function and assign the result to `result`, if multi Y
it runs the function for each axis and stores the result against the axis key
on `result`

elements.description:
### Usage
    <px-vis-axis-interaction-space
        svg="[[svg]]"
        width="[[width]]"
        height="[[height]]"
        margin="[[margin]]"
        x="[[x]]"
        y="[[y]]"
        domain-changed="[[domainChanged]]"
        complete-series-config="[[completeSeriesConfig]]"
        dimension="[[dimension]]"
        dimensions="[[dimensions]]"
        series-key="[[seriesKey]]"
        category-key="[[categoryKey]]"
        chart-data="[[chartData]]"
        muted-series="{{mutedSeries}}"
        radial="[[radial]]"
        center-offset="[[centerOffset]]"
        brush-to-remove="[[brushToRemove]]"
        brush-domains="[[brushDomains]]"
        drag-container-elem="[[dragContainerElem]]"
        cartesian-drag-behavior="[[cartesianDragBehavior]]"
        redraw-series="[[redrawSeries]]"
        dynamic-redraw="[[dynamicRedraw]]"
        action-config="[[actionConfig]]">
    </px-vis-axis-interaction-space>

### Styling
The following custom properties are available for styling:

Custom property | Description
:----------------|:-------------
`--px-vis-axis-brush-outline-color` | The stroke (border) color for the brushed box on an axis
`--px-vis-axis-brush-fill-color`  | The fill (background) color for the brushed box on an axis
`--px-vis-axis-brush-fill-opacity`  | The opacity of the brushed box on an axis

properties.name: svg
properties.description:
svg is a holder for the d3 instantiated svg container to draw to.
Must be set in ready and passed to all components so they know whom to draw to.

properties.name: _uniqueIdsUsed
properties.description:
Array of unique IDs generated for this comp. cleaned from global
store on detached

properties.name: pxSvgElem
properties.description: The SVG element inside the chart - not a D3 selected element.

properties.name: x
properties.description:
x is a holder for the d3 instantiated scale object
Must be set in the svg component and passed to all components so they know the drawing scale.
This can be set declaratively

See: https://github.com/d3/d3/blob/master/API.md#scales-d3-scale

properties.name: y
properties.description:
y is a holder for the d3 instantiated scale object
Must be set in the svg component and passed to all components so they know the drawing scale.
This can be set declaratively

See: https://github.com/d3/d3/blob/master/API.md#scales-d3-scale

properties.name: chartData
properties.description:
container for the data object that drives the chart / component
Generally loaded with an iron-ajax tag (but doesnt have to be)
This can be set declaratively

properties.name: completeSeriesConfig
properties.description: A configuration file generated by the chart behavior based on seriesConfig and defaultSeriesConfig.

properties.name: mutedSeries
properties.description:
A list of user selected muted series. Tied declaratively to series components

The series name is the key and the value is a boolean for whether it is muted or not:

```
{
    'seriesId1':true,
    'seriesId2':false,
 }
```

In this example, seriesId1 is muted. seriesId2 was muted, but has been turned back on.

properties.name: hardMute
properties.description:
Allows for a "hard" muting of the series/categories: the
series/category won't show up
in the tooltip anymore, it's tooltip data won't be shown in the register
and its extents won't be taken into account by the chart

properties.name: combinedMutedSeries
properties.description:
Aimed at regrouping all muted series when different behavior can mute
series (multi series for example: brush + navigator + categories)

properties.name: selectedDomain
properties.description:
New chart extents selected by the user

Serves as a trigger for the scale component to redefine the chart extents

properties.name: domainChanged
properties.description:
Number which increments up when the domain(s) has(have) changed.

0 (false) indicates that domains have not been set.

Serves as a trigger for many elements to redraw.

properties.name: centerOffset
properties.description: Used in a radial chart to provide a hole in the center of the chart

properties.name: radial
properties.description: Boolean specifying if the chart is a polar chart or a cartesian chart

properties.name: redrawSeries
properties.description: Boolean to specify if we should redraw the chart series when we move an axis. More of a chart type by chart type configuration rather than a developer configuration. IE, for charts such as multi-y timeseries, it is unnessary. For charts such as parallel coordinates, it is necessary.

properties.name: redrawElems
properties.description: The accompanying array of series elements required to redraw.

properties.name: dynamicRedraw
properties.description: Boolean specifing if the lines should redraw as you move the axis or just at the end.

properties.name: width
properties.description: The width of the elem; generally the width of the charting area for most components

properties.name: height
properties.description: The height of the component; generally the height of the charting area for most components.

properties.name: _defaultMargin
properties.description: Copy of the default margin for checking if it has changed

properties.name: margin
properties.description: Defines the base margin for the chart. Calcs are run to add to the margin to accommodate axes and other elements which exist within the SVG frame, but outside the chart frame.

properties.name: offset
properties.description: An optional offset for a variety of elements

properties.name: axes
properties.description:
Represents all axes plotted by the chart, including muted ones.
It doesn't guarantee to have the same order as the current visual
representation.
Can be set by the developer to define which axes to plot

properties.name: dimensions
properties.description:
An array of dimensions (axes) which the chart uses. This array represents
the current state of all axes: muted axes won't be included and the
array is ordered based on the current visual representation.
Do not set at a chart level, only read

properties.name: seriesKey
properties.description: A string specifying which key to use as the series

properties.name: _dragging
properties.description: Holder for the axis currently being dragged

properties.name: dragBehavior
properties.description: A holder for the drag behavior

properties.name: categoryKey
properties.description: A dev set string speciying which key to use as the category to use to color the series lines

properties.name: categories
properties.description: A dev set array defining the categories values.

properties.name: actionConfig
properties.description:
Configuration used to define what actions happen on events. Each key represents an event,
each value can be:
- a predefined action found in px-vis-interaction-space `actionMapping`
- a function, where `this` will be bound to the chart and the function's argument will be the mouse position on the chart

properties.name: handlersCount
properties.description: how many handlers are currently setup for each event type

properties.name: _iconCallbackQueue
properties.description: A list of methods that should be called in order to load the icon, position it, etc

properties.name: orientation
properties.description:
Defines which side the axis should be on.
 - 'left'
 - 'right'
 - 'bottom'
 - 'top'

properties.name: extentsData
extentsAction
properties.description: Used by the chart to interpret if extentsData is strip or zoom

properties.name: brushDomains
timeDomain
properties.description:
Can be used to define a time domain to be used, typically to restrain/filter the amount
of data displayed. Can be used in combination with a px-vis-chart-navigator

properties.name: dimension
properties.description: The string identifier for the axis

properties.name: _brushElem
properties.description: Holder object for the brush node

properties.name: _brushD3
properties.description: Holder object for the d3 selected brush

properties.name: _previousRange
properties.description: Holder for the original domain

properties.name: _brush
properties.description: Holder for the brush

properties.name: specialActionsList
properties.description: Set of predefined actions that can be used out of the box

properties.name: brushActions
properties.description:
set of actions which should display drawn brushes.
Key is the actionConfig value
value is the brushDomains key

properties.name: actionMapping
properties.description: set of predefined action that can be used out of the box

methods.name: generateRandomID
methods.description:
Generates a random id string.

Takes a string prefix, then adds 10 random chars

methods.name: cloneSVGElem
methods.description:
Clones a SVG elem and sets a component property with the d3 instance of that clone.

The intent of this is to clone the high level 'g' elem we draw to and attach it.
The draw order matters  in SVG and we want the some stuff to appear on top of everything else
Since we cannot easily ensure it draw order with components, we can stick top level items in a different 'g' that we know is drawn after the main 'g'

methods.name: _drawSVGOnCanvas
methods.description: Draws the current svg into a canvas

methods.name: _drawCanvg
methods.description:
Uses canvg third party to "translate" svg to javascript instructions
for the canvas, and draw on the canvas

methods.name: _nativeDrawSvgOnCanvas
methods.description: Tries to draw the SVG to canvas and if that doesnt work, falls back on a failure callback

methods.name: _getSVGOuterHtml
methods.description: fix for IE to get outer HTML

If in single Y it just run the function and assign the result to `result`, if multi Y
it runs the function for each axis and stores the result against the axis key
on `result`

methods.description: Binary search through sorted chartData returning all vals within a window

methods.name: clone
methods.description: deep-copy object into newObject

methods.name: _position
methods.description: helper function to calc the position of an axis

methods.name: transition
methods.description: Defines our transition for axis snapping

methods.name: _onDragStart
methods.description: When an axis starts being dragged

methods.name: _onDrag
methods.description: When an axis is dragged

methods.name: _radialSort
methods.description: Sorting function for polar in a cartesian space

methods.name: _radialOrLinear
methods.description: Helper function to return either a rotate transform or translate transform

methods.name: _onCartesianDragStart
methods.description: When an axis starts being dragged

methods.name: _onCartesianDrag
methods.description: When an axis is dragged

methods.name: _setupRegularActions
methods.description: Set up normal listener actions

methods.name: _computeGradientRange
methods.description: Computes the data range.

methods.name: _setDragBehavior
methods.description: Creates the drag behavior based on whether it is a cartesian chart or a parallel/radar chart

methods.name: drawElement
methods.description:
Creates the elements to listen to.

For simplicity, we just let d3.brush create the listener elements and control their size

methods.name: _calcRange
methods.description: Calculates the range to pass to the brush, i.e. the size the brush will have

methods.name: _createBrush
methods.description: Creates the brush

methods.name: _resizeBrush
methods.description: Resizes the brush elements

methods.name: _styleBrushSelection
methods.description: Adds or removes the dash style for the selection based on brushToRemove

methods.name: _setupSpecialActions
methods.description:
Set up the special d3 call function actions
These are d3 behaviors rather than simple mouse events

methods.name: _startPanning

methods.name: _calcSerieData
methods.description:
Creates the tooltipData & crosshairData

Takes the dimension (aid), the raw element, and the mouse position

methods.name: _searchData
methods.description: Determines if we want to keep some data.

methods.name: _createTooltipData
methods.description: Builds the tooltipData object from the results

methods.name: brushstart
methods.description: Stops event propagation on a brush start event

methods.name: brushEnd
methods.description: Final update on a brush end event

methods.name: _checkMinSize
methods.description: Checks the min size of the brush and resizes if necessary

methods.name: _checkBrushSize
methods.description: Checks that the brush size is valid and within the domain

methods.name: _getNewBrushRange
methods.description: On a resize or change, returns the new valid range for the brush

methods.name: clearBrush
methods.description: Deletes a brush and clears listeners

methods.name: deleteAndClearBrush
methods.description: Deletes a brush and clears listeners
