attributes.name: redraw-elems
attributes.description: The accompanying array of series elements required to redraw.

attributes.name: dynamic-redraw
attributes.description: Boolean specifing if the lines should redraw as you move the axis or just at the end.

attributes.name: width
attributes.description: The width of the elem; generally the width of the charting area for most components

attributes.name: height
attributes.description: The height of the component; generally the height of the charting area for most components.

attributes.name: margin
attributes.description: Defines the base margin for the chart. Calcs are run to add to the margin to accommodate axes and other elements which exist within the SVG frame, but outside the chart frame.

attributes.name: offset
attributes.description: An optional offset for a variety of elements

attributes.name: axes
attributes.description:
Represents all axes plotted by the chart, including muted ones.
It doesn't guarantee to have the same order as the current visual
representation.
Can be set by the developer to define which axes to plot

attributes.name: dimensions
attributes.description:
An array of dimensions (axes) which the chart uses. This array represents
the current state of all axes: muted axes won't be included and the
array is ordered based on the current visual representation.
Do not set at a chart level, only read

attributes.name: series-key
attributes.description: A string specifying which key to use as the series

attributes.name: drag-behavior
attributes.description: A holder for the drag behavior

attributes.name: category-key
attributes.description: A dev set string speciying which key to use as the category to use to color the series lines

attributes.name: categories
attributes.description: A dev set array defining the categories values.

attributes.name: action-config
attributes.description:
Configuration used to define what actions happen on events. Each key represents an event,
each value can be:
- a predefined action found in px-vis-interaction-space `actionMapping`
- a function, where `this` will be bound to the chart and the function's argument will be the mouse position on the chart

attributes.name: handlers-count
attributes.description: how many handlers are currently setup for each event type

attributes.name: orientation
attributes.description:
Defines which side the axis should be on.
 - 'left'
 - 'right'
 - 'bottom'
 - 'top'

attributes.name: extents-data
extents-action
attributes.description: Used by the chart to interpret if extentsData is strip or zoom

attributes.name: brush-domains
time-domain
attributes.description:
Can be used to define a time domain to be used, typically to restrain/filter the amount
of data displayed. Can be used in combination with a px-vis-chart-navigator

attributes.name: dimension
attributes.description: The string identifier for the axis

attributes.name: special-actions-list
attributes.description: Set of predefined actions that can be used out of the box

attributes.name: brush-actions
attributes.description:
set of actions which should display drawn brushes.
Key is the actionConfig value
value is the brushDomains key

attributes.name: action-mapping
attributes.description: set of predefined action that can be used out of the box

elements.description:
### Usage

    <px-vis-interactive-axis
        prevent-initial-drawing="[[preventInitialDrawing]]"
        svg="[[svg]]"
        x="[[x]]"
        y="[[y]]"
        dimension="[[dimension]]"
        series-key="[[seriesKey]]"
        height="[[height]]"
        width="[[width]]"
        margin="[[margin]]"
        chart-data="[[chartData]]"
        orientation="[[orientation]]"
        title="[[title]]"
        title-location='[[titleLocation]]'
        title-type-size="[[titleTypeSize]]"
        label-type-size="[[labelTypeSize]]"
        stroke-width="[[strokeWidth]]"
        outer-tick-size="0"
        tick-values="[[tickValues]]"
        truncation-length="[[truncationLength]]"
        complete-series-config="[[completeSeriesConfig]]"
        append-unit-in-title="[[appendUnitInTitle]]"
        unit="[[unit]]"
        prevent-series-bar="[[preventSeriesBar]]"
        domain-changed="[[_internalDimensionsChanged]]"
        selected-domain="[[selectedDomain]]"
        title-truncation
        disable-ticks="[[disableTicks]]"
        label-position="[[labelPosition]]"
        axis-color="[[axisColor]]"
        ticks="[[ticks]]"
        label-rotation="[[labelRotation]]"
        label-translation="[[labelTranslation]]"
        series-on-axis="[[seriesOnAxes]]"
        muted-series="[[mutedSeries]]"
        drawn-tick-values="[[drawnTickValues]]"
        rebuild-on-draw="[[_rebuildOnDraw]]"
        disable-brush="[[disableBrush]]"
        drag-behavior="[[dragBehavior]]"
        rebuild-on-draw="[[_rebuildOnDraw]]"
        prevent-initial-drawing="[[preventInitialDrawing]]"
        redraw-series="[[redrawSeries]]"
        brush-domains="[[brushDomains]]"
        hide-and-show-on-hover="[[hideAndShowOnHover]]">
    </px-vis-interactive-axis>

### d3 reference
https://github.com/mbostock/d3/wiki/SVG-Axes

### Styling
The following custom properties are available for styling:

Custom property | Description
:----------------|:-------------
  `--px-vis-font-family` | The font family for all labels and text
  `--px-vis-axis-color` | The color for the axis lines, axis ticks, and axis tick labels
  `--px-vis-axis-title-color` | The color for the axis title
  `--px-vis-axis-inline-title-color` | The color for the axis title
  `--px-vis-axis-inline-type-color` | The color for the axis lines, axis ticks, and axis tick labels when using 'inline' labelPosition
  `--px-vis-axis-inline-box-color` | The color for the tick boxes when using 'inline' labelPosition
  `--px-vis-axis-common-tick-color`

properties.name: svg
properties.description:
svg is a holder for the d3 instantiated svg container to draw to.
Must be set in ready and passed to all components so they know whom to draw to.

properties.name: _uniqueIdsUsed
properties.description:
Array of unique IDs generated for this comp. cleaned from global
store on detached

properties.name: pxSvgElem
properties.description: The SVG element inside the chart - not a D3 selected element.

properties.name: width
properties.description: The width of the elem; generally the width of the charting area for most components

properties.name: height
properties.description: The height of the component; generally the height of the charting area for most components.

properties.name: _defaultMargin
properties.description: Copy of the default margin for checking if it has changed

properties.name: margin
properties.description: Defines the base margin for the chart. Calcs are run to add to the margin to accommodate axes and other elements which exist within the SVG frame, but outside the chart frame.

properties.name: offset
properties.description: An optional offset for a variety of elements

properties.name: completeSeriesConfig
properties.description: A configuration file generated by the chart behavior based on seriesConfig and defaultSeriesConfig.

properties.name: labelTypeSize
properties.description: Defines the base label type size

properties.name: title
properties.description: The displayed title for the axis

properties.name: labelPosition
properties.description:
Defines on which side the tick mark the label should sit.
 - 'center'
 - 'before'
 - 'after'

properties.name: labelRotation
properties.description: Defines how the label should be rotated. Number is the degree of rotation

properties.name: labelTranslation
properties.description: Defines how the label should be moved in x,y. Array is an x,y pair and coresponds to the number of pixels to move the label

properties.name: series
properties.description: Array of the series which belong to this axis

properties.name: translateAmt
properties.description: An x,y amount to move the axis to allow for labels and titles

properties.name: titleLocation
properties.description:
Optional object to specify placement of the title. If none is supplied, then it uses `orientation` to determine title location.

```
   {
     x: Number, // a x number of pixels
     y: Number, // a y number of pixels
     r: Number, // a number of degrees to rotate
     anchor: String, // middle, start, end
   }
```

properties.name: titleTypeSize
properties.description: Defines the Title type size

properties.name: strokeWidth
properties.description: Defines the axis stroke width

properties.name: tickSizeOuter
properties.description:
Defines the axis tickSizeOuter. Default is to hide them

See: https://github.com/d3/d3-axis#axis_tickSizeOuter

properties.name: tickValues
properties.description:
Defines the what values the axis should use

See: https://github.com/d3/d3-axis#axis_tickValues

properties.name: ticks
properties.description:
Defines the tick number and format

See: https://github.com/d3/d3-axis#axis_ticks

Can be either a Number or an Object

Obj format:
```
   {
        "interval": Number,
        "format": String or d3 object,
   }
```

properties.name: tickFormat
properties.description:
A string that specifies the format of the ticks

https://github.com/d3/d3-format

https://github.com/d3/d3-time-format

properties.name: axisColor
properties.description: Defines the color for axis lines, ticks, labels, and title

properties.name: axisLineColor
properties.description: Defines the color for axis lines (overrides axisColor)

properties.name: axisTickColor
properties.description: Defines the color for axis ticks (overrides axisColor)

properties.name: axisLabelColor
properties.description: Defines the color for axis labels (overrides axisColor)

properties.name: axisTitleColor
properties.description: Defines the color for axis title (overrides axisColor)

properties.name: drawnTickValues
properties.description: Returned tick values from the axis

properties.name: chartData
properties.description:
container for the data object that drives the chart / component
Generally loaded with an iron-ajax tag (but doesnt have to be)
This can be set declaratively

properties.name: axes
properties.description:
Represents all axes plotted by the chart, including muted ones.
It doesn't guarantee to have the same order as the current visual
representation.
Can be set by the developer to define which axes to plot

properties.name: dimensions
properties.description:
An array of dimensions (axes) which the chart uses. This array represents
the current state of all axes: muted axes won't be included and the
array is ordered based on the current visual representation.
Do not set at a chart level, only read

properties.name: seriesKey
properties.description: A string specifying which key to use as the series

properties.name: mutedSeries
properties.description:
A list of user selected muted series. Tied declaratively to series components

The series name is the key and the value is a boolean for whether it is muted or not:

```
{
    'seriesId1':true,
    'seriesId2':false,
 }
```

In this example, seriesId1 is muted. seriesId2 was muted, but has been turned back on.

properties.name: hardMute
properties.description:
Allows for a "hard" muting of the series/categories: the
series/category won't show up
in the tooltip anymore, it's tooltip data won't be shown in the register
and its extents won't be taken into account by the chart

properties.name: combinedMutedSeries
properties.description:
Aimed at regrouping all muted series when different behavior can mute
series (multi series for example: brush + navigator + categories)

properties.name: redrawSeries
properties.description: Boolean to specify if we should redraw the chart series when we move an axis. More of a chart type by chart type configuration rather than a developer configuration. IE, for charts such as multi-y timeseries, it is unnessary. For charts such as parallel coordinates, it is necessary.

properties.name: redrawElems
properties.description: The accompanying array of series elements required to redraw.

properties.name: dynamicRedraw
properties.description: Boolean specifing if the lines should redraw as you move the axis or just at the end.

properties.name: domainChanged
properties.description:
Number which increments up when the domain(s) has(have) changed.

0 (false) indicates that domains have not been set.

Serves as a trigger for many elements to redraw.

properties.name: selectedDomain
properties.description:
New chart extents selected by the user

Serves as a trigger for the scale component to redefine the chart extents

properties.name: radial
properties.description: Boolean specifying if the chart is a polar chart or a cartesian chart

properties.name: centerOffset
properties.description: Used in a radial chart to provide a hole in the center of the chart

properties.name: seriesToAxes
properties.description: Object linking which series belong to which axis

properties.name: preventInitialDrawing
properties.description: blocks initial drawings of axis until set to false

properties.name: categoryKey
properties.description: A dev set string speciying which key to use as the category to use to color the series lines

properties.name: categories
properties.description: A dev set array defining the categories values.

properties.name: actionConfig
properties.description:
Configuration used to define what actions happen on events. Each key represents an event,
each value can be:
- a predefined action found in px-vis-interaction-space `actionMapping`
- a function which context will be bound to the chart. The function argument will be the mouse position on the chart

properties.name: brushDomains
timeDomain
properties.description:
Can be used to define a time domain to be used, typically to restrain/filter the amount
of data displayed. Can be used in combination with a px-vis-chart-navigator

properties.name: titleTruncation
properties.description: A boolean specifying if the axis title should truncate when too long

properties.name: _interactiveGroup
properties.description: A dictionary of g elements for each dimension.

properties.name: dimension
properties.description: The string identifier for the axis.

properties.name: appendUnitInTitle
properties.description: Whether to append unit in brackets in axis title, e.g [Hz].

properties.name: displayedValues
properties.description: Array representing the actual displayed titles for each axis.

properties.name: showTicksOnHover
properties.description: Whether the axis ticks should be hidden and shown on hover, or always shown.

properties.name: disableTicks
properties.description: Boolean to decide if all axes or just one axis should get ticks.

properties.name: length
properties.description: Length of the axis.

properties.name: brushToRemove
properties.description: Boolean controlling if brushing should retain or delete series.

properties.name: _pokeTitleLocation
properties.description: Force a redraw for titleLocation.

properties.name: recalcTicks
properties.description: Force a redraw if ticks.

properties.name: preventSeriesBar
properties.description: Boolean to specify whether to draw the series bars.

methods.name: generateRandomID
methods.description:
Generates a random id string.

Takes a string prefix, then adds 10 random chars

methods.name: cloneSVGElem
methods.description:
Clones a SVG elem and sets a component property with the d3 instance of that clone.

The intent of this is to clone the high level 'g' elem we draw to and attach it.
The draw order matters  in SVG and we want the some stuff to appear on top of everything else
Since we cannot easily ensure it draw order with components, we can stick top level items in a different 'g' that we know is drawn after the main 'g'

methods.name: _drawSVGOnCanvas
methods.description: Draws the current svg into a canvas

methods.name: _drawCanvg
methods.description:
Uses canvg third party to "translate" svg to javascript instructions
for the canvas, and draw on the canvas

methods.name: _nativeDrawSvgOnCanvas
methods.description: Tries to draw the SVG to canvas and if that doesnt work, falls back on a failure callback

methods.name: _getSVGOuterHtml
methods.description: fix for IE to get outer HTML

methods.name: _isValidData
methods.description: returns true if the data is valid: non NaN, null or undefined

methods.name: _isDataNotNull
methods.description: returns true if the data is not null

methods.name: _isObjEmpty
methods.description: Checks to see if an object is empty

methods.name: _isD3Empty
methods.description: Checks to see if an d3 obj is empty

methods.name: _doesD3HaveValues
methods.description: Checks to see if an d3 obj has something

methods.name: _doesObjHaveValues
methods.description: Checks to see if an object has values

methods.name: _isVarDefined
methods.description: Checks to see if an object is defined

methods.name: _isVarUndefined
methods.description: Checks to see if an object is defined

methods.name: _escapeCssSelector
methods.description: escapes '.' in css selectors so that we can appropriately select stuff with dots in thei ids

methods.name: _checkThemeVariable
methods.description: Checks if a theme variable exists, if so, returns the theme value, if not, returns the default

methods.name: _hexToRgb
methods.description: converts a hex to rgb color

methods.name: _binarySearch
methods.description: Binary search through sorted chartData

methods.name: _fuzzyBinarySearch
methods.description: Binary search through sorted chartData returning all vals within a window

methods.name: clone
methods.description: deep-copy object into newObject

methods.name: _applyConfigToElement
methods.description:
Applies the config object to the element. Each key in the config object
is the name of the property to be applied

methods.name: _createGroup
methods.description: Generates a group element for each dimension and moves it into the correct x coordinate.

methods.name: _setAxisStyles
methods.description: Sets styles and on-hover states for common axis.

elements.description:
### Usage

    <px-vis-multi-axis
        svg="[[svg]]"
        width="[[width]]"
        height="[[height]]"
        margin="[[margin]]"
        offset="[[_offset]]"
        length="[[_minDim]]"
        x="[[x]]"
        y="[[y]]"
        complete-series-config="{{completeSeriesConfig}}"
        series-key="[[seriesKey]]"
        chart-data="[[chartData]]"
        dimensions="[[dimensions]]"
        axes="[[axes]]"
        redraw-series="true"
        stroke-width="2"
        match-ticks="[[matchTicks]]"
        grid-ticks="{{gridTicks}}"
        grid-axis="{{gridAxis}}"
        common-axis="[[commonAxis]]"
        truncation-length="[[truncationLength]]"
        displayed-values="{{displayedValues}}"
        append-unit-in-title
        domain-changed="[[domainChanged]]"
        axis-groups="{{axisGroups}}"
        radial
        single-domain
        label-position="inline"
        label-one-axis
        axis-color="salmon"
        ticks="[[ticks]]"
        label-rotation="180"
        brush-to-remove="[[brushToRemove]]"
        center-offset="[[centerOffset]]"
        drawn-tick-values="{{drawnTickValues}}"
        title-type-size="15"
        label-type-size="12">
    </px-vis-multi-axis>

### d3 reference
https://github.com/mbostock/d3/wiki/SVG-Axes

### Styling
The following custom properties are available for styling:

Custom property | Description
:----------------|:-------------
  `--px-vis-font-family` | The font family for all labels and text
  `--px-vis-axis-color` | The color for the axis lines, axis ticks, and axis tick labels
  `--px-vis-axis-title-color` | The color for the axis title
  `--px-vis-axis-inline-title-color` | The color for the axis title
  `--px-vis-axis-inline-type-color` | The color for the axis lines, axis ticks, and axis tick labels when using 'inline' labelPosition
  `--px-vis-axis-inline-box-color` | The color for the tick boxes when using 'inline' labelPosition

properties.description: Defines the base label type size

properties.name: title
properties.description: The displayed title for the axis

properties.name: labelPosition
properties.description:
Defines on which side the tick mark the label should sit.
 - 'center'
 - 'before'
 - 'after'

properties.name: labelRotation
properties.description: Defines how the label should be rotated. Number is the degree of rotation

properties.name: labelTranslation
properties.description: Defines how the label should be moved in x,y. Array is an x,y pair and coresponds to the number of pixels to move the label

properties.name: series
properties.description: Array of the series which belong to this axis

properties.name: translateAmt
properties.description: An x,y amount to move the axis to allow for labels and titles

properties.name: titleLocation
properties.description:
Optional object to specify placement of the title. If none is supplied, then it uses `orientation` to determine title location.

```
   {
     x: Number, // a x number of pixels
     y: Number, // a y number of pixels
     r: Number, // a number of degrees to rotate
     anchor: String, // middle, start, end
   }
```

properties.name: titleTypeSize
properties.description: Defines the Title type size

properties.name: strokeWidth
properties.description: Defines the axis stroke width

properties.name: tickSizeOuter
properties.description:
Defines the axis tickSizeOuter. Default is to hide them

See: https://github.com/d3/d3-axis#axis_tickSizeOuter

properties.name: tickValues
properties.description:
Defines the what values the axis should use

See: https://github.com/d3/d3-axis#axis_tickValues

properties.name: ticks
properties.description:
Defines the tick number and format

See: https://github.com/d3/d3-axis#axis_ticks

Can be either a Number or an Object

Obj format:
```
   {
        "interval": Number,
        "format": String or d3 object,
   }
```

properties.name: tickFormat
properties.description:
A string that specifies the format of the ticks

https://github.com/d3/d3-format

https://github.com/d3/d3-time-format

properties.name: axisColor
properties.description: Defines the color for axis lines, ticks, labels, and title

properties.name: axisLineColor
properties.description: Defines the color for axis lines (overrides axisColor)

properties.name: axisTickColor
properties.description: Defines the color for axis ticks (overrides axisColor)

properties.name: axisLabelColor
properties.description: Defines the color for axis labels (overrides axisColor)

properties.name: axisTitleColor
properties.description: Defines the color for axis title (overrides axisColor)

properties.name: drawnTickValues
properties.description: Returned tick values from the axis

properties.name: chartData
properties.description:
container for the data object that drives the chart / component
Generally loaded with an iron-ajax tag (but doesnt have to be)
This can be set declaratively

properties.name: axes
properties.description:
Represents all axes plotted by the chart, including muted ones.
It doesn't guarantee to have the same order as the current visual
representation.
Can be set by the developer to define which axes to plot

properties.name: dimensions
properties.description:
An array of dimensions (axes) which the chart uses. This array represents
the current state of all axes: muted axes won't be included and the
array is ordered based on the current visual representation.
Do not set at a chart level, only read

properties.name: seriesKey
properties.description: A string specifying which key to use as the series

properties.name: mutedSeries
properties.description:
A list of user selected muted series. Tied declaratively to series components

The series name is the key and the value is a boolean for whether it is muted or not:

```
{
    'seriesId1':true,
    'seriesId2':false,
 }
```

In this example, seriesId1 is muted. seriesId2 was muted, but has been turned back on.

properties.name: hardMute
properties.description:
Allows for a "hard" muting of the series/categories: the
series/category won't show up
in the tooltip anymore, it's tooltip data won't be shown in the register
and its extents won't be taken into account by the chart

properties.name: redrawSeries
properties.description: Boolean to specify if we should redraw the chart series when we move an axis. More of a chart type by chart type configuration rather than a developer configuration. IE, for charts such as multi-y timeseries, it is unnessary. For charts such as parallel coordinates, it is necessary.

properties.name: redrawElems
properties.description: The accompanying array of series elements required to redraw.

properties.name: dynamicRedraw
properties.description: Boolean specifing if the lines should redraw as you move the axis or just at the end.

properties.name: commonAxis
properties.description: A boolean specifying if all axes should share the same range

properties.name: domainChanged
properties.description:
Number which increments up when the domain(s) has(have) changed.

0 (false) indicates that domains have not been set.

Serves as a trigger for many elements to redraw.

properties.name: selectedDomain
properties.description:
New chart extents selected by the user

Serves as a trigger for the scale component to redefine the chart extents

properties.name: radial
properties.description: Boolean specifying if the chart is a polar chart or a cartesian chart

properties.name: centerOffset
properties.description: Used in a radial chart to provide a hole in the center of the chart

properties.name: seriesToAxes
properties.description: Object linking which series belong to which axis

properties.name: preventInitialDrawing
properties.description: blocks initial drawings of axis until set to false

properties.name: categoryKey
properties.description: A dev set string speciying which key to use as the category to use to color the series lines

properties.name: categories
properties.description: A dev set array defining the categories values.

properties.name: actionConfig
properties.description:
Configuration used to define what actions happen on events. Each key represents an event,
each value can be:
- a predefined action found in px-vis-interaction-space `actionMapping`
- a function which context will be bound to the chart. The function argument will be the mouse position on the chart

properties.name: combinedMutedSeries
properties.description:
Aimed at regrouping all muted series when different behavior can mute
series (multi series for example: brush + navigator + categories)

properties.name: brushDomains
timeDomain
properties.description:
Can be used to define a time domain to be used, typically to restrain/filter the amount
of data displayed. Can be used in combination with a px-vis-chart-navigator

properties.name: titleTruncation
properties.description: A boolean specifying if the axis title should truncate when too long

properties.name: matchTicks
properties.description: A boolean to specify if the axis ticks should align or each have their own ranges.

properties.name: gridTicks
properties.description: If matchTicks, generate the ticks so they match too.

properties.name: gridAxis
properties.description: If matchTicks, generate the axis so it matches too.

properties.name: appendUnitInTitle
properties.description: Whether to append unit in brackets in axis title, e.g [Hz].

properties.name: displayedValues
properties.description: Array representing the actual displayed titles for each axis.

properties.name: _internalDimensions
properties.description: Internal dimensions to defeat race condition.

properties.name: _internalDimensionsChanged
properties.description: Internal dimensions trigger to defeat race conditions.

properties.name: singleDomain
properties.description: Whether the scales are using a single scale or multi scale.

properties.name: labelOneAxis
properties.description: Boolean to decide if all axes or just one axis should get ticks.

properties.name: length
properties.description: Length of the axis.

properties.name: _heightOrLen
properties.description: Whether to use the height or the length for axis length.

properties.name: brushToRemove
properties.description: Boolean controlling if brushing should retain or delete series.

properties.name: _lastDomainChanged
properties.description: Boolean to decide if domainChanged changed or if something else triggered the observer.

properties.name: _pokeTitleLocation
properties.description: Force a redraw for titleLocation.

properties.name: recalcTicks
properties.description: Force a redraw of ticks.

properties.name: preventSeriesBar
properties.description: Boolean to specify whether to draw the series bars.

properties.name: _displayedTitlesCounter
properties.description: Counter for number of axis titles that have been updated.

properties.name: _displayedTitlesBuilder
properties.description: Builder for current axis title updates.

properties.name: _drawnTickValuesChangedCounter
properties.description: Counter for number of drawn tick values that have been updated.

methods.name: _isValidData
methods.description: returns true if the data is valid: non NaN, null or undefined

methods.name: _isDataNotNull
methods.description: returns true if the data is not null

methods.name: _isObjEmpty
methods.description: Checks to see if an object is empty

methods.name: _isD3Empty
methods.description: Checks to see if an d3 obj is empty

methods.name: _doesD3HaveValues
methods.description: Checks to see if an d3 obj has something

methods.description: Checks to see if an object has values

methods.description: Checks to see if an object is defined

methods.name: _checkThemeVariable
methods.description: Checks if a theme variable exists, if so, returns the theme value, if not, returns the default

methods.name: _hexToRgb
methods.description: converts a hex to rgb color

methods.name: _binarySearch
methods.description: Binary search through sorted chartData

methods.name: _fuzzyBinarySearch
methods.description: Binary search through sorted chartData returning all vals within a window

methods.name: clone
methods.description: deep-copy object into newObject

methods.name: _applyConfigToElement
methods.description:
Applies the config object to the element. Each key in the config object
is the name of the property to be applied

methods.name: _computeTitleLocation
methods.description:
At ready, set the margin and titleLocation objects.
Used for radar to rotate the title appropriately.

methods.name: _toggleTitleLocation
methods.description: Forces a redraw of the titleLocation.

methods.name: _calcH
methods.description: returns length if it exists, otherwise returns height

methods.name: _returnY
methods.description: Returns the appropriate scale for a dimension.

methods.name: _calcDisableTicks
methods.description: Determines whether ticks are disabled.

methods.name: _computedInternalDimensions
methods.description:
Sets _internalDimensions to the value of dimensions but trigged AFTER the scale
has been set. Avoids an annoying race condition where dimensions triggers a
chart refresh but the new scale has yet to be triggered.

methods.name: _getTitle
methods.description: Checks if there is a title specified in the series config and returns it; otherwise returns the axis id.

methods.name: deleteAllBrushes
methods.description: Deletes the brushes on children axes.

methods.name: _displayedTitleChanged
methods.description: Sets the displayed value of the title including truncation

elements.description:
### Usage

    <px-vis-pie
        svg="[[svg]]"
        clip-path="[[clipPath]]"
        series-id="[[item.name]]"
        series-number="[[index]]"
        chart-data="[[item]]"
        x="[[x]]"
        y="[[y]]"
        muted-series="[[mutedSeries]]">
    </px-vis-pie>

### Styling
The following custom properties are available for styling:

Custom property | Description
:----------------|:-------------
  `--px-vis-pie-empty-color` | The color for an empty pie chart
  `--px-vis-pie-title-color` | The color for the title name
  `--px-vis-pie-title-font-size` | The size for the title name
  `--px-vis-pie-title-value-color` | The color for the title data value
  `--px-vis-pie-title-value-font-size` | The size for the title data value

properties.name: svg
properties.description:
svg is a holder for the d3 instantiated svg container to draw to.
Must be set in ready and passed to all components so they know whom to draw to.

properties.name: _uniqueIdsUsed
properties.description:
Array of unique IDs generated for this comp. cleaned from global
store on detached

properties.name: pxSvgElem
properties.description: The SVG element inside the chart - not a D3 selected element.

properties.name: chartData
properties.description:
container for the data object that drives the chart / component
Generally loaded with an iron-ajax tag (but doesnt have to be)
This can be set declaratively

properties.name: completeSeriesConfig
properties.description: A configuration file generated by the chart behavior based on seriesConfig and defaultSeriesConfig.

properties.name: mutedSeries
properties.description:
A list of user selected muted series. Tied declaratively to series components

The series name is the key and the value is a boolean for whether it is muted or not:

```
{
    'seriesId1':true,
    'seriesId2':false,
 }
```

In this example, seriesId1 is muted. seriesId2 was muted, but has been turned back on.

properties.name: hardMute
properties.description:
Allows for a "hard" muting of the series/categories: the
series/category won't show up
in the tooltip anymore, it's tooltip data won't be shown in the register
and its extents won't be taken into account by the chart

properties.name: width
properties.description: The width of the elem; generally the width of the charting area for most components

properties.name: height
properties.description: The height of the component; generally the height of the charting area for most components.

properties.name: _defaultMargin
properties.description: Copy of the default margin for checking if it has changed

properties.name: margin
properties.description: Defines the base margin for the chart. Calcs are run to add to the margin to accommodate axes and other elements which exist within the SVG frame, but outside the chart frame.

properties.name: offset
properties.description: An optional offset for a variety of elements

properties.name: seriesColorList
properties.description: Defines an colors in order that will be used for series.

properties.name: empty
properties.description: Whether to draw an empty pie chart when data is empty/null.

properties.name: seriesNumber
properties.description: An index of the series used for calculating its color.

properties.name: innerRadius
properties.description:
Number between 0 and 1 defining how much of the inner pie should be cut.
Typically at 0 this is a pie chart, at 0.5 a donut chart and at 1 all
the chart is cut (i.e. not visible).

properties.name: _innerRadiusPx
properties.description: The actual inner radius value in pixels which will be used internally to draw the chart.

properties.name: donut
properties.description:
Whether the chart should be displayed as a donut rather than a pie.
If displayed as a donut, it will by default use 30px as the ring size.
This can be overridden by using the "innerRadius" property (between 0 and 1).

properties.name: pieGroup
properties.description: A holder object for the series object.

properties.name: total
properties.description: Total value of all slices.

properties.name: radius
properties.description: Radius of the pie chart.

properties.name: _arcs
properties.description: The current arc definitions.

properties.name: _currentRotationAngle
properties.description: How much the pie is currently rotated in radians.

properties.name: usePercentage
properties.description: Whether the values should be displayed in percent.

properties.name: preserveDataOrder
properties.description:
By default the pie chart slices will be ordered by value.
Set to false to keep the data order.

methods.name: generateRandomID
methods.description:
Generates a random id string.

Takes a string prefix, then adds 10 random chars

methods.name: cloneSVGElem
methods.description:
Clones a SVG elem and sets a component property with the d3 instance of that clone.

The intent of this is to clone the high level 'g' elem we draw to and attach it.
The draw order matters  in SVG and we want the some stuff to appear on top of everything else
Since we cannot easily ensure it draw order with components, we can stick top level items in a different 'g' that we know is drawn after the main 'g'

methods.name: _drawSVGOnCanvas
methods.description: Draws the current svg into a canvas

methods.name: _drawCanvg
methods.description:
Uses canvg third party to "translate" svg to javascript instructions
for the canvas, and draw on the canvas

methods.name: _nativeDrawSvgOnCanvas
methods.description: Tries to draw the SVG to canvas and if that doesnt work, falls back on a failure callback

methods.name: _getSVGOuterHtml
methods.description: fix for IE to get outer HTML

methods.name: _isValidData
methods.description: returns true if the data is valid: non NaN, null or undefined

methods.name: _isDataNotNull
methods.description: returns true if the data is not null

methods.name: _isObjEmpty
methods.description: Checks to see if an object is empty

methods.name: _isD3Empty
methods.description: Checks to see if an d3 obj is empty

methods.name: _doesD3HaveValues
methods.description: Checks to see if an d3 obj has something

methods.name: _doesObjHaveValues
methods.description: Checks to see if an object has values

methods.name: _isVarDefined
methods.description: Checks to see if an object is defined

methods.name: _isVarUndefined
methods.description: Checks to see if an object is defined

methods.name: _escapeCssSelector
methods.description: escapes '.' in css selectors so that we can appropriately select stuff with dots in thei ids

methods.name: _checkThemeVariable
methods.description: Checks if a theme variable exists, if so, returns the theme value, if not, returns the default

methods.name: _hexToRgb
methods.description: converts a hex to rgb color

methods.name: _binarySearch
methods.description: Binary search through sorted chartData

methods.name: _fuzzyBinarySearch
methods.description: Binary search through sorted chartData returning all vals within a window

methods.name: clone
methods.description: deep-copy object into newObject

methods.name: _getColor
methods.description: Helper function to return the correct color for a particular index.

methods.name: _calcIndex
methods.description: Helper function to calculate the index. When we run out of indcies, it loops back over valid indicies.

methods.name: syncCSSTheme
methods.description:
Retrieves the CSS style variables set on this element and applies them
to the appropriate properties, triggering a redraw.

methods.name: _debounceSyncCSSTheme
methods.description:
Debounced function call for `syncCSSTheme` method. Loops through available
style variables to apply them to appropriate objects.

methods.name: _applyStyleVariables
methods.description:
Called when there is at least one style variable applied (the first is
expected to be named `--px-vis-series-color-0`). Loops through each
style variable in the format `--px-vis-series-color-[n]` and applies
the resulting values and series color order to the element. Stops looping
through style variables when it finds a gap.

methods.name: _colorHexToRgb
methods.description: Converts a hex-format color to RGB.

methods.name: _checkIfDevSetSeriesColorOrder
methods.description: Compares seriesColorOrder property value to the seriesColorOrder to determine if the dev set their own override.

methods.name: drawElement
methods.description:
Draws or updates the pie element.
Called from an observer watching for data and the necessary d3 objects.

methods.name: _checkInitialGroupCreation
methods.description:
Checks whether the group holding all of the slices has been created,
and creates it if necessary.

methods.name: _updateDrawing
methods.description: Updates drawing when adding, removing or updating data.

methods.name: _sliceMouseEnter
methods.description: Function used to display a tooltip for a specific slice.

methods.name: _positionChart
methods.description: Position the chart given the rotation angle.

methods.name: _onSliceClick
methods.description: Emits px-vis-pie-slice-clicked event with selected slice data.

methods.name: _centerOnSlice
methods.description: Transforms the svg to show the slice at the top (12 o'clock).

methods.name: _radToDeg
methods.description: Converts radians to degrees.

methods.name: _getRotationAngle
methods.description: Calculates the appropriate rotation angle for the slice to be displayed at 12 o'clock.

This can be set declaratively

attributes.name: complete-series-config
attributes.description: A configuration file generated by the chart behavior based on seriesConfig and defaultSeriesConfig.

attributes.name: muted-series
attributes.description:
A list of user selected muted series. Tied declaratively to series components

The series name is the key and the value is a boolean for whether it is muted or not:

```
{
    'seriesId1':true,
    'seriesId2':false,
 }
```

In this example, seriesId1 is muted. seriesId2 was muted, but has been turned back on.

attributes.name: hard-mute
attributes.description:
Allows for a "hard" muting of the series/categories: the
series/category won't show up
in the tooltip anymore, it's tooltip data won't be shown in the register
and its extents won't be taken into account by the chart

attributes.name: width
attributes.description: The width of the elem; generally the width of the charting area for most components

attributes.name: height
attributes.description: The height of the component; generally the height of the charting area for most components.

attributes.name: margin
attributes.description: Defines the base margin for the chart. Calcs are run to add to the margin to accommodate axes and other elements which exist within the SVG frame, but outside the chart frame.

attributes.name: offset
attributes.description: An optional offset for a variety of elements

attributes.name: series-color-list
attributes.description: Defines an colors in order that will be used for series.

attributes.name: empty
attributes.description: Whether to draw an empty pie chart when data is empty/null.

attributes.name: series-number
attributes.description: An index of the series used for calculating its color.

attributes.name: inner-radius
attributes.description:
Number between 0 and 1 defining how much of the inner pie should be cut.
Typically at 0 this is a pie chart, at 0.5 a donut chart and at 1 all
the chart is cut (i.e. not visible).

attributes.name: donut
attributes.description:
Whether the chart should be displayed as a donut rather than a pie.
If displayed as a donut, it will by default use 30px as the ring size.
This can be overridden by using the "innerRadius" property (between 0 and 1).

attributes.name: pie-group
attributes.description: A holder object for the series object.

attributes.name: total
attributes.description: Total value of all slices.

attributes.name: radius
attributes.description: Radius of the pie chart.

attributes.name: use-percentage
attributes.description: Whether the values should be displayed in percent.

attributes.name: preserve-data-order
attributes.description:
By default the pie chart slices will be ordered by value.
Set to false to keep the data order.

elements.description:
### Usage

    <px-vis-radar-grid
        svg="[[svg]]"
        x="[[x]]"
        y="[[y]]"
        axis-color="[[axisColor]]"
        tick-values="[[drawnTickValues]]"
        dimensions="[[dimensions]]"
        margin="[[margin]]"
        domain-changed="[[domainChanged]]">
    </px-vis-radar-grid>

### Styling
The following custom properties are available for styling:

Custom property | Description
:----------------|:-------------
  `--px-vis-gridlines-color` | The color for the gridlines

properties.description:
svg is a holder for the d3 instantiated svg container to draw to.
Must be set in ready and passed to all components so they know whom to draw to.

properties.name: _uniqueIdsUsed
properties.description:
Array of unique IDs generated for this comp. cleaned from global
store on detached

properties.name: pxSvgElem
properties.description: The SVG element inside the chart - not a D3 selected element.

properties.name: x
properties.description:
x is a holder for the d3 instantiated scale object
Must be set in the svg component and passed to all components so they know the drawing scale.
This can be set declaratively

See: https://github.com/d3/d3/blob/master/API.md#scales-d3-scale

properties.name: y
properties.description:
y is a holder for the d3 instantiated scale object
Must be set in the svg component and passed to all components so they know the drawing scale.
This can be set declaratively

properties.description: Holder for a clipping path ID

properties.name: seriesClipPath
properties.description: A more restricting clip path used to limit where the series are being drawn

properties.name: _gridData
properties.description: The calculated grid data.

properties.name: axisColor
properties.description: The color for the grid lines.

properties.name: _completeSeriesConfig
properties.description: A configuration object for the gridlines.

properties.name: _seriesKey
properties.description: The access key for the seriesConfig.

properties.name: tickValues
properties.description: The values obtained from the axis to place gridlines on.

properties.name: dimensions
properties.description: The dimensions of the chart.

properties.name: strokeWidth
properties.description: The stroke width for the grid.

methods.name: generateRandomID
methods.description:
Generates a random id string.

Takes a string prefix, then adds 10 random chars

methods.name: cloneSVGElem
methods.description:
Clones a SVG elem and sets a component property with the d3 instance of that clone.

The intent of this is to clone the high level 'g' elem we draw to and attach it.
The draw order matters  in SVG and we want the some stuff to appear on top of everything else
Since we cannot easily ensure it draw order with components, we can stick top level items in a different 'g' that we know is drawn after the main 'g'

methods.name: _drawSVGOnCanvas
methods.description: Draws the current svg into a canvas

methods.name: _drawCanvg
methods.description:
Uses canvg third party to "translate" svg to javascript instructions
for the canvas, and draw on the canvas

methods.name: _nativeDrawSvgOnCanvas
methods.description: Tries to draw the SVG to canvas and if that doesnt work, falls back on a failure callback

methods.name: _getSVGOuterHtml
methods.description: fix for IE to get outer HTML

methods.name: _processYValues
methods.description:
This functions process Y axis and applies the result to some variable.
If in single Y it just run the function and assign the result to `result`, if multi Y
it runs the function for each axis and stores the result against the axis key
on `result`

methods.name: _isValidData
methods.description: returns true if the data is valid: non NaN, null or undefined

methods.name: _isDataNotNull
methods.description: returns true if the data is not null

methods.name: _isObjEmpty
methods.description: Checks to see if an object is empty

methods.name: _isD3Empty
methods.description: Checks to see if an d3 obj is empty

methods.name: _doesD3HaveValues
methods.description: Checks to see if an d3 obj has something

methods.name: _doesObjHaveValues
methods.description: Checks to see if an object has values

methods.name: _isVarDefined
methods.description: Checks to see if an object is defined

methods.name: _isVarUndefined
methods.description: Checks to see if an object is defined

methods.name: _escapeCssSelector
methods.description: escapes '.' in css selectors so that we can appropriately select stuff with dots in thei ids

methods.name: _checkThemeVariable
methods.description: Checks if a theme variable exists, if so, returns the theme value, if not, returns the default

methods.name: _hexToRgb
methods.description: converts a hex to rgb color

methods.name: _binarySearch
methods.description: Binary search through sorted chartData

methods.name: _fuzzyBinarySearch
methods.description: Binary search through sorted chartData returning all vals within a window

methods.name: clone
methods.description: deep-copy object into newObject

methods.description: Add the clip-path attr to the element

methods.name: createGridData
methods.description: Draws the gridlines.

elements.description:
### Usage

    <px-vis-radial-gridlines
        svg="[[svg]]"
        axis="[[y]]"
        domain-changed="[[domainChanged]]"
        margin="[[margin]]"
        tick-values="[[drawnTickValues]]">
    </px-vis-radial-gridlines>

### d3 reference
https://github.com/mbostock/d3/wiki/SVG-Axes
The gridlines still make use of the d3.axis object, just with different settings

### Styling
The following custom properties are available for styling:

Custom property | Description
:----------------|:-------------
  `--px-vis-gridlines-color` | The color for the gridlines

properties.name: svg
properties.description:
svg is a holder for the d3 instantiated svg container to draw to.

Array of unique IDs generated for this comp. cleaned from global
store on detached

properties.description: The SVG element inside the chart - not a D3 selected element.

properties.name: orientation
properties.description:
Defines which side the axis should be on.
 - 'left'
 - 'right'
 - 'bottom'
 - 'top'

properties.name: axis
properties.description:
axis is a general holder for the d3 instantiated scale object
Can pass any type of instantiated scale object, IE pass in either your x or your y depending which this axis is for.
This can be set declaratively

See: https://github.com/d3/d3/blob/master/API.md#scales-d3-axis

properties.name: labelTypeSize
properties.description: Defines the base label type size

properties.name: title
properties.description: The displayed title for the axis

properties.name: labelPosition
properties.description:
Defines on which side the tick mark the label should sit.
 - 'center'
 - 'before'
 - 'after'

properties.name: labelRotation
properties.description: Defines how the label should be rotated. Number is the degree of rotation

properties.name: labelTranslation
properties.description: Defines how the label should be moved in x,y. Array is an x,y pair and coresponds to the number of pixels to move the label

properties.name: series
properties.description: Array of the series which belong to this axis

properties.name: translateAmt
properties.description: An x,y amount to move the axis to allow for labels and titles

properties.name: titleLocation
properties.description:
Optional object to specify placement of the title. If none is supplied, then it uses `orientation` to determine title location.

```
   {
     x: Number, // a x number of pixels
     y: Number, // a y number of pixels
     r: Number, // a number of degrees to rotate
     anchor: String, // middle, start, end
   }
```

properties.name: titleTypeSize
properties.description: Defines the Title type size

properties.name: strokeWidth
properties.description: Defines the axis stroke width

properties.name: tickSizeOuter
properties.description:
Defines the axis tickSizeOuter. Default is to hide them

See: https://github.com/d3/d3-axis#axis_tickSizeOuter

properties.name: ticks
properties.description:
Defines the tick number and format

See: https://github.com/d3/d3-axis#axis_ticks

Can be either a Number or an Object

Obj format:
```
   {
        "interval": Number,
        "format": String or d3 object,
   }
```

properties.name: tickFormat
properties.description:
A string that specifies the format of the ticks

https://github.com/d3/d3-format

https://github.com/d3/d3-time-format

properties.name: axisColor
properties.description: Defines the color for axis lines, ticks, labels, and title

properties.name: axisLineColor
properties.description: Defines the color for axis lines (overrides axisColor)

properties.name: axisTickColor
properties.description: Defines the color for axis ticks (overrides axisColor)

properties.name: axisLabelColor
properties.description: Defines the color for axis labels (overrides axisColor)

properties.name: axisTitleColor
properties.description: Defines the color for axis title (overrides axisColor)

properties.name: drawnTickValues
properties.description: Returned tick values from the axis

properties.name: domainChanged
properties.description:
Number which increments up when the domain(s) has(have) changed.

0 (false) indicates that domains have not been set.

Serves as a trigger for many elements to redraw.

elements.description:
### Usage

    <px-vis-scale
      x-axis-type="time"
      y-axis-type="linear"
      complete-series-config="[[seriesConfig]]"
      data-extents="[[dataExtents]]"
      width="[[width]]"
      height="[[height]]"
      margin="[[margin]]"
      chart-data="{{chartData}}"
      x="{{x}}"
      y="{{y}}"
      domain-changed="{{domainChanged}}"
      selected-domain="[[selectedDomain]]">
    </px-vis-scale>
    <px-vis-svg
      width="[[width]]"
      height="[[height]]"
      margin="[[margin]]"
      svg="{{svg}}">
    </px-vis-svg>
    <px-vis-scatter
      svg="[[svg]]"
      series-id="mySeries"
      complete-series-config="[[seriesConfig]]"
      chart-data="[[chartData]]"
      x="[[x]]"
      y="[[y]]"
      domain-changed="[[domainChanged]]">
    </px-vis-scatter>

This can be set declaratively

properties.name: completeSeriesConfig
properties.description: A configuration file generated by the chart behavior based on seriesConfig and defaultSeriesConfig.

properties.name: mutedSeries
properties.description:
A list of user selected muted series. Tied declaratively to series components

The series name is the key and the value is a boolean for whether it is muted or not:

```
{
    'seriesId1':true,
    'seriesId2':false,
 }
```

In this example, seriesId1 is muted. seriesId2 was muted, but has been turned back on.

properties.name: hardMute
properties.description:
Allows for a "hard" muting of the series/categories: the
series/category won't show up
in the tooltip anymore, it's tooltip data won't be shown in the register
and its extents won't be taken into account by the chart

properties.name: clipPath
properties.description: Holder for a clipping path ID

properties.name: seriesClipPath
properties.description: A more restricting clip path used to limit where the series are being drawn

properties.name: interpolationFunction
properties.description:
A d3 function used to interpolate the series lines.

Can also be a string referencing simple, built in d3 functions:
- `"curveBasis"`
- `"curveBasisClosed"`
- `"curveBasisOpen"`
- `"curveLinear"`
- `"curveLinearClosed"`
- `"curveMonotoneX"`
- `"curveMonotoneY"`
- `"curveNatural"`
- `"curveStep"`
- `"curveStepAfter"`
- `"curveStepBefore"`

See: https://github.com/d3/d3-shape/blob/master/README.md#curves

properties.name: lineRadiusLimit
properties.description:
sets a minimum value for the line amplitude. Points less than the lineRadiusLimit will be set to the limit

Essentially, it moves a point that is past the center into the visible axis area on the opposite side to terminating inside the clip path area, thereby also changing the angle of those connecting lines

Note: radius on a radialLine is equivelent to y on a cartesean line.

properties.name: line
properties.description: A holder object for the line generator

properties.name: domainChanged
properties.description:
Number which increments up when the domain(s) has(have) changed.

0 (false) indicates that domains have not been set.

Serves as a trigger for many elements to redraw.

properties.name: counterClockwise
properties.description: whether the polar data should be interpreted clockwise or counter-clockwise

properties.name: useDegrees
properties.description: Whether the angle data should be processed as degrees, as opposed to be processed as radians

properties.name: seriesId
properties.description: A unique ID for each line series

properties.name: _dynamicProperties
properties.description: A list of the dynamic properties

properties.name: serieToRedrawOnTop
properties.description:
Array containing a set of series to redraw on top of everything (in the order
they are found in this array)

properties.name: _isAttached
properties.description: Boolean tracking if we are attached

properties.name: markerMapping
properties.description:
Maps dev input marker string to d3 symbols.

To add additional, custom icons, provide a draw function wrapped in an object and draw your shape using canvas drawing methods. See 'bar' or 'x' as examples

properties.name: markerSymbol
properties.description:
The symbol used for the marker. Supported symbols:
- 'circle'
- 'cross'
- 'diamond'
- 'square'
- 'triangle-up'
- 'star'
- 'wye'
more info at https://github.com/d3/d3-shape/blob/master/README.md#symbols
This property will be read from the completeSeriesConfig

Some additional "custom" types are also available:
- 'bar'
- 'thin-bar'
- 'thick-bar'
- 'x'

properties.name: markerScale
properties.description:
Scales the size of the scatter marker
This property will be read from the completeSeriesConfig

properties.name: markerSize
properties.description:
the size of the markers
This property will be read from the completeSeriesConfig

properties.name: markerFillOpacity
properties.description:
The opacity of the fill (inside) of the marker
This property will be read from the completeSeriesConfig

properties.name: markerStrokeOpacity
properties.description:
The opacity of the stroke (outside) of the marker
This property will be read from the completeSeriesConfig

properties.name: mutedOpacity
properties.description:
the opacity value of the fill to be used when muting a serie (stroke is not drawn on mute)
This property will be read from the completeSeriesConfig

properties.name: showArrows
properties.description: Boolean to indicate if arrows should be drawn

properties.name: arrowConfig
properties.description:
Configuration options for the arrow
- `symbol`: the symbol name from `markerMapping`. Default: `caret
- `size`: the size of the symbol.
- `scale`: the scale of the symbol (another way to size). Default: 1
- `minLength`: the minimum segment length between points which should get an arrow. Lengths below this min value will not get an arrow. Default: 10

properties.name: seriesNumber
properties.description: The index of the series, used for calculating its color.

properties.name: scatterGroup
properties.description: A holder object for the series group.

properties.name: scatterDots
properties.description: A holder object for the series objects.

properties.name: scatterBuilder
properties.description: A holder object for the series builder.

properties.name: arrowDots
properties.description: A holder object for the arrow objects.

properties.name: arrowBuilder
properties.description: A holder object for the arrow builder.

properties.name: radial
properties.description: Whether the scatter plot is using radial coordinates (x=phase, y=amplitude).

properties.name: timeData
properties.description: Name of the variable holding the time stamp in the data. Used for non-timeseries charts.

properties.name: drawDebounceTime
properties.description: Debounce time to use for drawing.

methods.name: generateRandomID
methods.description:
Generates a random id string.

Takes a string prefix, then adds 10 random chars

methods.name: cloneSVGElem
methods.description:
Clones a SVG elem and sets a component property with the d3 instance of that clone.

The intent of this is to clone the high level 'g' elem we draw to and attach it.
The draw order matters  in SVG and we want the some stuff to appear on top of everything else
Since we cannot easily ensure it draw order with components, we can stick top level items in a different 'g' that we know is drawn after the main 'g'

methods.name: _drawSVGOnCanvas
methods.description: Draws the current svg into a canvas

methods.name: _drawCanvg
methods.description:
Uses canvg third party to "translate" svg to javascript instructions
for the canvas, and draw on the canvas

methods.name: _nativeDrawSvgOnCanvas
methods.description: Tries to draw the SVG to canvas and if that doesnt work, falls back on a failure callback

methods.name: _getSVGOuterHtml
methods.description: fix for IE to get outer HTML

methods.name: _processYValues
methods.description:
This functions process Y axis and applies the result to some variable.
If in single Y it just run the function and assign the result to `result`, if multi Y
it runs the function for each axis and stores the result against the axis key
on `result`

methods.name: _isValidData
methods.description: returns true if the data is valid: non NaN, null or undefined

methods.name: _isDataNotNull
methods.description: returns true if the data is not null

methods.name: _isObjEmpty
methods.description: Checks to see if an object is empty

methods.name: _isD3Empty
methods.description: Checks to see if an d3 obj is empty

methods.name: _doesD3HaveValues
methods.description: Checks to see if an d3 obj has something

methods.name: _doesObjHaveValues
methods.description: Checks to see if an object has values

methods.name: _isVarDefined
methods.description: Checks to see if an object is defined

methods.name: _isVarUndefined
methods.description: Checks to see if an object is defined

methods.name: _escapeCssSelector
methods.description: escapes '.' in css selectors so that we can appropriately select stuff with dots in thei ids

methods.name: _checkThemeVariable
methods.description: Checks if a theme variable exists, if so, returns the theme value, if not, returns the default

methods.name: _hexToRgb
methods.description: converts a hex to rgb color

methods.name: _binarySearch
methods.description: Binary search through sorted chartData

methods.name: _fuzzyBinarySearch
methods.description: Binary search through sorted chartData returning all vals within a window

methods.name: clone
methods.description: deep-copy object into newObject

methods.name: addClipPath
methods.description: Add the clip-path attr to the element

methods.name: _defineRadialLine
methods.description: Defines a multi-scale d3 line generator and its attrs

methods.name: _getPixelCoordForRadialData
methods.description:
Returns pixel coordinates for data values. [0,0] is the center of the
radial drawing, not the top left corner

methods.name: _adjustAngleForPolarChart
methods.description:
adjusts the angle for the polar chart, taking counterClockwise into account
and returning it in the asked unit (degrees if toDegrees is true)

methods.name: _computeValue
methods.description: Decides if it should use a default or user specified value

methods.name: _processConfig
methods.description: sets each property listed in dynamicProperies

methods.name: _watchConfigProperty
methods.description: Cycles through properties and adds them to dynamic properties

methods.name: drawElement
methods.description:
Draws or updates the scatter element.
Called from an observer that watches for data and the necessary d3 objects.

methods.name: _drawElementDebounced
methods.description: Debounced version of the above method for drawing or updating the scatter element.

methods.name: _addClipPath
methods.description: Helper to call addClipPath with the element.

methods.name: isIdInMuted
methods.description:
Checks mutedSeries to see if this ID is in there.
Called from an observer watching mutedSeries.

methods.name: _applyTransform
methods.description: Applies the necessary translate and scale to the scatterDots.

methods.name: _colorScatter
methods.description: Adds full color to the scatters.

methods.name: _drawOnTop
methods.description: Redraw this series on top if needed.

elements.description:
### Usage

    <px-vis-scale
      x-axis-type="time"
      y-axis-type="linear"
      complete-series-config="[[seriesConfig]]"
      data-extents="[[dataExtents]]"
      width="[[width]]"
      height="[[height]]"
      margin="[[margin]]"
      chart-data="{{chartData}}"
      x="{{x}}"
      y="{{y}}"
      domain-changed="{{domainChanged}}"
      selected-domain="[[selectedDomain]]">
    </px-vis-scale>
    <px-vis-svg
      width="[[width]]"
      height="[[height]]"
      margin="[[margin]]"
      svg="{{svg}}">
    </px-vis-svg>
    <px-vis-striping
      svg="[[svg]]"
      series-id="mySeries"
      complete-series-config="[[seriesConfig]]"
      chart-data="[[chartData]]"
      width="[[width]]"
      height="[[height]]"
      margin="[[margin]]"
      x="[[x]]"
      y="[[y]]"
      domain-changed="[[domainChanged]]">
    </px-vis-striping>

elements.description:
### Usage

You must have a link import for px-vis-behavior-common, e.g.

    <link rel="import" href="../px-vis/px-vis-behavior-common.html" />

and include the PxVisBehavior.thresholds behavior in the behaviors array inside your Polymer object configuration.

The following attributes are required:

    <px-vis-threshold
        svg="[[svg]]"
        width="[[width]]"
        margin"[[margin]]"
        domain-changed="[[domainChanged]]"
        y="[[y]]"
        show-threshold-box="true"
        complete-series-config="[[CompleteSeriesConfig]]"
        threshold-data="[[thresholdData]]">
    </px-vis-threshold>

### Styling
The following custom properties are available for styling:

Custom property | Description
:----------------|:-------------
  `--px-vis-threshold-color` | The default color for a threshold

properties.name: width
properties.description: The width of the elem; generally the width of the charting area for most components

properties.name: height
properties.description: The height of the component; generally the height of the charting area for most components.

properties.name: _defaultMargin
properties.description: Copy of the default margin for checking if it has changed

properties.name: margin
properties.description: Defines the base margin for the chart. Calcs are run to add to the margin to accommodate axes and other elements which exist within the SVG frame, but outside the chart frame.

properties.name: offset
properties.description: An optional offset for a variety of elements

properties.name: svg
properties.description:
svg is a holder for the d3 instantiated svg container to draw to.
Must be set in ready and passed to all components so they know whom to draw to.

properties.name: _uniqueIdsUsed
properties.description:
Array of unique IDs generated for this comp. cleaned from global
store on detached

properties.name: pxSvgElem
properties.description: The SVG element inside the chart - not a D3 selected element.

properties.name: x
properties.description:
x is a holder for the d3 instantiated scale object
Must be set in the svg component and passed to all components so they know the drawing scale.
This can be set declaratively

See: https://github.com/d3/d3/blob/master/API.md#scales-d3-scale

properties.description: A configuration file generated by the chart behavior based on seriesConfig and defaultSeriesConfig.

properties.name: thresholdConfig
_defaultThresholdConfig
properties.description:
Configuration object to define what the default icon should be. This gets used if a) no eventConfig is defined or b) the particular event is not defined in the eventConfig object.

```
Default: {
  'strokeWidth': '1',
  'dashPattern': '5,2'
}
```

properties.name: thresholdData
properties.description:
Data representing the events. Example:
```
[
     { "for":"y0", "type":"max", "value":35.4784 },
     { "for":"y0", "type":"min", "value":7.6531 },
     { "for":"y0", "type":"mean", "value":15.330657585139331 },
     { "for":"y1", "type":"mean", "value":75 },
     { "for":"", "type":"quartile", "value":17 }
 ]
```

properties.name: domainChanged
properties.description:
Number which increments up when the domain(s) has(have) changed.

0 (false) indicates that domains have not been set.

Serves as a trigger for many elements to redraw.

properties.description: Holder for a clipping path ID

properties.name: seriesClipPath
properties.description: A more restricting clip path used to limit where the series are being drawn

properties.name: _measurementCanvas
properties.description:
The zoom selection type:
- xy
- xAxis
- yAxis

properties.name: _defaultDefaultColor
properties.description: Internal copy of the default color.

properties.name: defaultColor
properties.description: Default color of the threshold.

properties.name: thresholdGroup
properties.description: Holder object for the event svg "g" element.

properties.name: thresholdLine
properties.description: Holder object for the event line elements.

properties.name: thresholdRect
properties.description: Holder object for the event rectangle elements.

properties.name: displayTitle
properties.description: Whether to show the title on the threshold.

properties.name: drawDebounceTime
properties.description: Debounce time to use for drawing.

properties.name: language
properties.description: A valid IETF language key used for localization.

methods.name: _processYValues
methods.description:
This functions process Y axis and applies the result to some variable.
If in single Y it just run the function and assign the result to `result`, if multi Y
it runs the function for each axis and stores the result against the axis key
on `result`

attributes.name: width
attributes.description: The width of the elem; generally the width of the charting area for most components

attributes.name: height
attributes.description: The height of the component; generally the height of the charting area for most components.

attributes.name: margin
attributes.description: Defines the base margin for the chart. Calcs are run to add to the margin to accommodate axes and other elements which exist within the SVG frame, but outside the chart frame.

attributes.name: offset
attributes.description: An optional offset for a variety of elements

attributes.name: svg
attributes.description:
svg is a holder for the d3 instantiated svg container to draw to.
Must be set in ready and passed to all components so they know whom to draw to.

attributes.name: px-svg-elem
attributes.description: The SVG element inside the chart - not a D3 selected element.

attributes.name: x
attributes.description:
x is a holder for the d3 instantiated scale object
Must be set in the svg component and passed to all components so they know the drawing scale.
This can be set declaratively

See: https://github.com/d3/d3/blob/master/API.md#scales-d3-scale

attributes.name: y
attributes.description:
y is a holder for the d3 instantiated scale object
Must be set in the svg component and passed to all components so they know the drawing scale.
This can be set declaratively

See: https://github.com/d3/d3/blob/master/API.md#scales-d3-scale

attributes.name: complete-series-config
attributes.description: A configuration file generated by the chart behavior based on seriesConfig and defaultSeriesConfig.

attributes.name: threshold-config
threshold-data
attributes.description:
Data representing the events. Example:
```
[
     { "for":"y0", "type":"max", "value":35.4784 },
     { "for":"y0", "type":"min", "value":7.6531 },
     { "for":"y0", "type":"mean", "value":15.330657585139331 },
     { "for":"y1", "type":"mean", "value":75 },
     { "for":"", "type":"quartile", "value":17 }
 ]
```

attributes.name: domain-changed
attributes.description:
Number which increments up when the domain(s) has(have) changed.

0 (false) indicates that domains have not been set.

Serves as a trigger for many elements to redraw.

attributes.name: clip-path
attributes.description: Holder for a clipping path ID

attributes.name: series-clip-path
attributes.description: A more restricting clip path used to limit where the series are being drawn

attributes.name: default-color
attributes.description: Default color of the threshold.

attributes.name: threshold-group
attributes.description: Holder object for the event svg "g" element.

attributes.name: threshold-line
attributes.description: Holder object for the event line elements.

attributes.name: threshold-rect
attributes.description: Holder object for the event rectangle elements.

attributes.name: display-title
attributes.description: Whether to show the title on the threshold.

attributes.name: draw-debounce-time
attributes.description: Debounce time to use for drawing.

attributes.name: language
attributes.description: A valid IETF language key used for localization.

properties.name: actionConfig
properties.description:
Configuration used to define what actions happen on events. Each key represents an event,
each value can be:
- a predefined action found as a key in px-vis-interaction-space `actionMapping`
- a function, where `this` will be bound to the chart and the function's argument will be the mouse position on the chart

properties.name: withinChart
properties.description: Whether the toolbar is within a chart. Drives where the secondary toolbar is displayed.

properties.name: chartMargin
properties.description: The chart margins. Used to position the secondary toolbar if withinChart is true.

properties.name: currentSubConfig
properties.description: Current sub-configuration. Can be the result of the config or passed in from another toolbar.

properties.name: _internalConfig
properties.description: Current config used to build the toolbar.

properties.name: horizontalAlignment
properties.description: Horizontal alignment of the toolbar. Should be 'left' or 'right'.

properties.name: subToolbarAlignment
properties.description:
Alignment of the sub toolbar. Accepted values:
- horizontal
- vertical
- above (when in a chart, the sub toolbar will be displayed
above the chart rather than on top of it)

properties.name: config
properties.description:
Configuration object for the toolbar. This object drives what buttons are available on
the toolbar and what they do. Three actions can be used out of the box by passing them
as keys in this config: 'zoom', 'pan' and 'tooltip'.
Any other kind of actions and buttons can be defined through this object. See above for example.

properties.name: _defaultActionsMapping
properties.description:
Predefined configs available for use and/or extensions:
- annotations
- axisMuteSeries
- axisDrag
- crosshairLasso
- crosshair
- crosshairWithOptions
- crosshairFrozen
- tooltip
- tooltipFrozen
- tooltipWithSearchTypes
- tooltipWithSearchTypesAndRadius
- tooltipWithFullOptions
- pan
- bareZoom
- zoom
- advancedZoom
- stripe

methods.description:
Will add 'hide' class if any of the arguments is falsy
(so shows if everything truthy)

Will add 'hide' class if all arguments are not falsy
(so hides if everything truthy)

methods.name: reProcessConfig
methods.description:
Forces the toolbar to reprocess its current config. Useful when changing
one subproperty of a toolbar item without having to re-copy the whole
config

methods.name: switchConfigItems
methods.description:
Convenience function for switching a toolbar item to another by hiding
the first one and selecting the second one.
Pass selectToItem true to select the "toItemName" automatically
By default this function will force the toolbar to reprocess the
changes incurred by this switching. If you have more changes to apply
to the config then pass `preventReprocess` true to this function and
call `reProcessConfig` on the toolbar once you applied all your changes

methods.name: _clickItem
methods.description: Called when clicking an item of the main toolbar.

methods.name: _clickSubItem
methods.description: Called when clicking an item of the secondary toolbar.

methods.name: _processItem
methods.description: Processes an item click: fire event if needed and set action config appropriately

elements.description:
### Usage

    <px-vis-register-item
        item="[[item]]"
        complete-series-config="[[completeSeriesConfig]]"
        type="[[type]]"
        x-axis-type="[[xAxisType]]"
        y-axis-type="[[yAxisType]]">
    </px-vis-register-item>

### Styling
The following custom properties are available for styling:

Custom property | Description
:----------------|:-------------
  `--px-register-series-marker-width` | The width (thickness) of the series marker
  `--px-vis-register-series-name` | The color of the data series name
  `--px-vis-register-data-value` | The color of the data series value
  `--px-vis-register-box` | The color of the box around the register when a scrollbar is present

properties.name: truncationLength
properties.description:
Defines if the label should get truncated and to how many characters.

Default length is 10 characters, not including the ellipsis which gets inserted.

The length must be at least 2.

To disable truncation, set the value to -1

properties.name: numberFormatCulture
properties.description:
Defines how a display number should be formatted:
Provide localization for currency formatting

For valid formats and features, see: http://numbrojs.com/languages.html
For docs on the component, see: https://www.predix-ui.com/#/components/px-number-formatter/

properties.name: numberFormatIsCurrency
properties.description:
Defines how a display number should be formatted:
Specify whether the value should be formatted as a currency

For valid formats and features, see: http://numbrojs.com/format.html
For docs on the component, see: https://www.predix-ui.com/#/components/px-number-formatter/

The format used to generate the output

properties.name: completeSeriesConfig
properties.description: A configuration file generated by the chart behavior based on seriesConfig and defaultSeriesConfig.

properties.name: mutedSeries
properties.description:
A list of user selected muted series. Tied declaratively to series components

The series name is the key and the value is a boolean for whether it is muted or not:

```
{
    'seriesId1':true,
    'seriesId2':false,
 }
```

In this example, seriesId1 is muted. seriesId2 was muted, but has been turned back on.

properties.name: hardMute
properties.description:
Allows for a "hard" muting of the series/categories: the
series/category won't show up
in the tooltip anymore, it's tooltip data won't be shown in the register
and its extents won't be taken into account by the chart

properties.name: xAxisType
properties.description:
Sets the type of data for the x values

Valid entries are:
- `ordinal`: for discrete input domains, such as names or categories.
- `scaleBand`: another ordinal type meant to create a bar instead of a point.
- `time`: for time domains.
- `timeLocal`: for local time domains.
- `linear`: for continuous input domains, such as numbers.
- `log`: for continuous input domains displayed logarithmicly. NOTE: Per d3 docs, this scale cannot cross or include 0.
- `pie`: for pie/donut charts

properties.name: yAxisType
properties.description:
Sets the type of data for the y values

Valid entries are:
- `ordinal`: for discrete input domains, such as names or categories.
- `scaleBand`: another ordinal type meant to create a bar instead of a point.
- `linear`: for continuous input domains, such as numbers.
- `log`: for continuous input domains, such as numbers.
- `pie`: for pie/donut charts
