methods.name: _truncateName
methods.description:
_truncateName takes a string and string length [optional].
Returns a truncated string with the middle replaced by an ellipsis. The ellipsis does not count towards the total character count.
Follows these truncation principles: http://www.gesdh.com/predix/product/principles/truncation/
Example: LNG_BAH_HOT_EFFECTIVENESS_CORE8 --> LNG_B...CORE8

Length cannot be less than 2 characters.
Default length is 10 characters.

If the string is less than or equal to the length or the length is invalid, returns the original string.

methods.name: _getSeriesWrapperClass
methods.description: returns the correct classes for the series based on type

methods.name: _isOfType
methods.description: tests if an item is of a type

methods.name: _getWrapperClass
methods.description: Returns the correct flex type based on the register type

methods.name: _computeConfigName
methods.description: Returns the name of the item

methods.name: _computeTruncatedName
methods.description: returns the truncated name of the item

methods.name: _computeDidTruncate
methods.description: decide if series name was truncated. If so, add a tooltip showing full name

methods.name: _computeBaseClasses
methods.description: helper function to set initial classes

methods.name: muteUnmuteSeries
methods.description: Method to mute or umute

methods.name: _computeItemMutedToStart
methods.description: returns if the series should be muted to start

methods.name: _computeItemColor
methods.description:
Function which takes an index and returns the appropriate dataVisColor

`i` is a series index number

`rgb(r,g,b)` return the appropriate rgb values based in the series index

methods.name: _computeItemDashPattern
methods.description:
Function which takes an index and returns the appropriate dash pattern

`e.g. pattern = "5,2"` return the appropriate svg stroke-dasharray value.

methods.name: _mutedToStart
methods.description:
helper function to set initial classes

Adds or removes muted class to those series in the register

methods.name: _seriesClicked
methods.description:
Event function which is fired when a series is clicked.

Adds series to mutedSeries property or toggles that key's boolean.

methods.name: _toggleSeries
methods.description:
observer function which is fired when the mutedSeries property is changed.

Adds or removes muted class to those series in the register.

methods.name: _calcDashPattern
methods.description:
Returns a striped pattern that can be used by background:linear-gradient(...) to represent a dashed vertical line.

ex:  'to bottom, red 0px, red 5px, transparent 5px, transparent 10px, [repeat]'

elements.description:
### Usage

    <px-vis-register-item-pie
        item="[[item]]"
        item-index="[[index]]"
        complete-series-config="[[completeSeriesConfig]]"
        chart-data="[[chartData]]"
        type="[[type]]"
        x-axis-type="[[xAxisType]]"
        y-axis-type="[[yAxisType]]"
        use-percentage="[[usePercentage]]">
    </px-vis-register-item-pie>

### Styling
The following custom properties are available for styling:

Custom property | Description
:----------------|:-------------
  `--px-vis-register-series-name` | The color of the data series name
  `--px-vis-register-data-value` | The color of the data series value
  `--px-vis-register-box` | The color of the box around the register when a scrollbar is present

methods.name: _truncateName
methods.description:
_truncateName takes a string and string length [optional].
Returns a truncated string with the middle replaced by an ellipsis. The ellipsis does not count towards the total character count.
Follows these truncation principles: http://www.gesdh.com/predix/product/principles/truncation/
Example: LNG_BAH_HOT_EFFECTIVENESS_CORE8 --> LNG_B...CORE8

Length cannot be less than 2 characters.
Default length is 10 characters.

If the string is less than or equal to the length or the length is invalid, returns the original string.

elements.description:
### Usage

    <px-vis-register-datetime
        first-date-time="[[_firstDateTime]]"
        second-date-time="[[_secondDateTime]]"
        separator="[[_separator]]"
        x-axis-type="[[xAxisType]]">
    </px-vis-register-datetime>


### Time, number, and name formatting
Formatting for the timestamps, the data values, and the series names can be controlled via a series of properties.
Please see the properties for configuration details.

properties.name: _firstDateTime
properties.description: Holder for the formated first datetime string

properties.name: _secondDateTime
properties.description: Holder for the formated second datetime string

properties.name: _separator
properties.description: Holder for the formated separator character

properties.name: completeSeriesConfig
properties.description: A configuration file generated by the chart behavior based on seriesConfig and defaultSeriesConfig.

attributes.name: complete-series-config
attributes.description: A configuration file generated by the chart behavior based on seriesConfig and defaultSeriesConfig.

elements.description:
### Usage

    <px-vis-register
        height="50"
        use-percentage="true"
        width="[[width]]"
        type="horizontal"
        tooltip-data=[[tooltipData]]
        chart-data=[[chartData]]
        muted-series="[[mutedSeries]]"
        complete-series-config="[[completeSeriesConfig]]"
        x-axis-type="time"
        muted-series="{{mutedSeries}}">
    </px-vis-register>


### Sending Data to the Register
tooltipData is in the form:

```
    {
        "time": "2015-03-25T20:34:47.085Z",
        "series":[{
            "name":"seriesId1",
            "coord":[xCoord1, yCoord1],  //in pixel space
            "value":{
                "x":xVal1,             //in data space
                "seriesId1":yVal1    //in data space
            }
        },{
            "name":"seriesId2",
            "coord":[xCoord2, yCoord2],  //in pixel space
            "value":{
                "x":xVal2,             //in data space
                "seriesId2":yVal2    //in data space
            },
        }],
        "mouse":[ mouseX, mouseY ],   //in pixel space
        "xArr":[xCoord1 , xCoord2],   //in pixel space
        "yArr":[yCoord1 , yCoord2],   //in pixel space
    }
```

 When not hovering on a chart, the tooltipData should still have the series names in order for them to still appear in the register. Ex:

```
    {
        "time": null,
        "series":[{
            "name":"seriesId1",
            "value": null
        },{
            "name":"seriesName1",
            "value": null
        }],
        "mouse": null,
        "xArr": null,
        "yArr": null
    }
```

### Reporting Data from the Register
The component returns an object via mutedSeries which the chart can take and react to:

    {
        'seriesId1':true,
        'seriesId2':false,
    }

### Time, number, and name formatting
Formatting for the timestamps, the data values, and the series names can be controlled via a series of properties. Please see the properties for configuration details.

### Styling
The following custom properties are available for styling:

Custom property | Description
:----------------|:-------------
  `--px-register-series-marker-width` | The width (thickness) of the series marker
  `--px-vis-register-series-name` | The color of the data series name
  `--px-vis-register-data-value` | The color of the data series value
  `--px-vis-register-box` | The color of the box around the register when a scrollbar is present
  `--px-vis-register-border-color` | The color of the outside border for the register
  `--px-vis-register-font-size` | font size for the register

properties.description: Defines a separator character between the two datetime strings.

properties.name: timezone
properties.description:
Sets what timezone the event time should display in.

Timezone defaults to UTC time. If a valid timezone is specified, then times include daylight savings time if applicable.

For a list of valid timezones, see: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_tz_database_time_zones

For more details on timezones, see: http://momentjs.com/timezone/

properties.name: mutedSeries
properties.description:
A list of user selected muted series. Tied declaratively to series components

The series name is the key and the value is a boolean for whether it is muted or not:

```
{
    'seriesId1':true,
    'seriesId2':false,
 }
```

In this example, seriesId1 is muted. seriesId2 was muted, but has been turned back on.

series/category won't show up
in the tooltip anymore, it's tooltip data won't be shown in the register
and its extents won't be taken into account by the chart

- `timeLocal`: for local time domains.
- `linear`: for continuous input domains, such as numbers.
- `log`: for continuous input domains displayed logarithmicly. NOTE: Per d3 docs, this scale cannot cross or include 0.
- `pie`: for pie/donut charts

attributes.name: y-axis-type
attributes.description:
Sets the type of data for the y values

Valid entries are:
- `ordinal`: for discrete input domains, such as names or categories.
- `scaleBand`: another ordinal type meant to create a bar instead of a point.
- `linear`: for continuous input domains, such as numbers.
- `log`: for continuous input domains, such as numbers.
- `pie`: for pie/donut charts

attributes.name: use-percentage
attributes.description: For pie charts whether the values should be displayed in %

attributes.name: force-date-time-display
attributes.description: Forces the use of the timestamp at the top

attributes.name: dynamic-menu-config
type
attributes.description: Defines if the register should be `horizontal` or `vertical`.

attributes.name: prevent-min-size
attributes.description: Prevents the register from having a minimum size.

attributes.name: prevent-muting
attributes.description: Prevents the mute on-click behavior.

attributes.name: inert-register
attributes.description: If inert, the register won't process any new data coming in. Useful when the register is hidden.

attributes.name: sort-config
sort-descending
attributes.description:
Set to true to reverse the current sorting algorithm. Can be changed
by the end user by clicking on the arrow next to the sorting options

elements.description:
### Usage

    <px-vis-tooltip
        hover-target=[[mouseRect]]
        mouse-position="[[mousePosition]]"
        width="250"
        margin="[[margin]]"
        chart-data="[[chartData]]"
        tooltip-data="[[tooltipData]]"
        complete-series-config="[[completeSeriesConfig]]"
        x-axis-type="time"
        tooltip-style="light"
        muted-series="[[mutedSeries]]">
    </px-vis-tooltip>

### Styling
The following custom properties are available for styling:

Custom property | Description
:----------------|:-------------
  `--px-vis-register-series-name` | The color of the data series name
  `--px-vis-register-data-value` | The color of the data series value
  `--px-vis-register-box` | The color of the box around the register when a scrollbar is present
  |
  |
  |
  `--px-tooltip-background-color` | The color of the tooltip
  `--px-tooltip-text-color` | The color of the tooltip text
  `--px-tooltip-light-background-color` | The color of the light version tooltip
  `--px-tooltip-light-text-color` | The color of the light version tooltip text
  `--px-tooltip-light-border-color`| The color of the light version tooltip border

properties.name: chartData
properties.description:
container for the data object that drives the chart / component
Generally loaded with an iron-ajax tag (but doesnt have to be)
This can be set declaratively

properties.name: tooltipData
defaultEmptyData
properties.description: The "empty" dataset that should be used for tooltipData when not hovering

properties.name: xAxisType
properties.description:
Sets the type of data for the x values

Valid entries are:
- `ordinal`: for discrete input domains, such as names or categories.
- `scaleBand`: another ordinal type meant to create a bar instead of a point.
- `time`: for time domains.
- `timeLocal`: for local time domains.
- `linear`: for continuous input domains, such as numbers.
- `log`: for continuous input domains displayed logarithmicly. NOTE: Per d3 docs, this scale cannot cross or include 0.
- `pie`: for pie/donut charts

properties.name: yAxisType
properties.description:
Sets the type of data for the y values

Valid entries are:
- `ordinal`: for discrete input domains, such as names or categories.
- `scaleBand`: another ordinal type meant to create a bar instead of a point.
- `linear`: for continuous input domains, such as numbers.
- `log`: for continuous input domains, such as numbers.
- `pie`: for pie/donut charts

properties.name: completeSeriesConfig
properties.description: A configuration file generated by the chart behavior based on seriesConfig and defaultSeriesConfig.

properties.name: mutedSeries
properties.description:
A list of user selected muted series. Tied declaratively to series components

The series name is the key and the value is a boolean for whether it is muted or not:

```
{
    'seriesId1':true,
    'seriesId2':false,
 }
```

In this example, seriesId1 is muted. seriesId2 was muted, but has been turned back on.

properties.name: hardMute
properties.description:
Allows for a "hard" muting of the series/categories: the
series/category won't show up
in the tooltip anymore, it's tooltip data won't be shown in the register
and its extents won't be taken into account by the chart

properties.name: seriesKeys
properties.description: Representes the keys avaiable in completeSeriesConfig.

properties.name: truncationLength
properties.description:
Defines if the label should get truncated and to how many characters.

Default length is 10 characters, not including the ellipsis which gets inserted.

The length must be at least 2.

To disable truncation, set the value to -1

properties.name: numberFormatCulture
properties.description:
Defines how a display number should be formatted:
Provide localization for currency formatting

For valid formats and features, see: http://numbrojs.com/languages.html
For docs on the component, see: https://www.predix-ui.com/#/components/px-number-formatter/

properties.name: numberFormatIsCurrency
properties.description:
Defines how a display number should be formatted:
Specify whether the value should be formatted as a currency

For valid formats and features, see: http://numbrojs.com/format.html
For docs on the component, see: https://www.predix-ui.com/#/components/px-number-formatter/

properties.name: numberFormatCurrency
properties.description:
Defines how a display number should be formatted:
Provide a new default format for currency

For valid formats and features, see: http://numbrojs.com/format.html
For docs on the component, see: https://www.predix-ui.com/#/components/px-number-formatter/

properties.name: numberFormatDefault
properties.description:
Defines how a display number should be formatted:
Provides a new default format

For valid formats and features, see: http://numbrojs.com/format.html
For docs on the component, see: https://www.predix-ui.com/#/components/px-number-formatter/

properties.name: numberFormat
properties.description:
Defines how a display number should be formatted:
The format used to generate the output

For valid formats and features, see: http://numbrojs.com/format.html
For docs on the component, see: https://www.predix-ui.com/#/components/px-number-formatter/

properties.name: numberFormatUnformat
properties.description:
Defines how a display number should be converted back to a Number:
A formatted String to extract a value from

For valid formats and features, see: http://numbrojs.com/format.html#unformat
For docs on the component, see: https://www.predix-ui.com/#/components/px-number-formatter/

properties.name: numberFormatZero
properties.description:
Defines how to display 0 values

For valid formats and features, see: http://numbrojs.com/format.html
For docs on the component, see: https://www.predix-ui.com/#/components/px-number-formatter/

properties.name: firstDateTimeFormat
properties.description:
Defines the format for the first datetime string. The first datetime is shown in normal font weight.

Default is the first datetime string is TIME presented as "15:00:00 +0000"

For valid string formats, see: http://momentjs.com/docs/#/displaying/

properties.name: secondDateTimeFormat
properties.description:
Defines the format for the second datetime string. The second datetime is shown in bold font weight.

Default is the second datetime string is DATE presented as "12 Feb 2016"

For valid string formats, see: http://momentjs.com/docs/#/displaying/

properties.name: separator
properties.description: Defines a separator character between the two datetime strings.

properties.name: timezone
properties.description:
Sets what timezone the event time should display in.

Timezone defaults to UTC time. If a valid timezone is specified, then times include daylight savings time if applicable.

For a list of valid timezones, see: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_tz_database_time_zones

For more details on timezones, see: http://momentjs.com/timezone/

properties.name: forceDateTimeDisplay
properties.description: Forces the use of the timestamp at the top

properties.name: hoverTarget
properties.description:
The DOM element over which the tooltip should be shown.
Generally some <g> or <rect> element on the svg.

properties.name: mousePosition
properties.description:
The x,y screen position where you want the tooltip to be displayed.
Can be the mouse position; can also be any arbitrary screen position.

properties.name: tooltipStyle
properties.description:
Tooltip style supports two values:
- `light` : gives the tooltip a white background
- `dark`  : gives the tooltip a black background (default)

properties.name: orientation
properties.description: Orientation for the tooltip.

properties.name: hide
properties.description: Whether to hide the tooltip.

methods.name: _isValidData
methods.description: returns true if the data is valid: non NaN, null or undefined

methods.name: _isDataNotNull
methods.description: returns true if the data is not null

methods.name: _truncateName
methods.description:
_truncateName takes a string and string length [optional].
Returns a truncated string with the middle replaced by an ellipsis. The ellipsis does not count towards the total character count.
Follows these truncation principles: http://www.gesdh.com/predix/product/principles/truncation/
Example: LNG_BAH_HOT_EFFECTIVENESS_CORE8 --> LNG_B...CORE8

Length cannot be less than 2 characters.
Default length is 10 characters.

If the string is less than or equal to the length or the length is invalid, returns the original string.

methods.name: formatTimestamp
methods.description: Method that takes a datetime string, timezone string, and a formatting string. Returns a formated datetime string.

methods.name: _isObjEmpty
methods.description: Checks to see if an object is empty

methods.name: _isD3Empty
methods.description: Checks to see if an d3 obj is empty

methods.name: _doesD3HaveValues
methods.description: Checks to see if an d3 obj has something

methods.name: _doesObjHaveValues
methods.description: Checks to see if an object has values

methods.name: _isVarDefined
methods.description: Checks to see if an object is defined

methods.name: _isVarUndefined
methods.description: Checks to see if an object is defined

methods.name: _escapeCssSelector
methods.description: escapes '.' in css selectors so that we can appropriately select stuff with dots in thei ids

methods.name: _checkThemeVariable
methods.description: Checks if a theme variable exists, if so, returns the theme value, if not, returns the default

methods.name: _hexToRgb
methods.description: converts a hex to rgb color

methods.name: _binarySearch
methods.description: Binary search through sorted chartData

methods.name: _fuzzyBinarySearch
methods.description: Binary search through sorted chartData returning all vals within a window

methods.name: clone
methods.description: deep-copy object into newObject

methods.name: forceShow
methods.description: Forces the tooltip to show by calling _show on px-tooltip.

methods.name: forceHide
methods.description: Forces the tooltip to hide by calling _hide on px-tooltip.
